loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin P., 45 years old, is from the town of Banga. He is married and has a 26-year-old child. To make a living, Edwin owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Edwin has been engaged in his business for over 22 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

Edwin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwin is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edwin from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy candy, sodas, canned products, juices, meat, poultry, bread and other products to improve sales

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia A. is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by running a general store. She lives in San Roque, Brgy. Baod, Bantayan, Cebu City with her husband, Roger, who is 44 years old and a fisherman, together with their three children who are between 9 and 13 years old, all currently going to school. Delia has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and by her own efforts. By working hard in her store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Delia is borrowing 28,000 PHP to use as additional working capital for her general store. This will be her tenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Delia hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan H., 43, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known as the most favorite tourist place in the country. H. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns an income of USD 3.50 per day.

H. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase cows to help plow the rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. H.'s husband appears in the photograph because H. is not available.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Cheth

texts.en:
Cheth M. is 45 years of age and a married woman. In order to meet the needs of her family, Cheth M. sells some supplies for students inside a local school located near her house. She has had experience in this sector for nine years and is earning approximately $6 per day.

To help contribute to her family, her husband works as a teacher in the secondary school (he appears in the photo). This couple have been married for years and they have four children, three of whom are now married and the other is single.

In order to reduce her transportation costs, Cheth M. is applying for a loan to buy a used motorbike that she will use to either transport her inventory or to travel anywhere.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Restocking vegetables on a regular basis

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a resident of Riwind city, which is located near Lahore. This city is famous for its dairy and agriculture industries. She is 27 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a three-room brick house. She has been living in this city from a young age.
 
Her husband's name is F. H. and he works as a government employee. Sughran supports her family financially by operating a grocery shop adjacent to her home. She started this business six years ago and it is working well now. 

She has two sons and a daughter and all of them are getting an education. Sughran and her husband make the best efforts to be able to afford the education expenses of their kids so they never face the same destiny that they faced in their early age. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her grocery shop. With the loan amount, she will buy daily-use items like bath soaps, rice, cooking oil, lentils and spices for her shop. She hopes that her investment in the business will prove to be a productive one and it will make a good return for her. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her sixth loan cycle. In previous loan years, she proved herself to be a responsible client who always paid installments on time and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Shaidullo

texts.en: K. Shaidullo is 50 years old, is married, and is the father of seven children. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults, thanks to his example. Shaidullo is an enterprising man who constantly tries to do things better and to improve, day after day. He works hard in his fields where he spends as much time as possible providing the necessary care, fertilizing his land and spraying to prevent diseases that might affect his yield. Shaidullo needs seeds and fertilizers to continue his difficult work, tending his crops so that they can be taken to the capital for sale. That's why he's applying for a loan of 6,000 Somoni. Let's be the ones who reach out our hands to help Shaidullo. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Voskehat

texts.en: Voskehat B. is married and a proud mother of 4 children. The family lives in Talin, Aragatsotn region of Armenia. The family’s main income comes from the agriculture. Together with her husband, Voskehat grows wheat on 2 ha of land. The family has a cattle farm too. Voskehat is preparing her household for the winter. She has applied for this loan to buy cattle feed.

loans.use: To purchase cattle feed.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This anonymous Lebanese Kiva borrower is 36 years old and married with two young children. For the past five years, she has been running a clothing store that also sells perfume. Her business income is vital to support her husband and pay school fees for her children. She has obtained a previous loan through Kiva and she is very thankful for her decision. Now she is requesting a new larger $2,000 loan through Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory. This loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she hopes to sell shoes in addition to clothes at her store.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Sem Chansok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people make up a village bank loan located in Tuol Tnaot village in Kandal province and have selected Mrs. Sem C., born in 1979. as the village bank president. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes which can improve their families' living conditions. 

Mrs. Sem C. is a married woman who has three children, one of whom is enrolled in a local school, while the others are too young to work or study. She is a Khmer cake maker who can earn some money in this way to support her family. Since her business is presently going well,  she wants to expand. So, to meet this goal, Mrs. Sem C. is applying for a loan to buy more corn, coconuts, sugar, and rice to make Khmer cake to sell. Her husband, Mr. Sokorn Suon, is a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn some money to support his family, too.

loans.use: To buy more corn, coconuts, sugar, and rice to make Khmer cake to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. is 47 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Poblacion, a part of the municipality of Kadingilan, Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Jocelyn operates a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she buys and sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, biscuits and snacks to the local community. Jocelyn has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan, her fourth from HSPFI, of 14,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Fernando; el tiene 49 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de librería el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa siendo su horario desde las 09:00am hasta las 08:00pm todos los días. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio como cuadernos lapiceros,plumones,papel entre otros.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "My Peru". The bank is located in the district, province, and region of Cusco.

His name is Fernando. He is 49 years old, he is married, and he has 2 children. He balances his every day chores with his office supply store business. He works together with is wife from 9 am to 8 pm every day. 

He requires a loan to supply his business with notebooks, pencils, pens, paper etc.

He is grateful to all those who have contributed to his dream and he is committed to the payment terms established for his loan.

loans.use: To purchase office supplies.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 46 años, convive con Yolanda, de 36 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Hugo, de 16 y Yordan, de 9 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. La siembra de tubérculos como; papa, olluco y oca, es su principal actividad económica; ya que desde niño creció entre la vegetación y los terrenos agrícolas, ya desde que formó su propia familia, comenzó a sembrar en terrenos alquilados, pero gracias a la dedicación que brinda a sus sembríos los que cultiva y cuida constantemente. Consigue vender sus cosechas, en el mercado central de su ciudad, obteniendo buenas ganancias; los que hicieron que ahora obtuviera sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Por todo lo que avanzó, Juan; desea mejorar la construcción de su casa, para darles una excelente calidad de vida a sus hijos. Esté es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y como socio de su banco comunal, se siente agradecido por el apoyo constante, que recibe por parte de sus integrantes. Con el monto que solicita comprará 5 sacos de abono orgánico, lo que esparcirá en sus sembríos de papa, que en estos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Juan is 46 years old and shares a home with 36 year old Yolanda.  Together they have two sons, 16 year old Hugo, and 9 year old Yordan.  They live as a family in their own home, located in the Ricrican neighborhood.  He raises tubers, such as potatoes, olluco, and oca.  As a child, he grew up around vegetation and farmland and now it's his primary economic activity.  When he started his family he began planting on leased land, but thanks to his dedication to his crops, which he constantly cares for, he sells his harvest in the city market, where he makes good earnings, which allowed him to buy his own farmland.

Juan wants to improve the construction of his home, so that he can give his children an excellent quality of life.  This will be his fourth loan through MFP, and as a member of his communal bank.  He is grateful for the constant support he gets from his fellow members.  He will use the money from this loan to buy five bags of organic fertilizer, which he will spread on the potato crop that he will harvest in the coming months.

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose, 63 years old, is from the town of Banga. He is engaged in farming. He plants and harvests rice and corn crops. He sells his harvest at the market and with what he earns, he provides for his family's needs. Jose hopes to improve his business and earn better. He wants to improve his family's living conditions.

Jose needs seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000, which he will use to buy what he needs for the farm. Jose is hopeful that this loan will help him improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tierras de cultivo, la socia cultiva papa y maíz y luego lo vende en los diferentes lugares como en mercados y ferias, la socia quiere mejorar las tierras de cultivos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.       
              
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Madres Trabajadoras Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Francisca is 51 years old, married, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her work in farming. She grows potatoes and corn and then sells them at different places such as markets and street markets. She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her croplands.

Francisca is happy because of the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for her croplands

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan E. is from the village of Bayombong in Nueva Vizcaya. He is 35 years old. Jonathan is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jonathan owns & operates a jeepney transport service. Jonathan has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Jonathan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonathan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to repair his vehicle for better service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jonathan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair vehicle

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol is a 27-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating two businesses: Barbecue/Food vending and "Balot" (fertilized duck eggs) vending. Carol joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carol has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 which she added to her own capital helped her earn a monthly income of PHP 8000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital to save up for the future security of her family and to continue growing her business. She plans to improve her food vending business and engage in personal products direct selling business. Carol is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Celestine Nzasu

texts.en:
Celestine Nzasu N. has been selling second-hand clothes in Tala Kangundo for one year, earning a monthly profit of KES.12,000. She is 31 years old, married to N., and they have five school-going children.

Celestine, who has never borrowed from any other MFI, is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to it by a registered group member. She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy more used clothes to sell.  Celestine intends to save some of the anticipated profit and pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her  business and in the future become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a stock of used clothes for her business

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtsetseg is 47 years old, and lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a rented flat. Her only son Davgaragchaa, 16, studies in secondary school. Munkhtsetseg used to work as a nurse in the hospital but lost her job due to job cuts in the late 90s.

She started running an office supply retail business at an outdoor market. She rents two separate stalls in the market and now she wants to extend her business by renting one more stall. She is one of our VIP clients and each time we do the loan assessment we see that her business is growing steadily. She employs two salespersons as well. The loan she is taking will be used to buy more stationery and office supply to sell at the third stall.

loans.use: to buy more stationery and office supplies to sell on the third stall.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita F. is 57 years old, married, and has four children ranging in age from 18 to 31.  Anita is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. She grows rice and corn to sell. She also makes chorizo that she sells in her neighborhood. Anita works hard to sustain her family and her children's education. She wants them to be successful.  Anita's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Hector Alonso

texts.es:
Hector se siente orgullosos de ser campesino, pues el campo le ha permitido cultivar las lechugas que hoy en día son su fuente de sustento, pues la falta de oportunidades laborales y la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de la familia, lo impulsaron para inventarse la vida como él mismo lo dice. 

Desde hace un año, Hector cultiva las lechugas en su pedacito de tierra, actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas que le permitan mejorar su producción para sacar un producto de buena calidad que lo posicione en el mercado y le permita incrementar sus ventas para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hector is proud to be a farmer. The land has helped him cultivate lettuce and today that is his source of support. There is a lack of work opportunities and the need to cover his family’s expenses motivated him to invent himself a living, as he says. 

For the past year, Hector has cultivated lettuce on a small plot of land. He needs a loan to purchase agricultural materials that will help him improve production and to have good quality produce to sell in the markets. This will increase his sales and it will help improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural materials

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas de 36 años, empezó con esta actividad  con una tienda porque en su sector no había  y como el tenia conocimientos empezó con poca mercadería y fue creciendo poco a poco.

El labora todos los días desde la 8H00 am a 20H00 pm. Con EL préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite para aumentar sus ingresos. Ella anhela adecuar su casa hacer un segundo piso y surtir mas su negocio y terminar de ayudar a su hijo en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 36 years old and he set up a store in an area where there were no stores. He had some experience and he started with a small inventory but he gradually expanded.

He works every day from 8am to 10 pm. With the loan he wants to purchase rice, sugar, and cooking oil to increase his income. His goal is to improve his house with the addition of a second floor and to add more inventory to his business. He also wants to help his son complete his studies.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason M. is a farmer in Nkubu producing maize, beans, wheat, potatoes, and milk.  He has been a farmer for the last 15 years. He is married and has three adult children. He earns additional income from a cereals business he runs in the local market.

Jason is requesting a loan for 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase seeds and expand his farm acreage for maize, beans, and wheat.This is Jason's second loan with Juhudi Kilimo . He says this will go well with his cereals business as he will be selling his own produce rather than sourcing from other farmers. This, in turn, will give him better margins for the cereals business and enable him to adequately provide for his family. He is focusing on having buying a vehicle to supply his cereals beyond the local market. Jason mentions poor market prices and pests as the main challenges to his business. He remains glad Juhudi Kilimo provides small farmers with loans.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and expand his farm acreage

loans.name: Norly

texts.en:
For Norly, 54, being successful translates into being full. This is true for her both in her business, family life, and Christian ministry. Norly gives her fullest to achieve success in her business, even as she actively participates in the weekly Bible fellowships and entrepreneurial activities in CCT*. Norly remains single. She resides in Pasay City with the family she has grown up with.

Norly manages a “sari-sari” store into which she pours out her focus. She has this little space adjacent to their home where she displays her products, ranging from eggs to detergents to soft drinks—anything her valued customers would need. She sells a lot in her community, being able to come up with PHP18,000 net income per month. Norly has managed to run the business alone for ten years now.

In order to give more and more of her potential towards improving her store, Norly has to outsource more finances to back up her funds. She then decided to loan PHP12, 000 with the help of CCT. With these new funds, she intends to purchase more goods for her store. This will include cases of soft drinks, boxes of canned goods, and sachets of detergents and fabric conditioners. It is important for Norly that her shelves are full of products, as these will attract more customers to her store and still retain the regular ones. Because of the loan, she is able to sustain her business and make sure that she does not run out of products to sell. The loan enables her to buy the things she needs to sustain her lifestyle.

One challenge Norly faces, which is common to running sari-sari stores, is following up the debts of regular customers. Also, it is a struggle for her whenever she gets sick and weak, to run the store. But it is her goal to turn the store into a grocery. It is going to take her full effort to make it happen. 

Norly also desires to give her full commitment to the Christian ministry, where she belongs, and it has become of great help to her family. Included in her goals list are an owned house and a transportation vehicle for her business.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
Félix, habita en la comarca el Rosario, localizada en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, tiene 41 años de edad, de oficio agricultor, tiene tres hijos. El comenzó trabajando desde temprana edad con su papa de el aprendió todo lo que sabe acerca de siembra de granos básicos y hortalizas. Posteriormente emigro a Costa Rica a trabajar durante 8 años ahorro y con eso fue que compro su finca, mejoro su casa, trabajo muy duro para poder comprar su vehículo el cual utiliza para transportar su cultivo. Además tiene una pulpería en su hogar la cual le ayuda su esposa a atender la venta. 
El solicito el préstamo para sembrar frijol, comprar insumos, abono y pagar mano de obra. Con esta inversión espera mejorar la producción, elevar el rendimiento  y así obtener alta productividad.   
El desea seguir sembrando, espera en lo futuro comprar mas tierra para cultivar, darle un mejor futuros a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Félix lives in El Rosario region, in Pueblo Nuevo - a town in Estelí.  He is 41 years old and a farmer.  He has three children.

Félix started working from an early age together with his dad, from whom he learned everything that he knows about growing basic grains and vegetables.

Félix emigrated to Costa Rica to work for eight years.  He saved up and used this money to buy his farm and improve his home.  He worked very hard to buy his vehicle which he uses to transport his crops.

Félix also has a grocery store in his home where his wife helps serve.  He is requesting this loan so that he can sow beans, buy supplies and fertilizer, and pay laborers.  With this investment, he hopes to improve his production, increase his yield and thereby achieve high productivity.

Félix would like to continue growing crops.  He hopes, in the future, to buy more land to farm and to provide his children with a better future.

loans.use: to grow beans, to buy supplies and fertilizers, and to pay laborers

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y  tiene dos hijos.  Tiene estudios hasta el cuarto de secundaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace más de un año, su préstamo anterior que fue por S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de carnes de cordero y alpaca.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará seis degollados de cordero.  Lla señora trabaja sola en el negocio y realiza sus ventas en el mercado de Ilave.
Su sueño es tener más capital y tener otro negocio como venta de celulares.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la alegría de las socias y la ganancia de los ahorros.
texts.en:
Agripina is a member of the communal bank, “San Miguel Arcángel II,” which is located in the district of Llave, in the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno.  She is 34, is a single mother, and has two children.  She completed through the fourth year of secondary school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for more than a year.  Her previous loan was for 500 PEN, which she invested in her business of buying and selling lamb and alpaca meat.

With this new loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy six prepared lambs.  She works alone in her business and makes her sales in the market in Llave.

Her dream is to have more capital and to have another business selling cell phones.  What she likes most about her communal bank is the happiness of the members and saving money.

loans.use: to buy six prepared lambs

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora tiene 46 años, ella es de la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy alegre y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rolando y su querido hijo menor Gerardo de 22 años a quienes quiere  mucho. El negocio al que se dedica Nora son los tejidos artesanales, tiene su puesto de venta en el centro artesanal del poblado de San Pedro de Cajas, en el cual vende las prendas que ella misma confecciona y que son rápidamente compradas por sus clientes, ya que los modelos que hace son muy novedosos. Además de surtir los mismos con variedades de telares y tapices de otros artesanos de la zona. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y desarrollar su creatividad, lleva 7 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder salir, pero eso no la desanima ya que sabe que tiene que vender lo más rápido para poder cada 20 días darse un tiempo. Ya que su esposo llega de la mina donde trabaja y juntos comparten la mayor parte de su tiempo. Asimismo se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando papa una vez al año. Por todos los objetivos que está alcanzando, espera con el tiempo poner una tienda más grande, donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de ser uno socia muy cumplida y puntual con sus cuotas. Nora de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias madejas de lana de carnero y alpaca para continuar con sus tejidos.
texts.en:
Nora is 46 years old and from the town of San Pedro de Cajas.  She is noted as being a very cheerful and sincere woman.  She lives in her own home together with her husband Rolando and her youngest son, 22 year-old Gerardo, who she loves very much.

Nora's business is weaving handicrafts.  She has a sales stall in the craft center in San Pedro de Cajas.  This is where she sells the items that she makes and they are bought very quickly by her customers since the designs that she makes are very original.  She also stocks her business with a variety of loom-produced crafts and tapestries from other craftspeople in her area.

What Nora most enjoys about her work is weaving and developing her creativity.  She has been in this business for seven years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to spend the whole day on her sales stall without being able to go out.  However, this does not discourage her since she knows that she has to sell her products as quickly as she can so that she can take some time out every 20 days as her husband arrives home from the mine where he works and they are able to share most of their time together.

Nora also farms.  She grows potatoes once a year.  With all the goals that she is achieving, over time Nora hopes to be able to set up a larger store where she can serve her customers more comfortably.  She is a member of the "Mujeres al Futuro" community bank and this is her seventh loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  She is very punctual in making her loan repayments.  With your support, Nora will invest the money that she has requested in buying several skeins of ram's wool and alpaca wool so that she can continue weaving her products.

loans.use: to buy ram's wool and alpaca wool

loans.name: Sypros

texts.en:
Sypros, 32 years old and married to George, has been operating her general store for the past eight years, earning a monthly income of about KES 20,000 which she uses to take care of her business and family.

With a loan of KES 25,000 from KADET LTD. Sypros intends to purchase more stock including sugar, wheat flour, rice in bulk, maize flour in bulk, etc., and plans to use the anticipated profits to open another shop. In the future, she hopes to open a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as sugar, wheat flour, rice in bulk, maize flour in bulk, etc.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 23-year-old single man who works as a driver for a car rental company in order to cover his university and personal expenses. Mohamad is a man with good reputation, recommended to deal with by most of his instructors and bosses. 

Mohamad is a hardworking man. He works hard to finish his education and search for a suitable long-term job that fits his chosen career. 

Mohamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for the first time to pay for his last semester at the university. He will graduate soon and start his official career, the one he's been working hard for the past couple of years to reach. He hopes he can keep his parents proud of him and fulfill his desires.

loans.use: To pay for his university education fees

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man with 2 children aged five years old and three year old. He runs a shoe sales business. He has been in this business for three years now and says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints.

He is using his loan of 20,000 KES to buy more shoes to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. In future, he hopes to become a wholesaler. He describes himself as a very ambitious man.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with three children, two boys and one girl. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a curio shop business, hawking along the street, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of competition and high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sculptures for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sculptures for resale.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Josefa; tiene 47 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 3 hijos de 23, 21, 20 años de edad;  La socia es comerciante minorista, la socia compra animales menores como cuyes, chanchos, aves de corral,  los cuales los engorda, procrean y los vende, ella tiene a sus gallinas ya listas para la venta son 60  gallinas que deben ser vendidas en el transcurso de esta semana, por lo que necesitara la compra de nuevas aves de corral en un numero de 100 y también comprara cuyes, la socia requiere comprar 100 cuyes también para la crianza, reproducción si se da satisfactoriamente y la venta final. La socia desea tener en un futuro cercano su granja de animales menores.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes y pollos.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Josefa is a member of the Communal Bank “Solidaridad-Cachimayo” which is located in the District of Cachimayo, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 47 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 23, 21, and 20). Josefa is a small merchant who buys domesticated animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens for fattening, breeding, and resale. She prepares her chickens for sale and sell as many as 60 over the course of a week. For this reason, she needs to acquire 100 new birds and also buy guinea pigs. Josefa is looking to buy 100 guinea pigs to raise and successfully breed so that they can be eventually sold. In the near future, she hopes to have a farm for her animals. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of guinea pigs and chickens.

Josefa is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Mary Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Mary es socia del banco comunal San Fernando II del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 55 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, dos mayores D. edad.
Se dedica a la confección D. ropa interior para niños porque es lo más solicitado entre sus clientela, son años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos y todos sus préstamos los invierte comprando los materiales que necesita para trabajar y elaborar diferentes modelos.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 kilos D. tela, 5 kilos D. tela algodón, 2 conos D. elásticos, 3 rollitos D. cinta satinada, 1 cono D. blondas D. un centímetro.
Son materiales que utiliza en cada una D. sus prendas para dar mejor acabado, todo el trabajo lo realiza en su casa por las tardes y parte D. la noche cuando tiene que entregar sus pedidos, su último hijo todavía está en edad escolar y necesita el apoyo D. sus padres, su esposo es profesor jubilado y recibe una mensualidad con el cual mantiene su hogar.
Los años que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos ha servido para implementar su negocio y poder trabajar para generar sus propios ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mary is a member of the communal bank San Fernando II of the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali.  She is 55, married and has three children, two of whom are adults.

She is a seamstress who makes children's underwear which is what is in most demand from her customers.  For several years she has worked with Manuela Ramos and all of her loans have been invested in materials to make the different products she sews.

With the new loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN she will buy 5 kilos of fabric, 5 kilos of cotton, 2 cones of elastic, 3 rolls of satin ribbon and one cone of 1 cm lace.  These are the materials she uses on the garments to give them a better finish.  She does all the work at home in the afternoons and part of the evenings when she delivers the orders.  

Her youngest son is still in school and needs his parents' support.  Her husband is a retired teacher and receives a monthly pension to cover household expenses.

The years she has worked with Manuela Ramos have been useful in setting up her business in order to generate her own income and help the family.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, cotton and elastic.

loans.name: Dusangirimirimo Group

texts.fr:
Philémon   fait partie du groupe Dusangirimirimo. Le nom du groupe signifie « Partager le travail». Il a 45 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 3 à 19 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  8 ans de primaire.

Philémon est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilisation des fertilisants. Dans les prochaines années, Philémon voudrait agrandir la surface à cultiver le riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Philémon is part of the group Dusangirimirimo. The group's name means "Share the Work". He is 45 years old and married, and he has six children, from 3 to 19 years old. Four of the children are in school. He has an 8th grade education. 

Philémon is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his first one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy some chemical fertilizers for his rice farm. 

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use fertilizers. In the next few years, Philémon would like to expand his arable land for growing rice. With the profits, he plans on educating his children and taking care of them.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for rice farming

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 47 years old, married and blessed with three school-aged children.  To make a living, he has been growing corn for almost fifteen years.  He earnt 35,000 Phillipine pesos (PHP) at the last cropping.  He is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm business.  He is determined to work hard to supplement his family's daily needs.  He hopes that Kiva will continue to give him financial assistance to improve his family's status in life.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm business.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura is married with three children. She is 50 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Laura owns and operates a general store, selling food and daily use products in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than 20 years and earns PHP 20,000 per month. Laura requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional products to sell. Laura has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for more than three years and this will be her eighth loan cycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business and finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Odilia Isabel

texts.es:
Odilia Isabel, es soltera, tiene 24 años de edad, estudio bachillerato, se dedica a la costura de delantales típicos, inició este trabajo como operaria para otro negocio y con el negocio que tiene  lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Solicita un prestamos para la compra de telas típicas y producir delantales y mejorar sus ganancias, espera que su negocios pueda crecer en el futuro.
texts.en:
Odilia Isabel is 24 years old, single, and finished high school.  Her business is sewing traditional aprons.  She started out in this line of work working as a laborer in another business.  She has three years experience in her business.  

Odilia Isabel is requesting a loan to buy traditional fabrics so that she can make aprons and improve her profits.  She hopes that her business will grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Saidia Shg Group

texts.en:
Mildred is the facilitator of the Saidia SHG group. Mildred and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mildred takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to grow quality farm produce and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mildred had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mildred was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mildred and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from her maize sales, Mildred will educate her children and invest in business and livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Saidia SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Mildred is pictured with her group members. Standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
Lydia's group comprises three hard-working women. Lydia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. For the past two years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells mobile phones. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy mobile phones for resale and will help Lydia to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Lydia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has improved Lydia's prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones for resale.

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en: Knarik is a young entrepreneur from Yerevan. She buys flowers, designs bouquets, and sells them. To meet the rising demand, Knarik needs to purchase more flowers. With the loan's help Knarik will expand her business and get more income. This will allow her to to increase the variety of her services and develop the business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for flowers

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 24 years old and married to Rosemary. They have one child. He has been in the welding business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 11,500.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 20,000, He will use the funds to purchase more stock of welding rods and metal bars .With the anticipated profits, he will save to improve his living standards.

His hopes and dreams are to have a stable business (self-sustaining) and provide the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase welding rods and metal bars

loans.name: Super Femmes 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SUPER FEMMES 2 est composé de neuf personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mahougnon Ida est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo a très peu fréquenté l’école. Mahougnon Ida est âgée de 43 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Le couple a un enfant, qui n'est pas encore scolarisé et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par la bénéficiaire. Pour cette raison, Mahougnon Ida vend depuis vingt-ans de l’huile a moteur à son domicile. Mahougnon Ida s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Mahougnon Ida ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, sollicite un premier crédit.

loans.use: Acheter de l’huile a moteur.

loans.name: Gultakin

texts.en:
Gultakin was born in 1970 in Kalbacar region Chaykand village. She is married and has three children. She has been engaged in cookery at home, but her husband sells the building materials in Khirdalan stone market.
She is a well known cook in Khirdalan town where she was settled after displacing from her homeland. All praise her sweets in Khirdalan. 
She cooks our national sweets such as pakhlava, shakarbura, shorkogal and etc. The first borrowed loan  was $400. She spent this loan on buying  a small oven, but this oven was not comfortable for the cooking of the sweets and she decided to apply for the second time for a loan amount of $800.
She wants to buy the big oven and the building materials for her husband. 
She has been engaged in this business for a year. She plans to improve her business  and help to the business of her husband.

loans.use: To buy the big oven

loans.name: Kebadio

texts.en: Kebadio is married and has nine children. She is among the oldest women in Hope’s Microfinance program in the Democratic Republic of Congo, but still strong, bright, and doing well with her business. She was born on December 25, 1945, and started her business in 1961 by selling corn from the fields. Kebadio is requesting US$900. She wants to expand her business and provide much better service to her community. She intends to double the variety of beverages offered from 10 to 20, and to purchase a large stock of rice, beans, sugar, milk and basic foods that are in high demand from her clientele. Kebadio's long-term plan is to purchase a plot of land where she could build a store.

loans.use: Food sales such as fish, beans, rice, sugar, salt, milk, canned food and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in New Products

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is uneducated and a widow. Her husband died during the war in Kabul. She is still supporting her family. She is a seamstress. She wants to expand her business so she wants to take a group loan to buy new sewing machines so that she can support her family and enroll her children in a better school. She is happy about this loan.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok P., 27, lives with her husband and one little child in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She and her husband work on their plot of land raising pigs, grinding mill and selling rice to the people in their area. Together they earn approximately $6 each day. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to transport their rice crops and the remainder of the money is to be used to buy additional ten pigs and feed for their livestock supplies.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport their rice crops and the remainder of the money is to be used to buy additional ten pigs and feed for their livestock supplies

loans.name: Elih

texts.en: Elih is 30 years old and is married. She sells cosmetics on credit and usually earns $10 per week. Her husband, Dahlan, is a driver, and usually earns $40 per month. Elih is requesting a IDR 500,000 loan to expand her business. Elih hopes that she can improve her income to use towards her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Mrs. Ruth works is part of the las Activas Communal Bank and lives in the district of Calleria of Ucayali. She is 26 years old and is single. Thanks to the first loan she received of $100 she was able to create a small business selling clothes, soft drinks, beer and ice pops.

She has a little store located in her own house. She wakes up at six in the morning every day to go to the market and make breakfast. For the rest of the day she dedicates herself to her business.

With the recent loan she requests of $334 she will buy three boxes of soft drinks, nine loads of beer, three boxes of nectar, four of yogurt, three packets of bags for ice pops, and four loads of fruit. The loan will be repayed in five months. With the rest of the money she will invest in clothing.

Ruth is very happy to see her business prosper because it is a very important achievement to her.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ruth pertenece al Banco Comunal las Activas, vive en Jr. Unión Mz. 6 Lt. 9, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera. Gracias al primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decidió poner un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa al por menor, bebidas gaseosas, cervezas y chupetes (paletas de hielo).

En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña bodega ubicada en su misma casa, se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para ir al mercado y hacer el desayuno, y después de dedica ala venta en su negocio.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1.000, (US$ 334.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 03 cajas de gaseosa, 09 cajas de cerveza, 03 cajas de néctar, 04 de yogurt, 03 paquetes de bolsas para chupetes, 02 masas de aguaje (fruta de la zona), 02 masas de hungurahuina (fruta de la zona) y S/. 500.00 serán invertidos en la compra de prendas de vestir.

Ruth esta muy contenta de al ver que su negocio prospera, ya que es un logro muy importante para ella.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, fruit, and clothing

loans.name: Lieng

texts.en: M. Lieng (59) and her husband, Khin Run (61) have been married since 1970. They have three children — two sons and one daughter. Their daughter is in full time employement, while one of the sons is a monk and  the other one studying in Phnom Penh. Lieng and her family live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  M. Lieng started her own business in 1989 selling groceries and shoes while her husband earns a small living growing rice and planting vegetables.  Lieng is requesting a second loan of $1000 which she plans to use to purchase grocery items which she will sell at her store.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her store.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
"I'm divorced and have 1 adolescent daughter. I manage to make some improvements in my home with my job and the alimony that my ex-husband gives me but it is still difficult. Currently, I'd like to build a room and a bathroom on the second floor of my home for more space. I seek a loan of $1200 to build a room and a bath in the second floor of my home. "

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer. “Yo soy divorciada y tengo1hija adolescente, con mi trabajo y la pensión que me da mi ex esposo he logrado hacerle algunas mejoras a mi vivienda pero es difícil, ahora me gustaría hacer un cuarto y un baño el la planta alta de mi casa para tener un poco más de espacio. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para construir un cuarto y un baño en planta alta de mi vivienda."

loans.use: to build a room and bathroom

loans.name: Joao Eriasse

texts.pt:
João Eriasse C. is 42 years old and native of the Beira district in the Sofala province in Mozambique. During his childhood João did not have the opportunity to study due to social situations. He lost his father when he was young and went to live with his grandparents.

In his childhood he learned to fish since that is what most people do in the zone where he was born. When he was 18 years old he joined the army and was transferred to the Maputo province. After working 3 years he was discharged.

He is married and the father of 3 children the youngest of which are students. He works as a fisherman, and his wife helps him sell his fish. Both of them work in agriculture during periods of low production.

With this loan João intends to purchase fishing nets. He doesn't have sufficient funds to fix them and lately the fishing hasn't been very lucrative due to the drastic reduction in fish in the Maputo River. In the future he wants to improve his boat and buy a motor so he can fish in the Indian Ocean.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Joao Eriasse C., de 42 anos de idade, natural do Distrito de Beira, provincia da Sofala, centro de Moçamique, durante a sua infáncia não teve possibilidade de estudar, devido a situaçoes sociais muito cedo perdeu o seu pai onde viu se obrigado a viver com os avos. Desde a infancia que aprendeu a actividade de pesca, uma vez que uma maioria exerce a mesma actividade na zona onde ele nasceu. Quando tinha 18 anos foi incorporado no exercito e tendo sido transferido para Maputo provincia, onde trabalhou 03 anos, tendo sido desmobilizado. Casado e pai de 3 filhos e todos menores e estudantes, ele ocupa-se como pescador e a esposa ajuda-lhe nas vendas do produto pesqueiro e ambos no periodo de fraca producao dedicam-se a agricultura. Com o emprestimo de pretende comprar mais redes de pesca, uma vez que nao dispoe de fundos suficientes para sua reposicao e ultimamente a pesca nao tem lhes dados muita receita, devido a reducao drastica do produto pesqueiro no rio Maputo. No futuro tenciona melhorar seu barco e comprar motor para pescar nas aguas do oceano indico.

loans.use: To buy nets

loans.name: Nhom Chi Tham - Thon An Ninh Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hồng Thắm (MS 13010027), 23 years old, is married with two small children. The coupL. are young and active. He is a truck driver and she tends a grocery stand. They have a loan, almost paid off, with the agricultural bank to buy his truck. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 đồng, that’d paid off in 6 months, to invest in her grocery stand. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Lê Thị Mận (MS 13010028), 34 years old, applies for a loan to buy fabrics
  • Nguyễn Thị Sáu (MS 13010029), 41 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs
  • Nguyễn Thị Năm (MS 13010031), 44 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs
  • C. Thị Liên (MS 13010032), 21 years old, applies for a loan to invest in “đi chợ”
  • Nguyễn Thị Thơm (MS 13010033) applies for a loan to to invest in “đi chợ”

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a littL. fish or a small bundL. of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng Thắm (MS 13010027), 23 tuổi, có 2 con nhỏ. Vợ chồng chị dù rất trẻ nhưng khá chăm chỉ, năng động. Chồng chị là lái xe ô tô, vợ bán các mặt hàng tạp hoá. Anh chị đã từng vay vốn ở ngân hàng nông nghiệp để mua ô tô cho chồng lái xe chở hàng thuê nhưng đã hoàn trả gần hết nợ. Chi tham gia Tài chính vi mô bình minh để thêm vốn mua hàng tạp hoá bán. Chị vay mức 2006000đồng với kỳ hạn là 6 tháng. Các thành viên khác: Chị Lê Thị Mận (MS 13010028), 34 tuổi, vay vốn để mua vải may quần áo Chị Nguyễn Thị Sáu (MS 13010029), 41 tuổi, vay vốn để mua cám lợn Chị Nguyễn Thị Năm (MS 13010031), 44 tuổi, vay vốn đế mua cám lợn Chị C. Thị Liên (MS 13010032), 21 tuổi, vay vốn để đi chợ Chị Nguyễn Thị Thơm (MS 13010033, vay vốn để đi chợ.

loans.use: Invest in various businesses

loans.name: Hebreo Group

texts.en:
Y. lives with his wife and two children (ages: 12, 15) in the busy town of San Pedro D. Macoris. He owns a small street-siD. business where he sells a variety of fried foods. This loan will be used to buy flour, oil, meat, and vegetables for the popular Dominican food called “empanada”. In the future, he would like to move his business from the street to a proper store where he would be able sell a variety of different foods. Y. loves his children, and he takes great priD. in sending them to a good school. He hopes that once his business grows even more he will be able to start saving for their college education.

Thank you for supporting this group, and we look forward to watching these 5 entrepreneurs improve their businesses and lives!

loans.use: To purchase additional flour, oil, vegetables, and meat to make "empanadas"

loans.name: Darine

texts.en: Darine is a 28-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Darine sells fruit juices. She has partnered with two friends to establish her business. This is the first time she is applying for a loan at A. Majmoua. She needs to buy provisions to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Nelson Moises

texts.pt:
Nelson Moises M. is 30 years old and native to the province of Maputo in the district of Boane. He is single with a 3 year old son. Beyond his family he supports 3 siblings by sending them money or food at the end of every month.

Nelson studied through the 8th grade and did not continue due to the financial situation of his family. He has never moved and has always lived in Boane. He has his own home. Nelson works for Petromoc, a service station in Boane, and he works from 8:00am to midnight 3 days per week.

This is the third loan for Nelson, and the first two were used to purchase construction materials (1st loan=4,200MT, 2nd loan=7,200MT). Likewise, this loan will also be applied to purchase construction materials given that he is building his house in phases. Nelson intends to pay back before maturity because he is also requesting another loan to open a small business for his girlfriend.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Nelson Moises M. tem 30 anos de idade, natural da provincia do Maputo, distrito de Boane, solteiro e pai de um filho com 3 anos de idade. Para além da sua familia sustenta 3 irmao enviando lhes dinheiro ou produtos alimentares no fim de cada més. Nelson estudou até 8ªClasse e não continuou devido a situação financeira da família e nunca mudou se de cidade, sempre viveu em Boane. Tem casa própria. Nelson M. é trabalhador da Petromoc, estação de serviço de Boane com Horiario das 8:H as 0:00h 3 dias por semana. Este é o terceiro empréstimo para Nelson, onde os dois primeiros foram para compra de material de construção ( 1º =4200,00mt, 2º =7200,00mt ). Assim este também vai aplicar o dinheiro na compra de material de construção dado que está fazendo a casa em fase. Nelson pretende pagar antes do tempo dado que vai solicitar outro emprestimo para abrir um pequeno negocio para sua esposa.

loans.use: purchase construction materials for his home

loans.name: Rabia's Wache Waseme Group

texts.en:
Rabia R. is 25 years old and married. She started her business selling meat in 2007. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $90.

Rabia now hopes for a loan of $1000 to buy more chicken and beef for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who lso have businesses selling soap and coconut oil, clothing and cakes, charcoal and groceries.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and beef for her business

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom S. is a 61-year-old widowed teacher who lives with her two children in Phnom Penh. Typically, she is able to earn approximately $2 per day, and her daughter, Sin Kalyan, earns approximately $5 per day as a port staff member. Her other child is a photographer in a photo center in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Mom is asking for a loan to purchase a digital camera for her son so that he can use the camera in his free time (i.e., when he is not working at the photo center). She is confident that her son will use the camera to generate additional profits to support their family.

loans.use: To purchase a digital camera for her son to enable him to generate greater income

loans.name: Lisset Antonia

texts.es: Lisett tiene 26 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe de la ciudad de Managua, un lugar rural caracterizado por su producción de piñas y pitahayas. Lisett es casada, su esposo es obrero y trabaja en una fábrica, y junto a ella unen esfuerzos para sacar a su pequeña familia adelante, ellos todavía son un matrimonio sin hijos. Lisset se dedica a la venta de comida, ofrece en su vivienda sopa y nacatamales los fines de semana,  inició desde muy joven esta labor, tiene 5 años de tener el negocio, cuya experiencia fue adquirida de su mamá. En estos momentos ellos planean invertir en la mejora de su hogar con el préstamo solicitado compraran materiales de construcción para terminar de construir la sala de estar de su vivienda, y así poder tener una vivienda digna que ofrecerle a sus hijos, para cuando éstos vengan al mundo.
texts.en:
Lisett is 26 years old, lives in the Ticuantepe municipality of Managua, a rural place known for its production of pineapples and dragon fruit. Lisett is married, her husband is a laborer and works in a factory, and along with his wife they work to help their small family get ahead, as they do not yet have children. Lisett sells food from her home on the weekends, such as soup and “nactamales” (a type of tamale made of smashed corn and potatoes wrapped in a banana leaf along with some pork meat, little fresh tomato and some garlic & salt.). She began selling food at a young age, and has been in business for 5 years, acquiring her experience from her mother. Today she plans to invest in improving her home with the loan, she will buy construction materials to build a living room in her home and in this way have a worthy home to offer to her children when they come into this world.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the living room of her home.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna S., 52 ans, mariée avec 01 enfant et 01autre petit garçon à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Samba 15 ans 1  depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente d’huile de palme, de poisson sec et  de poisson fumé. Maimouna participe aux charges familiales. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Maimouna S., 52, married with one child and one other little boy for whom she is responsible, has been a member of the village bank of "Samba 15 ans 1" for 6 years. She wants to boost her business selling palm oil, dried fish, and smoked fish on a table in the street. Maimouna helps support the family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of palm oil, dried and smoked fish

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en:
Calixta is a member of the Florecer (“to bloom”) Village Bank.  Calixta is 48 years old and is widowed with two children. She sells fruit outside the bus terminal on Cuzco Street, where buses leave for the southern parts of the region of Ayacucho. She works every day, and her children often help out. Calixta also sells Omnilife products.  Calixta needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy different fruits.  Her dreams are to build a second floor onto her home and for her children to graduate from college with professional degrees.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Calixta es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Calixta es viuda, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Calixta vende frutas en el terminal terrestre de la av. Cuzco, donde es el paradero de salida y llegada de los buses que viajan a la zona sur del departamento, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Calixta vende productos Omnilife.
Calixta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de diferentes frutas.
Los sueños de Calixta son construir el segundo piso de su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To buy different fruits

loans.name: Lazaro Bernardo

texts.es: El Sr. Lázaro tiene 50 años de edad, habita en  un bario de la capital de Managua llamado Hialeah, casado su esposa trabaja como domestica en una casa particular no tienen hijos. Los planes para el futuro de  su familia es terminar de construir su casa. Don Lázaro se desemP. como celador, es un trabajo agotador tiene seis años de experiencia laboral también posee conocimiento de construcción. Sus objetivos es cambiar a un mejor trabajo y con un mejor  ingresos los donde pueda satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: Cemento, hierro, bloque y ladrillo para terminar de hacer su casa y poder gozar de una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Senor Lázaro, 50, lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of the capital of Managua. He is married, his wife works as a domestic in a private home, they have no children. The family's future plans are to complete the construction of their house. Don Lázaro has the job of security guard, which is exhausting work. He has 6 years of work experience, and he also has knowledge of construction. Their objective is to change to a better job with a better income that would be able to meet the needs of the household. Thanks to the Afodenic loans, he will be able to buy construction materials such as: cement, iron, blocks and bricks to finish building his house and be able to enjoy a decent lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials to finish his house

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en: Mr. S., 37, teaches secondary school, as well as grows rice on a farm. He is married to Mrs. Sreykhim who grows and sells vegetables.  They have three teenaged children living with them at home. His wife is a strong communicator who is able to attract regular customers. He believes they have the potential to earn more money if she rents a farming machine to people in his area. Therefore, Mr. S. would like to ask for a loan to purchase a farming machine.

loans.use: To purchase a farming machine

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad, 45, lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mouhamad has owned a bakery for 30 years. He sells mankoucheh, which looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese), and lahm bi ajin (chopped meat). You can eat mankoucheh anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Mouhamad is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials for his bakery. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan.
Mouhamad does his work well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for his bakery

loans.name: Dios Es Amor 6 Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs belongs to the Dios es Amor (God is Love) Bank of Hope in San Pedro de Macoris. They are starting their businesses with this first loan. Lucia is the group coordinator and she sells clothes. She has 5 children; the oldest is 10 years old and the youngest is just two months old. She will use the entire amount of her loan to purchase clothes to sell in her business. She finds her biggest challenge in life is to be there for her children as a parent, and not merely as a provider. She knows her presence and guidance are important, which is why she hopes that (and works hard for) her business to grow so she can be self-sufficient and spend more time with her young children.

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these new entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Rashidan Zafar Haider Group

texts.en:
Rashidan Baji is a 48-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Her husband's name is Z. H., a shoe seller by profession, who has been in this business for the past 5 years. Rashidan Baji is the mother of three sons. Her elder son runs a small hotel in the food market and attracts customers with his Punjabi foods. The next runs a vegetable selling business. Her younger son works in a private office as an telephone operator on a monthly wage. Rashidan Baji is a very hardworking lady. She operates a clothes knitting business. She knits clothes and sells them to the cloth markets to earn an income. She saves her income in a community bank and plans to marry off her elder son with her savings. She is applying for a loan to expand her second son’s business by buying more vegetables.

Rashidan Baji is the group leader of three another women from her locality. Shahnaz Baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switch boards and switches) to sell. Maqsoodan Baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Khursheed Baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Srun L. is 28 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, where she has been running a business as a Khmer cake seller for three years. Her business is now going well, and she has a lot of regular customers come to buy her product, because she is skilled in communication in the village. 

As the another source of daily income, her husband works as a truck repairer. He earns around $5 a day. The couple lives with one child, who is minor and enrolled in school. The family has been building its house for a long time, but the house is lacking the spare parts needed. 

Right now, L. needs a loan to purchase more wood and furniture to decorate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and furniture to decorate her house

loans.name: Sawssan

texts.en: Sawssan, 39, lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband and three children. She has owned a grocery store since 2001. When she first started her business, Sawssan didn’t have the startup capital. However, she continued with the business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. She requests a loan of US $1500 from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for her store. This is her fourth cycle of loan, and she has always paid back on time. The previous loans helped her improve her store by diversifying her merchandise. Sawssan is a good business woman as she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients include her friends and neighbors. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Atawa

texts.fr: Atawa K. est une jeune femme de 25 ans, mariée et mère d’une petite fille. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes çà Wome. Atawa se déplaçait de temps en temps dans les marchés environnants pour vendre ses marchandises. Elle désire avec ce deuxième crédit augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant des pagnes de qualité afin répondre aux exigences de la clientèle. Avec les revenus, elle pourra mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Atawa K. is a young woman, 25 years old, married, and the mother of a girl. She is a retailer of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) in Wome. She used to travel now and then to the surrounding marketplaces to sell her merchandise. She would like to use this second loan to expand her commerce by buying quality pagnes in order to respond to customer demands. With the revenues, she will be able to provide for her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth for resale

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs Sreng C., aged 54, was married in 1980 and has six children: one daughter, married but living inside the family home, and five sons. Four of her sons attend school and the other son runs a battery-charging business in front of his house. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sreng has been selling mangoes for over ten years – she buys them on contract from villagers and resells them at Phnom Penh market. Sreng’s daughter has been a hairdresser for five years. She wants to raise pigs in her free time, but she lacks money to purchase piglets to raise. Therefore Sreng is applying for a loan of $500 USD in order to help fund her daughter's initiative.

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs to raise

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Célestine D. est âgé de 26 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est revendeuse de produits pharmaceutiques à Womé. Célestine exerce cette activité depuis 4 ans et elle est à son premier crédit. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit relancer son activité en achetant de nouveaux produits afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Célestine D. is 26 years old, married, and the mother of two. She is a retailer of pharmaceutical products in Womé. She has been in this business for four years, and she is on her first loan. She would like to use this loan to reinvigorate her business by buying new products in order to respond to customer needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new goods

loans.name: Marufat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization.
