Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Маруфат  Махкамова  1965 года рождения, разведенная,   имеет 2 детей. Маруфат проживает в Зафарабадском районе. Около двух лет Маруфат торгует на рынке детской одеждой, которую привозит из Кыргызстана. Маруфат кредитуется у нас не в первый раз, прежде получив кредиты, она наладила свою торговую деятельность и стала получать хорошую прибыль. Маруфат одна из примерных клиентов нашей организации. Снова подав заявку на получение кредита, она   планирует расширить свой товарооборот. Запрашиваемая  сумма - 3500 сомони.
texts.en:
Marufat M. was born in 1965. She is divorced and has two children. Marufat lives in the Zafarabad district of Sogd region. For about two years, Marufat has been selling children's clothes, which she obtains in Kyrgyzstan, at the local market. This will not be Marufat's first loan from MLF "MicroInvest." She received loans in the past which helped her get started in business and earn a good profit. Marufat is one of MLF's model clients. She has applied for a new loan of 3500 somoni in order to expand her sales volume.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand sales volume

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is married and mother of two girls. Currently both her children attend school in the community where they live. She is 34 years old and a petty trader who trades in clothing materials. She is a very hard-working young woman who works to cater for herself and her business. She trades in cloth for sewing clothing, shoes, slippers and lace materials. She started her business sixteen years ago. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations.

Rebeca treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. For lack of adequate working capital she buys little because of inadequate funds. She sells her goods at the community market center. For this reason she requests a loan to make business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level.

loans.use: To purchase bulk amounts of lace materials and textiles

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
“It’s better to give than to receive,” says Eddie, when he is asked about his principle in life. Eddie is a very generous person, not only to his children, but also to other people. He is married to Edelia who works abroad as a domestic helper. They have two children. The eldest is now looking for a job and their youngest is a nursing student. He and his wife are sacrificing a lot just to provide a better life for their children.  

To help his wife to meet the needs of their family, Eddie decided to engaged in the hog-raising business.  At the moment, Eddie has only one hog to raise.  He is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 which he will use to buy more piglets.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El Sr Alejandro se dedica a alquilar su camioneta para tranasportar ladrillos, tejas, cemento , etc pertenece a una asociacion en el 5º anillo santos dumont. Vive en  la zona alto Santa Rita junto con su esposa son dueños de casa su esposa se dedica a la costura de ropa y tiene una pequeña hija. El credito utilizara para realizar algunas reparaciones a la movilidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Alejandro rents out his truck for transporting bricks, tiles, cement and other construction materials. He is a member of the #5 Anillo Santos Dumont Association. He lives in the Santa Rita district with his wife (who is a seamstress) and young daughter. His loan will be used to pay for repairs to his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Test We Group

texts.en:
This is Angela S., Mbalu K., Mariatu K., Mohamed K. M. and Abass K. S.. They named their group Test We. They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo small town, twenty miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo. Each of them is requesting a loan of Le 500,000.00. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses and consequently make better profit and improve on their standards of living.

Angela (right) is the leader of this group. She is thirty-seven years of age and was born in a small town called Batt K. in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with four children who are attending school. Angela sells cooked rice, meat, vegetables and cold soft drinks and has been a businesswoman for over sixteen years now. With this loan, she will buy a cool-man, two bags of rice, ten gallons of palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and other cooking ingredients.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Martha Veronica

texts.es: La Joven Martha Verónica A. , tiene la edad de 21 años habita en el barrio la Francia numero uno , junto a sus padres y hermanos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ella desde hace cuatro años se dedica a trabajos del campo , ya que su abuelo le heredo para que se defendiera por si sola , los sueños de la Joven es poder llegar a ser doctora , actualmente trabaja como auxiliar de enfermería , agradece a la institución por la aprobación del préstamo ya que el primero obtuvo resultados mejores , lo cual le permitió vender en un buen precio la piña a la vez cancelo su desembolso en tiempo y forma . Con este préstamo comprara fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo  Se siente contenta ya que son muchos los agricultores que se benefician con estos programas dirigidos al sector agrícola.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is a 34-year-old borrower who lives in San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. This is Daniela’s first individual loan, and fourth overall with Esperanza International. She has a perfect repayment record, and she is excited for the challenge of having a loan for which she is solely responsible.

Daniela runs a beauty salon in her neighborhood here in San Pedro, which she rents on a monthly basis. She specializes in hairstyling and coloring, and also gives manicures and pedicures. Daniela will be using her loan to purchase new hair and nail products, shampoos, creams, and perfumes. She hopes these will lead to happier customers, better business, and greater profits.

Daniela likes the detailed attention she receives from Esperanza. She has never had a problem working with her loans, and she hopes to continue borrowing in order to have a better future for her business. One day, she would like to own both her business and her home. Thank you for lending to Daniela and her beauty salon!

loans.use: To purchase hair and nail products

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.en: Senora Maria is 45 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 12. They are both in high school. For three years, she has had a restaurant in the small community of Palo Grande near the city of Chinandega. Maria has worked in El Salvador where she gained valuable work experience and with the money that she earned she opened her business. She serves three meals a day. This loan of C$10,000 will go towards structural improvements to her business. Maria Eugenia has a good credit history with Fundacíon León 2000 and is a very capable client and businesswoman.

loans.use: To make structural improvements to her business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa D., 46. is married to Arsenio D. and blessed with six children. Three are already married and three are single. They reside together at the village of Calaocan, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their house is situated near the Baranggay Health Center.

Marissa is engaged in hog-raising for almost 20 years. Every time she disposes of one hog she earns a net income of 5000 PHP. She works hard to increase her income and to strengthen her business.

Marissa decided to request a loan of 11,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to purchase hog feed and some hogs to raise. She wants to expand her pig pens to earn more income for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: To buy hog feed and some hogs to raise.

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es: Doña Julia V. mujer trabajadora desde su juventud, había deseado tener su propio negocio el cual es una pulpería que con ayuda de su única hija han salido adelante, a pesar que la crió sola. Las dificultades en su negocio que ha dado crédito y mucha gente no le han pagado y ha venido descapitalizando su fondo como poco inventario,  es por eso desea invertir en granos básicos, cosmético como: vanidades, pinturas, sombras, pintura de uña, talco, colonia, a si como productos enlatados, para preparar los alimentos. El cual espera poder vender más y seguir aumentado de clientes. Con esto que le ha pasado no dará más al crédito ya que tiene una responsabilidad con la institución de pagar mensual, a si como pagar sus gastos básicos de agua, luz, teléfono.  Su anhelo es poder hacer crecer su venta para que a futuro su hija dependa de su negocio propio. Feliz por que solo mediante el financiamiento ha podido fortalecer su negocio  y solo mediante este medio se logra la inversión a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Julia V. has been a hard-worker since her youth. She had wanted to have her own business, which is a mini market. With help from her only daughter, they have gotten ahead in spite of the fact that she raised her alone. The problem with her business is that she has given credit, and many people have not paid. She does not have adequate funding, and she has little inventory. That is why she wants to buy basic grains and cosmetics like lipstick, shadow, nail polish, powder, and cologne. She also wants to buy canned goods to prepare food. She hopes to be able to sell more and get more customers. With what has happened, she will not sell anymore on credit. She has a responsibility to the institution to make monthly payments, and she has to pay basic expenses like water, light, and telephone. Her goal is to be able to make her sales grow so that in the future her daughter can depend upon her own business. She is happy that she has been able to strengthen her business with the loan. The loan is the only way to achieve long term investment.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains like rice, beans, sugar and cosmetics and other products to increase sales through a variety of products

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es: Gloria Patricia H. D. L. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango. Vive junto a sus tres hijos menores D. edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Debido a la difícil situación económica su esposo decidió irse a los Estados Unidos, lugar en el cual espera encontrar un buen trabajo. Gloria posee una venta D. ropa para dama, así también zapatos para adultos y niños. Gloria solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para poder comprar ropa y zapatos al por mayor D. manera que pueda obtener precios más bajos. Esto lo hace con el fin D. poder brindar mayor cantidad D. productos D. diferentes tallas y colores y así mismo poder brindar un poco más barato su producto, D. manera que sus ventas aumenten y ella pueda seguir adelante junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria Patricia H. D. L. is thirty-five years old, she lives in the municipality of Soyapango. She lives with her three young children who are in school. Due to the difficult economic situation her husband decided to go to the United States, where he hopes to find good work. Gloria has a women's clothing shop, where she also sells shoes for adults and children. Gloria sought a loan in order to obtain the money necessary to buy clothes and shoes at wholesale prices. She does this in order to be able to proviD. a variety of sizes and colors, and she is also able to lower the price of her products in order to increase her sales and continue to do well with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.en: Hikmat is 35 years old, married, and has two children. The family lives in Baku city. He has been in this business for three years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy the necessary things for improving his carpenter business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for improving his carpenter business

loans.name: Digana Emerita

texts.es: DOÑA DIGNA ES UNA COMERCIANETE DE PESCADO DE LA ZONA DE JIQUILILLO EN CHINANDEGA  TIENE 15 AÑOS DE TENER EL ACOPIO  Y ES UNA CLIENTA QUE COMENZO CON SOLO UNA PANA VENDIENDO AMBULANTE HOY EN DIA DEBIDO AL ESFUERZO EL NEGOCIO VA EN AUMENTO  SE PUEDE OBSERVAR EN LA FOTO UN DIA NORMAL DE TRABAJO EN EL ACOPIO
texts.en:
Mrs. Digna markets fish in the Jiquilillo area of Chinandega. For 15 years she has had a fish distribution business. She is a client who started out selling bread in the streets. Now, thanks to her efforts, her business is increasing. In the photograph you can see a normal working day in her fish business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a boat motor

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita U. is a woman of many dreams and the heroism to fight challenges in order to achieve her dreams. She is 57 years old and married to George, 50, who is a fisherman.  She is a loving mother of an only child, King, who is 15 years old and a high school student. She lives in the town of Tanay, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. 

In 1996, she joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with an opportunity of having startup capital for generating income. During her previous loans from ASHI, she carefully invested it in planting vegetables and a hog raising business. Both businesses gave her a reasonable income, but it was lost due to a storm last September 2009.

Now on her third loan, she requests 15,000 PHP for the recovery of her planting business and to also start hog fattening. Specifically, the amount will be use for both businesses. This loan will help her business, which was destroyed by huge typhoons ”Ondoy” and “Santi”. 

As a mother, Nenita dreams of sending her son to school and on to completing college degrees and finding jobs for a better life. She also enjoys that the loan from ASHI will change their lives and accommodate her family's needs. Through the support of ASHI, a Kiva partner, she hopes to continue reaching for her dreams.

loans.use: For the recovery of her planting business and to start hog fattening.

loans.name: Sepha

texts.en:
G. Sepha, 45, is a state teacher in the Takeo province. He is married with five children. Two are students and three are employed as garment factory workers.

On average, G. Sepha is able to make about US$2 a day, while his wife, pictured here, sells vegetables and beef at the local market. She is able to make US$2 of profit a day as well.

Due to the high transportation costs that her children spend every day to commute to work, G. Sepha would like to purchase a motorbike for her children. This will help reduce transportation costs and allow her children to save even more.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie B. is from Gingoog City. She is 26 years old and married. To make a living, Jessie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jessie has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Jessie joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Proyeccion Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyección inicia su ciclo 16 con  14 socias.
Las socias son del departamento D. Huancavelica y realizan diferentes negocios.
Como es el caso D. Nemesia que es casada y tiene 7 hijos, Nemesia se dedica a el traslado D. carga en diferentes instituciones, actividad que realiza con su esposo. Además Nemesia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, negocio que fue implementando poco a poco para ayudar en los gastos del hogar. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. tubérculos para surtir su tienda. Nemesia sueña con mejorar su negocio.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 400 soles, 500 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 8900 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Proyección" started its 16th loan cycle with 14 members. The members are from the Huancavelica region and they have a variety of businesses. As is the case for Nemesia, who is married and has 7 children. Nemesia has a business transporting cargo to different institutions, an activity that she carries out with her husband. In addition, Nemesia has a store in her home where she sells groceries. She established this business gradually in order to help with the household expenses. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of root vegetables to stock her store. Nemesia dreams of improving her business. The members need loans of various amounts such as 300, 400, 500 or 1,000 Peruvian soles, making a total of 8,900 soles of loans for the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy root vegetables

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR BRAULIO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD, COMO SER: SARDINAS ENLATADAS, FIDEO, ARROZ, AZUCAR,, TAMBIEN VENDE CARNE, Y OTROS INSUMOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD.

EL SEÑOR VIVE EN UNA PEQUEÑA CASA CON SU ESPOSA Y SU HIJITA DE 3 AÑOS DE EDAD, EL SE LEVANTA A ABRIR SU TIENDA DESDE LAS 5:30 DE LA MADRUGADA, ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA EL ACCEDIO AL CREDITO POR SER BASTANTE CUMPLIDO EN SUS  PAGOS, SU TIENDA ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE EL MAICA  A 20 KILOMETROS DE COCHABAMBA TIENE UNA TIENDA SURTIDA DONDE  OFRECE TODOS LOS PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD. 
                                                         
EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA PODER COMPRASE UN HELADERA PARA HACER ENFRIAR LOS REFRESCOS QUE VENDE.           EL SEÑOR ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y CON LOS SOCIOS DE KIVA, POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Braulio has a small grocery store where he sells basic items like: canned sardines, pasta, rice, sugar, meat and other supplies. He lives in a small house with his wife and 3-year-old daughter. He rises at 5:30am to open his store for business. He is a responsible, hard-working person. He qualified for the loan because he has made his payments on time. His store is in Maica which is 20 kilometers from Cochabamba. His store is well-stocked with all basic items. He will use the funds to buy a refrigerated display case to cool his soft-drinks. He is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva members for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerated display case.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling ocean-caught fish in her community. She is 55 years old, married and has three adult children. She is from the village of Punta, Panaon. Anita has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Anita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
La   Sra. Pelagia V. A.  es de la compania Jejui, tiene 64 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Rodolfo Rolón de 69 años de edad.
 
           La Señora es propietaria de  una negocio  que funciona en su domicilio particular.
El negocio es muy completo ya que tiene todos lo relacionado a la canasta básica , ademas posee una carnicería y venta de ropas.
La pareja es muy trabajadora, por que ademas de atender el negocio tienen algunos cultivos, hortalizas en la huerta y ademas tienen cria de ganados menores como cerdos y aves.
Solicita el crédito a la Fundación Paraguaya y KIVA para la compra de una congeladora para la carnicería que funciona en su negocio ya que estaban utilizando la heladera de la casa para conservar la carne.
Ella desea aumentar su ganancia para invertir en ganados vacunos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pelagia V. A. is from the Jejui Company; she is 64 years old and is married to Mr. Rodolfo Rolón of 69 years of age.

Mrs. V. A. is the owner of a business that is run in her home.

The business is very complete since she has everything relating to basic household goods and she also has a butcher’s shop and sells clothing.

They are a very industrious couple, besides having the business they have some crops, a vegetable garden and a litter of small livestock like pigs and birds.

She needs the loan from Fundación Paraguaya (Kiva’s field partner) and KIVA to buy a freezer for her butcher’s shop since she uses her home freezer to preserve the meat.

She wishes to increase her profits to invest in cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Née en 1958 à Missérété au Bénin, H. Cécile vit depuis trente ans à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Cécile est mariée à un certain Justin. Le couple a sept enfants, tous scolarisés. Seulement trois des enfants sont à la charge de Cécile et de son mari. Cécile vit ensemble avec son mari et ses trois enfants à charge. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différentes charges de la famille. Cécile n'a pas été à l'école. C'est depuis trente ans que Cécile prépare et vend de l'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Cécile gère un moulin à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au Nigéria que Cécile achète ses produits. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement et d'augmenter le stock de ses produits, Cécile sollicite pour une première fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1958 in Missérété in Bénin, Cécile H. has lived for 30 years in Ekpè, in the Sèmè-Podji community. Cécile is married to Justin. The couple has seven children, all of whom are educated. Only three of the children are still under the couple's care. Cécile lives with her husband and the three children. Together, the couple supports the family's different needs. Cécile did not go to school. For 30 years, she has prepared and sold "akassa" (a local dish made from a base of maize starch) from her home. As secondary work, Cécile manages a mill from her home. She purchases her products in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin, and in Nigeria. With the goal of strengthening her working capital and increasing her stock, Cécile is asking for her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of maize

loans.name: Kalamba Tukole Womens Gp, Mubende Group

texts.en:
W. Yusuf, aged 48 years, has been operating a Laundry and dry-cleaning business in Kalamba Trading Centre, Mubende.

This hardworking married father of five children started up his business five years ago where he cleans and irons clothes for his customers for amounts that vary with the number of clothes worked on. This has seen him earn 70,000 Ugandan shillings on a weekly basis as many people tend to be lazy on cleaning their own clothes, which helps him get a market.

With this loan, Yusuf looks forward to buying Laundry and dry-cleaning machines as they will help him make his work faster and easier. This will get him more customers and further improve his revenue.

Yusuf says that he taught himself the trade after he saw a need for the business and although he describes himself as successful in business, he still needs help from loans. In future, Yusuf hopes to open up another laundry shop to expand business.

loans.use: The revamping of his business and purchase of new laundry and dry cleaning machines

loans.name: Eufronia

texts.en:
Eufronia is a 47-year-old mother of eight. She is a native of Talim Island from the town of Binangonan, which is located in Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is happily living with her 8 children and her 48-year-old husband, Virgilio, who is a bamboo set maker (furniture maker). 

Eufronia dreams of escaping the circle of poverty. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2000 with hope of having access to capital to start a business. She and her husband are partners in their bamboo set making business. Since then her business has continued to grow and provide good income for her family but income from business in not enough to sustain everyday needs; therefore the couple now requests a much larger loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP for a bigger profits. The loan will be used to pay for inventory of raw materials of her business.

Eufronia is looking forward to increased demand for bamboo sets (furniture) on the island and in nearby towns so that their business will grow and generate enough income for her family. She dreams of sending her children to school until they finish college and find a stable living arrangement. She also hopes to build a new concrete, durable house for secure and comfortable living conditions.  Her long-term goal is to launch a new fishing business for additional income.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials for her bamboo set (furniture) making

loans.name: Mrs. Nuon Saing Villlage Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people, who live in Prey Kduoch village in Takeo province, are made up a village bank loan. Mrs. Nuon S. is a village bank president who is 51 years old. She is a farmer who owns one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family and a side this she is also a clothes seller. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. Nuon S. is seeking for a loan to bU. more clothes to resale. She is widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the other is attending in local public school. Mrs. La Chem is a group guarantor so she is presented in the picture. All the members are shown in the picture but one of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resale

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel G. is from the village of Poblacion, Valencia City. She is 34 years-old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns and operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Raquel joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Raquel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for her restaurant.

loans.name: Riaz's Group

texts.en:
Riaz is a housewife. She is 46 years old and lives in Kot Radha Kishen, which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan. 
Kot Radha Kishen is near Lahore and famous for its dairy products. She owns a small house of three rooms where she lives with her family. 
Riaz is the mother of three sons. Only one of her sons could manage to get ana education. Now the all three of them work in a factory to support the family financially. Her husband is a laborer. He sometimes gets work, sometimes not. That’s why her children started supporting the family. 
Riaz has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will start a grocery shop in a nearby market and leave his labor work.  
Riaz is hopeful that a new business will bring new happiness to the family and her family’s financial condition will get better. She is a regular loan user and this is the seventh time she has applied for a loan from Asasah. In previous years, she has proved that she is a very responsible client and always attends meetings.

loans.use: To start a grocery shop

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina M., from the village of Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon, is 30 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Josefina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
Paul D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Together As One'.  He is 42 years old, married, and has three children who are between the ages of 5 and 19 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial constraints. 

For 22 years, he has been selling radios and watches in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 16,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 90,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more radios and watches. 

He describes himself as a hard-working man whose goals are to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more radios and watches

loans.name: Mitooma Tumanyane Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
A self-motivated Enid M. of Mitooma Tumanyane group, Bushenyi, aged 40, is a married mother of 6 aged between 20 and 8 years. She has been operating a retail shop business selling general products for home use from Mitooma town council, Bushenyi. She started this business 21 years ago after realizing the ready market in the area and at the end of every month she is able to pocket profits to the tune of 800,000 Ugandan shillings.
 
Her main drawback has been having small stock in the business that cannot match the purchasing rate of the customers. She is therefore seeking a loan that she figures will help her stock more goods that will satisfy the customers’ high demand and also transform her enterprise into a big enterprise. 
Being very committed to the business with good customer care, she hopes to increase her sales revenue. This will bring about a transformation in her business as she hopes to build a family house and enable her to achieve a self-sustaining life, and cater for her children’s education expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Sharonaliza

texts.en:
Sharonaliza S. is from the village of Matusalem. She is 25 years old. Sharonaliza is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sharonaliza owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Sharonaliza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sharonaliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sharonaliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. Sharonaliza is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Sharonaliza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina N. is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old. Dina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Dina owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing karaoke or videoke services wherein the customers need to pay 5 pesos per song. Dina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Dina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the karaoke. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Dina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the karaoke machine

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet P. is from the town of Banga. She is 31 years old and married with four young children. Her eldest child is 9 years old. Juliet and her husband are farmers who cultivate rice on their land. Juliet also manages a sari-sari (general) store where she sells a variety of products. She works hard to help provide for the needs of her family and fund her children's education.

Juliet joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase farm supplies and additional store merchandise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Juliet from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and store merchandise

loans.name: Juan Doroteo

texts.es: Juan Doroteo tiene 66 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y 3 hijos. El se dedica a brindar el servicio de acarreo. Tiene 15 años que se ha dedicado a eso y no quiere que su negocio termine, a pesar de los problemas que ha enfrentado como es la enfermedad de uno de sus hijos ya que es asmático, es por eso que se preocupa todos los días por generar ingresos para su negocio. Es el primer préstamo que solicita, El no había tenido antes problemas con su negocio, pero si quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio. El quiere invertir en su negocio para ofrecer un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Juan Doroteo, 66, is married and lives with his wife and three children.  He provides cartage services.  He has been in this line of work for 15 years and would like his business to continue. 

Despite problems faced, like one of his children’s illness (he’s asthmatic), he strives daily to earn income for his business.

This is the first loan he has requested.  He hadn’t had any problems with his business previously but he wants to continue growing in his business.  He wants to invest in his business in order to offer better service.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Fredesvinda

texts.en:
Fredesvinda is sixty-six years old.  She lives in the village of La Estancia in the district of Olmos.  Olmos is a rural region which is heavily populated by farmers who manage small plots of land and grow corn, rice, yucca, sugar cane and other crops.  Fredesvinda is married.

In corrals behind her home, Fredesvinda raises animals.  Specifically, she raises fowl, sheep, goats and hogs.  She cares for and feeds the animals until they reach the appropriate size to be sold in local markets or to neighbors.  The animals serve as integral parts of the daily nutrition of the people in the zone and form a part of the rich culinary tradition of northern Peru.

Fredesvinda plans to use the loan funds to purchase additional feed for her animals and make improvements to her corrals.  She hopes to be able to improve the quality of her animals through using better feed and providing a healthier and better living environment.  By improving her business, she expects to be able to improve her lifestyle, make improvements to her home and spend more time with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her animals and make improvements to her corrals.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda M. is from the town of Talibon. She is 52 years old and married. She has children who go to school. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She also fattens pigs for selling and hopes to acquire more piglets to raise.

Imelda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a  loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to buy two piglets and feed for them, and also additional merchandise to sell in her store. This will be her first loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and feed for them, and also additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Eduardo, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Parque Ecológico, este lugar es conocido porque aquí hay un hermoso parque el cual es muy visitado por los turistas y personas de la localidad que quieren pasar un dia en contacto con la naturaleza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mariana, ella tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 13 y 8 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es taxista. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección en un taller donde ella laboraba.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también elabora uniformes para escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, nos cuenta que son seis años que se dedica a esto desde que se independizó de donde ella trabajaba.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la forma como se trabaja en el mismo. Sus sueños son tener un taller con operarias y con más maquinarias.
texts.en:
In the San Eduardo neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo, the communal bank Parque Ecológico [Ecological Park] meets bimonthly.  This area is known for its beautiful park which is visited quite frequently by tourists and locals that want to spend the day communing with nature.  

Señora Mariana is 44 years old, married and has two school age children ages 13 and 8.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  Several years ago she learned the art of dressmaking in the shop where she worked.  She now has her own small shop where for many years she has been making all types of clothing.  She works on an order basis for individuals as well as making uniforms for schools in the area.  She works everyday from 6 am until 9 pm and sometimes until later when she has orders to fill.  She tells us that she has been doing this since she became self-employed six years ago.  

With this loan she is going to purchase fabrics and other materials for her shop.  She is the founder of her communal bank and she is happy with the way it is working.  Her dream is to have a shop with more machines and operators.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, buttons, fasteners, etc.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida G. is 56 years old, married and lives in Bantayan municipality on Cebu island, one of the Visayas islands. She sells fruit. Brigida has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard selling fruit, she has gradually made her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 15,000 PHP.

Brigida is borrowing 26,000 PHP, her 21st loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, so that she can purchase more fruit to sell. Her previous loan of 26,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Brigida aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina S. is from the village of Burnay, Gitagum, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Elina is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Elina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. She sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste to the local community. Elina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Elina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to purchase additional inventory and to fund working capital. 

Elina is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods,  snack foods and beverages. This loan will be Elina's 8th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 45-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating dried fish vending and food vending businesses.  She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Violeta is borrowing PHP 21,000 to fund operations. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Violeta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong T. T., 42 years old with 3 children, lives in Xuan Trach village.  She has had a shop that sells fresh fruits in the local market for 5 years. Her shop has many kinds of fruits which come from the southern province of Vietnam.  It attracts many customers and creates considerable revenue to manage family life.  During the time she has participated in the Seda credit project, she has been a good group leader and has received larger loans cycle after cycle.  Now she is planning to enlarge  the shop, and she wants a loan of 8,502,000 VND for that. She said  our credit program is very suitable for her business.

loans.use: to enlarge  the shop

loans.name: Ambroisine's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 19 women who live in the same neighborhood in Cotonou, Benin's largest city. This is their second loan with ALIDE following successful repayment of the first. They have agreed to support each other in business and through loan repayments.

Ambroisine (with her hand raised in the photo) is 36 years old and lives with her husband and their two children, both of whom are in school.

For the past five years, Ambroisine has run a general store selling various items from beauty products to clothes to refreshments. This loan will enable her to purchase these items in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim in the long term is to further diversify her product line.

loans.use: to restock her shop with household goods and clothes

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar V. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en pareja con la Sra. Norma Beatriz, tienen 3 hijos juntos todos en edad escolar y viven en la cuidad de Carapeguá.
Como proviene de una familia humilde y con ganas de salir adelante decidió emprender un pequeño negocio, empezó vendiendo ropas y calzados por la zona urbana de su ciudad, en poco tiempo logró juntar un poco de capital para empezar a comprar más variedad de artículos y llevar a vender por la capital del país, Asunción,  donde ya tiene una buena clientela formada.
Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo  pudo comprarse una motocicleta, la cual utiliza para realizar sus ventas y mantener la buena clientela.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas, sobrecamas, fajas y sábanas) puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos y desea cumplir con sus consumidores.
texts.en:
Oscar V. is 37 years old and lives with his partner, Norma Beatriz, with whom he has 3 school-aged children.  They live in the city of Carapeguá.  Since he comes from a modest family with a desire to get ahead, he decided to start a small business.  He began selling clothing and shoes throughout the urban areas of the city.  Over a short period of time, he managed to gather some capital to buy a greater variety of merchandise to take to the country’s capital city, Asunción, where he now has a well-established customer base. 

Thanks to his hard work and effort, he was able to buy himself a motorcycle that he uses to make his sales and maintain his good customers.  He requests this loan to buy merchandise (hammocks, blankets, bedspreads, and sheets) as he has many requests for these products and he wants to fulfill his consumers’ needs.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, sheets, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Amaris Del Rosario

texts.es:
Amaris E. con su anterior credikiva invirtió una parte en la  compra de Hilaza para hacer hamacas y mochilas, y con  la otra  parte hizo arreglos a su vivienda. Con su nuevo credikiva al que ahora está aplicando,  comprará hilaza, hilo fino para mochilas y bolsos y el resto lo invertirá en la compra de dulcería y refrescos para vender en tiendas de  barrios populares  en compañía de su hijo, que es su gran apoyo en esta tarea. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Que sigan prestando dinero a más personas, para que puedan trabajar  cómodamente y  mejorar sus situación económica”
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Amarís E. ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://www.kiva.org/lend/187404
texts.en: With part of her last credikiva, Amaris E. bought thick yarn to make hammocks and backpacks, and with the rest she made repairs to her house. With the new credikiva that she is applying for, she will purchase thinner yarn for backpacks and purses, and she will use the rest to buy sweets and drinks to sell in popular neighborhood stores with her son, who is her greatest support in this work. Her message to Kiva lenders is: "May you continue lending money to more people, so they can comfortably work and improve their financial situation." If you would like to know more about Amarís E.'s story, click this link.

loans.use: to purchase thin yarn for backpacks and purses, and to use the rest to buy sweets and drinks to sell in stores

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 78 years old and hardworking.  He is a married man with eight children.   He started a laundry business after retiring as a church pastor four years ago.  He joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that he would easily access loans because the members of the group guarantee each others loans.  George hopes to grow his business and open other branches and employ people.   He has requested a loan for 30, 000 Kes to rent a business premise and to buy an iron box.

loans.use: To rent a business premise and buy an iron box.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, a married father of three children, all of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food for the family.

For the past two years, Paul has operated a grocery shop, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the high cost of transportation as the major challenge in his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With the Kshs 15,000 loan, he wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, vegetables, onions, garlic, potatoes and ground nuts.

Paul dreams of expanding his business and operating as a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, vegetables, onions, garlic, potatoes and ground nuts.

loans.name: Damaris Esther

texts.es:
Damaris, es soltera, no tiene hijos, se dedica a la venta y elaboración de bisutería, este negocio lo inicio hace un año, junto a su madre, lograron comenzar un nuevo negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, hilo, piedras, broches de diferentes estilos, con esta inversión su negocio estará más fuerte, y con estos materiales podrá construir nuevos estilos de accesorios como collares, aretes, pulseras.
 Su objetivo es tener un negocio bien establecido, con mayores ingresos, que puedan cubrir todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Damaris is single and doesn't have any children.  Her business is making and selling costume jewelry.  She set up her business one year ago, together with her mother.  They managed to start a new business.

Damaris is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business: thread, stones and different styles of clasp.  This investment will strengthen her business and, with these materials, she will be able to make new styles of accessories such as necklaces, earrings and bracelets.

Damaris' goal is to have a well-established business which makes more money so that she can cover all her needs.

loans.use: to buy thread, stones and different styles of clasp for making necklaces and bracelets

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra María  actualmente  tiene  un  transporte  escolar  el  cual le permite  obtener  ingresos  para  sacar  adelante  a  su  familia, en esta  ocasión   necesita  de  nuestra  ayuda  para  realizar la compra  de herramientas para su transporte ya  que  le  surgieron  algunas   fallas  y   teme  en  que  estas   pudieran ocasionar     mayores  complicaciones    las   cuales originaran la  suspensión  del servicio, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en:
María currently has a vehicle used for school transportation.  It allows her to get income in order to get her family ahead.  

She now needs our help in order to buy tools for her vehicle because some defects have arisen.  She fears that these could cause greater complications leading to the suspension of her service.

She is grateful for the support given in order to fulfill her project.

loans.use: to make repairs on school transportation.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 42 years of age and is married to a farmer. They have two children. She has been running a livestock business for five years and earns PHP5,000 every four months. Grace is requesting a loan of PHP12,000 to purchase additional hogs to raise and hogfeed supplement. She raises hogs to gain income because she wants her two children to finish their education someday. She hopes to increase her business income.

loans.use: to purchase additional hogs to raise and pigfeed supplement

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is a married woman with one child. She lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. 

Jeralyn is a farmer. She started growing rice three years ago. She sells her harvest at her town's market. Jeralyn earns about 4000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. 

Jeralyn has requested a loan to purchase rice seed and fertilizers. She will also buy piglets to raise. Jeralyn hopes for her businesses to grow.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed, fertilizers, and piglets

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 34 years old, married and the father of two small children. For the last 14 years, he has earned a living by selling books and stationary in a store his father opened many years ago and worked very hard to improve. Today, the business is Hussein's major source of income and one reason why he is a loyal Al Majmoua borrower. He has taken out and repaid 10 previous loans, and has a reputation as a responsible and hard-working businessman. He is committed to provide his children with a good life and a top-notch education, and is applying for a new loan to make sure his store has the books and stationary required by most schools in his area. Hussein hopes to expand his business in the future by opening a second location.

loans.use: to buy school books and stationary for the upcoming 2011-2012 school year.

loans.name: Sandra Vanessa

texts.es: Sandra Vanesa tiene cuatro años en su negocio que es una pulpería, esta no es la primera vez que Sandra realiza financiamiento, la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a conversar y comprar los productos que ella ofrece, es una persona simpática y amable. Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, detergente, refrescos, papel higiénico, enlatados y sopas.  A pesar de los problemas de salud que tiene como es el asma, es una mujer luchadora y admirable.
texts.en: Sandra Vanesa has been in business for four years. She has a general store. This is not the first time that Sandra has taken out a loan. The majority of her customers come in to chat and buy her products. She is a very kind and likeable person. She is now requesting a loan for the purchase of basic grains, candies, detergent, drinks, toilet paper, canned goods and soups. Despite health problems such as asthma, she is a fighter and an admirable person.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, candies, detergent, drinks, toilet paper, canned goods and soups.

loans.name: Tujyinama / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Béatrice fait partie du groupe Tujyinama. Il est née au Rwanda et a 39 ans, Il est mariée et Il a 3 enfants de 2 et 6 mois à 21 ans, aucun enfant scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 
Béatrice est commerçante. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des pagnes  pour les revendre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’avoir des dépôts des pagnes pour vendre beaucoup plus en vie d’augmenter le capital. Dans les prochaines années, Béatrice voudrait devenir une grande commerçante et vendeur dans sa région, payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants et payer les frais médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Béatrice is part of the group Tujyinama. She was born in Rwanda and is 39 years old. She is married and has three children, from 2 and 6 months to 21 years old. None of the children are in school. She has a 6th grade eduction. 

Béatrice is a merchant. This loan cycle is her second one with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy pagnes (colorful West African cloth) to resell. Her strategy for business growth is to have warehouses of pagne cloth in order to sell a lot more with the aim of increasing her capital. 

Over the next few years, Béatrice would like to become a major merchant and seller in her region, to pay for schooling for her children, and to cover the medical costs for her family.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth (pagne) to resell

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Irene; tiene 44 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos  de 24, 21. 18, 14 años de edad;  La socia tenía antes de este nuevo negocio una tienda escolar, ella no ganaba mucho así que con el préstamo anterior pudo comprar mesas, sillas e implementar el local que tenía para poner un restaurante casero, la socia ahora es dueña de un muy acogedor restaurante en pleno corazón del valle de los incas, la socia se encarga de la elaboración de potajes regionales y esto la hace muy conocida en la zona, ella a futuro desea implementar mejor su restaurante y hacerlo campestre, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos como productos  para elaborar diversos potajes, papa, aceite, sal, arroz, entre otros.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Irene, 44, belongs to the “Solidaridad-Cachimayo” (Solidarity-Cachimayo) communal bank located in Cachimayo District in Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She’s married and has four children who are 24, 21, 18 and 14 years old.  Before this business she used to have a school supplies store but she didn’t earn much there so she used her previous loan to buy chairs and tables and turned the locale she had into a restaurant selling home-cooked meals  Now, she owns a very cozy restaurant right in the middle of the Valley of the Incas.  She makes regional dishes and this makes her very well known in the area.  In the future, she’d like to improve her installations and make it into a country inn.  She needs the loan to buy ingredients to prepare her various dishes like potatoes, oil, salt and rice, among others.

She is grateful for the support that will be provided and she commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Jose Gumercindo

texts.es:
Jose es un señor de 31 años de edad, el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada el Upala de San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela. En Alajuela existen cinco parques nacionales, una reserva nacional de fauna silvestre, cinco zonas protectoras y varias reservas forestales. También en la provincia se ubica el Museo Juan Santamaría, el cual exhibe artesanías producidas localmente. Esta zona ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña.

Desde hace varios años que Jose tiene este negocio de actividad agrícola, ya que cuenta en estos momentos con el propiedad que le heredaron sus padres, pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados. Dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante.

Actualmente Jose está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢200.000 (doscientos mil colones) para la compra de semillas de maracuyá. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Jose es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Delirio, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Jose is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and children in Upala de San Carlos in the province of Alajuela. In Alajuela there are five national parks, a national wildlife reserve, five buffer zones and several forest reserves. The Juan Santamaría Museum which showcases locally produced handicrafts is also located in Alajuela. This area takes first place nationally in both coffee and sugar cane production.

For several years, Jose has had this farming business as he now owns the property that he inherited from his parents. However, he lacks the key element to make his business grow and his neighbours in the community benefit. He says that the project is very interesting.

Currently Jose is seeking a small loan of 200,000 (two hundred thousand colones) (CRC) to buy passion fruit seeds.With this he hopes to grow his business and improve both his own and his family's quality of life.

Jose is a member of the communal bank Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Delirio, one of 110 member organisations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and with it he hopes to continue growing at a personal and economic level as well as participating actively in the microfinance organisation in his community,

loans.use: to plant passion fruit seeds.

loans.name: Saodatkhon

texts.ru: Саодатхон умная и честная женщина. Она вдова и любящая мать 3 детей. Ей тяжело одному обеспечить своих детей. Несмотря на все трудности, она работает усердно, чтобы содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. Чтобы зарабатывать на обеспечение семьи она начала заниматься торговаться в базаре. В 2000 году она начала свой бизнес с продажей женской и мужской верхней одежды, а постепенно перешла на продажу женских одежд. Саодатхон хотела бы получить займ для покупки новых одежд с целью расширения бизнеса и пополнения оборотного капитала. Она заранее благодарна вам всех за ваше внимание и поддержки.
texts.en: Saodatkhon is a smart and honest woman.  She is a widow and is loving mother of three children.  It is hard for her to provide for her children by herself, but, despite the difficulties, she works diligently to provide a good quality of life for them.  In order to earn money and support her family, Saodatkhon became involved in retail sales at the market.  She started her business in 2000 with the sales of women's and men's outerwear and gradually transitioned to selling women's clothing.  Saodatkhon wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of new clothing in order to expand her business and add to her revolving capital.  She thanks all of you in advance for your attentiveness and support.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Mergin

texts.en:
Mergin is 45 years old.  She is married with three children.

Mergin has a store that sells sweet coolers like halo halo and fruit salad.  She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Phillipine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional things needed, like boxes and ingredients in making the food products to sell.

Mergin has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future Mergin hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes for food products and ingredients to sell fruit salad.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married woman with four children; three are enrolled in school, while one is too young for school. Her husband is a teacher who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Josphine has operated a fuel selling business for the past three years. She also operates a grocery. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces the major challenge of fluctuating commodity prices. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this KES 40,000 loan, Josphine wants to purchase fuel to resell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it offers quality financial services to its clients.

loans.use: to purchase fuel to resell.

loans.name: Rosa Amanda

texts.es: Rosa Amanda vive con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a vender comida por la necesidad de sufragar los ingresos de su hogar. Todos los días vende sus platillos como gallo pinto, pollo asado, queso frito, tajaditas entre otros. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, maduro, queso, aceite, verduras, bolsas entre otros productos. de esa forma tendrá más variedad y ofrecerles a sus clientes el cual le ayudara a obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa Amanda lives with her husband and son. She sells food in order to cover her household expenses. Every day she sells her dishes such as gallo pinto (rice and beans), barbecued chicken, fried cheese and tajaditas (fried, sweet plantain). She is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, plantains, cheese, oil, vegetables, bags and other products. This will give her more variety to offer her customers which will help her to make better income.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, plantains, cheese, oil, vegetables, bags and other products

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.fr:
Marie Rose  est née au Rwanda et a 37 ans. Elle est mariée avec 5 enfants de 5 à 15 ans, tous sont scolarisés. Marie Rose a une autre personne en charge. Son niveau d’éducation est 2 ans de secondaire.

C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter une moto qu’elle va utiliser en transport rémunéré des personnes. L’accident de sa moto peut être la seule chose qui peut entrainer le mauvais remboursement de ce prêt.

Marie Rose voudrait offrir le service de qualité en service de transport. Elle va faire son mieux pour faire le suivi quotidien du chauffeur de sa moto. Marie Rose a une vision d’offrir plus tard le service de transport rémunéré des personnes avec une voiture au lieu de moto.  Avec le profit  Marie Rose va continuer la scolarisation de ses enfants, et elle va améliorer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Rose was born in Rwanda and is 37 years old. She is married with five children from 5 to 15 years old, all of whom are in school.  Marie Rose supports one other person.  She has two years of secondary education.

This is her first loan cycle with ACB.  She will use her loan to purchase a motorbike that she will use to provide paid transportation services.  Possibly the only thing that would inhibit her proper repayment of the loan would be an accident involving the motorbike.

Marie Rose would like to offer quality service in transportation.  She will do her best to follow the daily activity of the driver of her motorbike.  Marie Rose has a vision to later offer paid transportation services with a car instead of a motorbike.  With the profits, Marie Rose will continue the schooling of her children and improve the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike, which she will use for paid transportation services.

loans.name: Bayandelger

texts.en:
Bayandelger is a 29-year-old man who operates a clothing retail stall at a local market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Aside from his business at the market, he works as an excavator specialist at Hera Investment Co., Ltd., a company that supplies heavy machinery and equipment. As Bayandelger is often called out of town, his wife runs their clothing business. They sell women’s clothing imported from Beijing, China. 

Bayandelger is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase more clothing for this fall. He is a trusted client of Transcapital Company, Ltd., and he always pays his loans successfully and on time.  

Bayandelger has been saving his earnings with the intention of moving into an apartment and improving his and his wife's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a dried-fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by buying and selling salt. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her dried-fish-vending business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Rosesina

texts.en:
Rosesina is a 35-year-old married woman with four children. Three of the children are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for four years.

Rosesina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to buy a car in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina is a married woman with 7 children. She is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She tills her own land to grow rice crops to sell. Aside from farming, she also buys and sells vegetables in her community. She works hard to support her family. Celestina has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies. She hopes to earn better and be able to improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 49 years old and is married to Davson. They have three children. She has been running a retail shop for the past 11 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 8000.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20000. She will use the funds to purchase stock of sugar, salt, soda and rice. With the anticipated profits, she will educate her kids.

Her hopes and dreams are to venture into dairy farming.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, salt, soda and rice

loans.name: Valentine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de quatre personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Valentine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo, n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Valentine est âgée de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Valentine est veuve, mère de quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et un à sa charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par la bénéficiaire. Pour cette raison, Valentine vend depuis trente ans du gari (farine de manioc), du haricot et des ignames frites à son domicile. Valentine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Valentine ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, sollicite un troisième crédit. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du gari, du haricot et des ignames.

loans.name: Julio Raul

texts.es: Julio es un hombre trabajador de 40 años que vive en la localidad rural de Subin, la cual está ubicada en Moquegua. Él trabaja como obrero de construcción y también se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar dos reses orgánicas, espera vender su carne a un mejor precio por ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar su casa para vivir cómodamente y le gustaría casarse y tener hijos.

loans.use: Para comprar dos reses orgánicas para criar como ganado de engorde para vender su carne y así aumentar sus ingresos

loans.name: Amna

texts.en: Mi name is Amna E. I work preparing and selling tortillas, my business began 4 years ago. I have the help of my son who helps me packing the product, my clients are very good because I distribute my product in markets, and also accept requests for meetings and parties. My business produces income to support my family, my goal is to increase my production and my sales, and with the profit I will be able to improve my working place, support my family and give my son good studies, as he is almost finishing high school.

loans.use: To buy corn flour, salt, lime, wood, matches, coal.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.en: In Choluteca, most people know me as Don Clemen. I have been selling men’s clothing, men’s stockings and cooking apparel for two years. I visit different sites and offices to make my sales, and people can purchase goods as they need. I also have a small post at the market, where my wife sells ladies’ shoes and sandals. Our income is used to pay for our children’s education and food.

loans.use: Purchase of sandals, glasses, towels, etc.

loans.name: Guadalupe De Jesús

texts.en:
I have run a grocery store for 3 years now. My wife and I are in charge of it and it makes us very happy because it is the source of income for my family. It is what has allowed us to raise our 2 chldren and give them everything basic that they need. It has also allowed us to pay for our home and carry on with the business. Therefore, I am asking for a $1,200.00 loan so that we can expand the business and have more merchandise to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya 3 años con el negocio de abarrotes mi esposa y yo somos los que nos encargamos de el negocio estamos muy felices por que es la fuente de ingresos de la familia, es el que nos a dado para sacar adelante a nuestros 2 hijos y darles lo necesario y poder también pagar la casa don de vivimos y tenemos el negocio. Por lo cual estoy solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para poder ampliar el negocio y tener mas mercancía que vender.

loans.use: Expand the business and buy merchandise

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama J. is thirty-eight years old, married with five children.  Her husband has no job and Adama provides for the family’s basic needs.  She sells palm oil on a small scale around her home in Makeni Town in Sierra Leone, and she would like to expand her business.
