Adama would like to provide her children with at least a basic education but so far she can not do so as her income is insufficient to meet school expenses. She is requesting a loan of $175 to purchase 40 gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her inventory of palm oil

loans.name: Mohammadllah

texts.en: Mohammadllah lives in district 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with two children: one son and one daughter. They are small. His wife is a teacher, and she helps her husband with the family expenses. He has a workshop where he fixes TV's and radios. He decided to increase his business and move to a new shop, so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his shop and expand his business. He wants to support his family. He is happy.

loans.use: To finish his shop

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mrs. Yin T. was married in 1990 and has four children, one son and three daughters. In 2004 she started her business making and selling fish sausages. He husband helps her with this business, and he also raises ducks at home.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice before already. She is now asking for a loan of $700. She will use this loan to expand her fish sausage making business by purchasing another fish sausage making machine. She would also like to buy 100 baby ducks to raise at home.

loans.use: to buy another fish sausage making machine and a 100 baby ducks

loans.name: B.sumi

texts.id:
Since the end of 2007 there were many programs/activities that necessitate the use of trumpet. Sumi saw this opportunity. He has been selling toys all this time. As this opportunity, occurring only once a year should be capitalized. As the profit from selling trumpet usually double when sold towards the end of the year. Sumi conduct this with help from his son, as her husband had since deceased. The toys and trumpet are sold in surrounding areas using motorcycle where the back is equipped with wooden racks stacked with toys and trumpets. Capital for this business was Rp. 800.000,00 (about USD85) can hopefully increase profits which currently is Rp. 30.000,00 (USD3) daily.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Menjelang akhir tahun 2007 tentu akan ada banyak acara yang memerlukan terompet. Sumi melihat peluang ini. Selama ini memang dia menekuni usaha Jual Mainan. Namun, peluang yang datangnya hanya setahun sekali tentu perlu disikapi sebijaksana mungkin. Karena hasil dari penjualan terompetnya bisa berlipat – lipat apabila dijual menjelang akhir tahun. Sumi menekuni usaha ini dibantu oleh anaknya. Sedangkan suaminya sudah meninggal. Mainan dan terompet – terompet tersebut dijual dengan cara berkeliling menggunakan sepeda motor yang bagian belakangnya sudah ditambahi dengan rak kayu tempat mainan dan terompet tersebut. Modal usaha Rp 800.000,00 diharapkan dapat meningkatkan keuntungannya yang selama ini Rp 30.000,00/hari.

loans.use: Purchase toys and materials for making trumpet (Membeli mainan dan bahan - bahan membuat terompet.)

loans.name: Abir

texts.en: Abir is a 35-year-old mother of 1. She lives with her family in Aley. Abir does crochet work and is supporting her family with her business. This is the fourth time Abir is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs to buy the necessary material to sustain her business.

loans.use: To buy material for the business.

loans.name: Shirali

texts.en: Shirali is 36 years old and married with one child. They live in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan.  Shirali started selling hazelnuts 5 years ago and would like a loan of $850 to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To buy hazelnuts

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Mrs. María de Lourdes is mother of a 6-year-old boy and an 8-year-old girl. Like many enterprising women, two years ago, she decided to open up a gift and novelty shop called “La Pachanga” with the aim of generating her own income, thus not depending on her husband for both her personal and any unforeseen expenses.

She hopes to receive a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 monthly installments, so that she can become more prosperous and increase her clientele in the city of Mérida, Yucatán. Let’s help Lulú reach her goals!

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. María de Lourdes es madre de familia de 2 pequeños hijos un niño de 6 años y una niña de 8 años, como muchas mujeres emprendedoras ella decidió iniciar un negocio de venta de regalos y novedades llamado “La Pachanga” hace 2 años, con el fin de generar ingresos propios y así no depender de su marido para gastos personales y algunos imprevistos.

Espera recibir un crédito de US $250 que liquidara en 3 meses para poder comprar más mercancía para su negocio y que esto le permita prosperar más e incrementar sus clientes en la ciudad de Mérida, Yucatán. Ayudemos a Lulú a alcanzar sus metas!!.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Asha's Hatuchoki Group

texts.en:
Asha is 37 years old and is divorced with 3 children, ages 17, 14, and 3 years old. She also takes care of 2 other children, ages 26 and 20 years old. Asha began her business in 1998; today she conducts a mobile phone business and also sells soup. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who also has a small business. The members mutuA. guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other member is responsible.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Esnilda

texts.en:
Esnilda is twenty-five years old, and she and her husband have two daughters, aged of four and eight. To supplement the family’s income, she sells costume jewelry to women of her community. Esnilda explains that she’s started her business two years ago, and currently she has a lot of loyal customers.

The entrepreneur plans on using her loan to buy new fashionable jewels to add to her stock. She hopes that she’ll attract more people to her business, and increase her revenue.

Esnilda says that she’s putting aside money so that she can send her youngest daughter to school next year.

loans.use: Purchase of costume jewelry to retail in her community.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married. One of his sons and his family lived in Iran for eight years.

Ali came to Kabul one year ago and opened a photo copy shop. He still works in the shop and now he needs to expand his business. For this reason, he has requested an individual loan to complete his lease payments. He hopes that a larger shop will provide a good income to help better his family.

Ali is very happy because he has access to this loan and he is happy that these loans can help people around the world.

loans.use: To complete his lease payments

loans.name: María Luz

texts.es:
Maria is a very talented woman who always tries to offer her clientele the best finishes and quality in embroidered skirts. These skirts are typical outfits that are used during the customary festivals in the region. Since she was 6 years old, Maria has been dedicated to the art of embroidery. Her story started when she, herself, needed a skirt to participate in one of these festivals. Her curiosity and talent produced her first skirt. It was a well-made skirt and captivated the people who saw it. Since that day she has received various orders for her embroidered skirts.

Today Maria's dream is to continue producing, at a better quantity and quality, her orders, which have increased due to the upcoming Festival in her area. The majority of people come back to her because they know that she is the best. This is also the work of her husband, who occasionally helps her to embroider the skirts, when Maria runs out of supplies. They have 3 children and she is 33 years old, she has so much ahead of her. The loan she is requesting is to purchase supplies of fabric, colored thread, frames, sequins, and beads, which are the necessary materials to make her skirts. Support this small, but growing family business.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

María es una mujer muy talentosa que siempre trata de ofrecer a su clientela lo mejor en acabado y calidad en bordados de fustanes. Estos fustanes son trajes típicos que se utilizan en las fiestas costumbristas de la zona, desde hace 6 años María se dedica a este arte. Su historia comienza cuando ella misma tuvo la necesidad de un fustán para participar en una de estas festividades, su curiosidad y talento produjeron su primer fustán, el cual tenía un fino acabado y terminó cautivando a las demás personas que lo vieron y empezaron ha hacerle varios pedidos. Hoy, el sueño de María es seguir produciendo, a mayor cantidad y calidad, sus pedidos han aumentado debido a que se acerca el tiempo de fiesta en su localidad y la mayoría de personas recurren a ella porque saben que es la mejor. Tal es el trabajo que su esposo también la apoya bordando ocasionalmente algunos de los fustanes, cuando María ya no se da abasto, tienen tres hijos y a sus 33 años, María, tiene mucho por delante. El préstamo que solicita es para abastecerse de telas, hilos de colores, bastidores, lentejuelas y mostacillas, que son los materiales necesarios para el acabado de sus fustanes. Apoya esta pequeña, pero creciente empresa familiar.

loans.use: Supply materials needed to embroider typical skirts of Huancayo, the Festivals are close and her orders have increased but she does not have money for supplies.

loans.name: Attiogbe

texts.fr:
Mr Attiogbe D. was born in 1968 in Lomé. He is married and the father of three (3) children. He is a machinist and repairs sewing machines with replacement parts that he buys from the larger stores in Lomé. He is well known in his district as there are few people in Lomé that provide this service. He earns considerable revenue as he has a monopoly in his district. He also sells sewing machines. Presently, his stock has nearly run out and he must increase it. He is requesting his first loan to purchase ten (10) sewing machines and some replacement parts.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur D. Attiogbe est né en 1968 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il est machiste et répare les machines à coudre avec les pièces de rechange qu’il achète dans les grands magasins de Lomé. Il est reconnu dans son quartier car c’est une activité qui est rarement exercé par les gens à Lomé. Il gagne assez de revenu car il détient le monopole dans son quartier. Il vend aussi des machines à coudre. Actuellement son stock est presque épuisé et il désire le refaire. A cet effet, avec ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite il désire acheter 10 machines à coudre et quelques pièces de rechange.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machines and replacement parts

loans.name: Ortizer

texts.es:
Ortizer tiene 50 años, comparte su vida y su trabajo con su esposa. Se dedica, en su mayoría, a la producción de fréjoles, actividad que le toma todo el día, para ello tiene que salir muy de mañana de su hogar y trasladarse a sus chacras que están alejadas de su hogar, hay días que no regresa a su casa, aspecto que es muy común entre los agricultores, es algo a lo cual Ortizer está acostumbrado, ya que se dedica a ello por más de  30 años.Sin embargo, cuando  su producción hecha frutos es algo gratificante, el resultado de su trabajo y dedicación, de sobrellevar dificultades, limpiar y mantener sus terrenos productivos.
Ortizer tiene gran amor a su pareja, quien es el ser más importante para él  y quien lo motiva día  a día. Con el dinero que solicita tiene pensado incrementar su producción, sembrar gran cantidad y variedad de productos típicos de la zona, para ir asegurando su vejez y la de su pareja.
texts.en:
Ortizer is 50 years old. He shares his life and his work with his wife. He primarily works on the production of beans, an activity that takes up his entire day. For this, he has to leave his house very early in the morning and travel to the farm, which is located very far from his home. There are days when he does not return home, something that is very common among agricultural workers. It is something that Ortizer is accustomed to since he has spent more than 30 years doing it. However, when the production bears many fruits it is gratifying. It is the result of his work and dedication, of overcoming difficulties, cleaning and maintaining his productive lands.

Ortizer has a great love for his wife, who is the most important person for him and who motivates him day after day. With the money that he is seeking, he is thinking about increasing his production and growing a greater quantity and variety of products typical of the region so that he and his wife can be secure in their old age.


Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of agricultural products for his land

loans.name: Galo

texts.en:
Galo S., 37 years old, is married with four children.  She has three years of experience in the baking, ice cake business. She sells to the village people three days per week. In addition, she has had four previous loans with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about 166 USD). SPBD loans are Galo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She is looking to buy ingredients for her business. In addition, her husband and children help out.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients used in her ice cake business

loans.name: Walner Eliodoro

texts.es: Walner Eliodoro G. tiene la edad de 23 años habita en Veracruz, municipio de Managua, es casado,  su esposa Ana Barbera es ama de casa, tienen un hijo a su cargo de la edad de 2 años, Walner trabaja como Chofer de una Institución en Managua desde hace un año y medio; el pide el apoyo de AFODENIC ya que el techo de su vivienda esta muy deteriorado y las lluvias le están afectando, para lo cual necesita el crédito para comprar zinc y perlines e instalar un nuevo techo;  para ya no tener ese problema que le ha ocasionado mucha perdida materiales .
texts.en:
Walner Eliodoro Gutierrez, 23, lives in Veracruz, Managua. He is married; his wife Ana Barbara, is a stay-home mom who cares for their 2-year-old son. Walner has been working as a driver in a Managua agency for a year and a half. He is requesting a loan through AFODENIC to buy materials to replace his house roof. The roof is in very bad shape and the rains have caused great damage to his family's belongings.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacing the roof in his home.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 48 años, es casada, vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos jóvenes. Se dedica a administrar sus carros, que con mucho esfuerzo logró adquirir  hace  4 años, con los cuales su esposo y sus hijos trabajan en transporte de pasajeros. Esta actividad es una de  las que más le agrada realizar,  ya que aprende acerca del manejo de los ingresos y egresos que  tiene en su hogar, así puede prever para el mantenimiento de  sus  carros y sobre todo en la  distribución  de  las ganancias. Le es rentable porque en su comunidad los carros son pocos y la concurrencia de personas es abundante. Lo difícil de ello, es poder lidiar con algunas situaciones  graves, como reparar el carro cuando sufre de  algunos choques o accidentes. Se encuentra en su cuarto préstamo con MFP, desde entonces  a  trabajado en el banco comunal con mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos. Hermelinda comprará repuestos para sus carros y los llevara a la mecánica  para su debido mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, 48, is married and has three children. With hard work she bought several cars four years ago. Now her husband and children work transporting passengers and she manages the business. She enjoys this activity because she learns about balancing expenses and income, setting aside funds for car maintenance, and distributing the profits fairly. This business is profitable because in the community where Hermelinda lives few people own cars, and the need for transportation is great. The hard part of the business is to face difficult situations like major repairs or accidents. Hermelinda has requested four loans through Kiva partner MFP. She has been very responsible with her payments to the communal bank. With the loan she is requesting now, Hermelinda will purchase parts needed for her cars, and will take them to the mechanic for maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for auto parts and maintenance

loans.name: André Rosalina

texts.pt:
André Rosalina Z. é natural de Maputo, tem 37 anos de idade, é casado maritalmente e pai de 3 filhos, com idade entre 11, 9 e 2 anos respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta uma empregada que vive com ela.

André estudou até 12ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeira da família, cresceu com a sua mãe dado que perdeu seu pai muito cedo, estando no seu segundo casamento dado que a primeira divorciaram e esta a 4 anos que estão juntos. Neste momento vive numa casa arrendando e a sua ainda está em construção.

André para alem de negocio é voluntário numa organização de apoio aos meninos da rua, e tem uma mercearia onde aponta os lucros líquidos de 6000,00mt mensal conta com ajuda de uma empregada. Para André este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva.

André sonha daqui para frente concluir a sua casa, casar oficialmente e comprar uma viatura para família e ajudar nas compras.
texts.en:
A native of Maputo, André Rosalina Z. is a 37-year-old married father of 3 children (of 11, 9 and 2 years of age). Along with his children, he also supports a live-in maid. André studied up until the 12th year and stopped because of his family's lack of financial conditions. He was raised by his mother because he lost his father at a young age. His mother is in her second marriage (of four years). The first ended in divorce. His mother lives in a rented house, and André's home is still under construction. Apart from his business, he also works as a volunteer in an organization that supports children living on the streets. He also has a grocery store where he employs one worker. This is André's first loan. He dreams of finishing his home, marrying officially, and purchasing a vehicle for the family.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and sell a variety of products

loans.name: Aajer Safy Group

texts.en:
Hajera is the group leader of Hajera Safy group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive a loan for his/her own business.

Malally and Hajera want to take out a loan for their business of beading, and Howsey wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. Galally wants to take out a loan for her husband’s business. They all want to buy necessary materials for their businesses.

They want to say that this loan is very useful because it can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses and become stronger in their business and life. This group wants to thank all the lenders for this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials for their individual businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Tomasa Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Tomasa tiene 60 años de edad, reside en el  Barrio 380 en la ciudad de Managua, sus hijos son independientes, la Sra. Tomasa trabaja de conserje desde hace nueve años, sus metas es poder terminar de hacer las mejoras a su vivienda que gracias a los prestamos de Afodenic ha logrado poder mejorar su casa con esta solicitud es la octava la cual va invertir en comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de hacer un muro en la parte de enfrente para tener mas seguridad de la delincuencia. Y poder gozar de sus esfuerzos.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 60 years old and lives in Barrio 380 in the city of Managua. Her children are independent. Tomasa has worked as a concierge for nine years. Her goal is to be able to finish her home improvements, which she has been able to start thanks to Afodenic loans. With this, her eighth loan, she will invest in the purchase of construction materials to finish building a front wall to increase security against vandalism, and thus be able to enjoy her efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Kishwar Sultana

texts.en:
My name is Kishwar sultana and I am a married woman and the mother of four daughters. I have been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 35 years. I completed my education up to the 5th standard but couldn’t read more because my parents couldn’t afford my education expenses. I married a man whose name is M. A. and he has a government job and works as a security guard on monthly wage.

I manufacture thread-chain which I sell to the goldsmiths and they use it to tie up the jewelry. My daughters help me in the making of thread-chains. I’ve successfully repaid my five loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy more thread to expand my thread-chain making business.

loans.use: To buy thread for making thread-chains

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас - молодая женщина 27 лет, эамужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж работает пастухом. Она откармливает крупно-рогатый скот дома, а муж пасет мелко-рогатый  скот в горах. После 2-3 месяцев откармливания, они продают скот на базаре. Этим они зарабатывают на жизнь. Мукаддас хочет купить еще одну дойную корову, чтобы и откармливать и доить молоко для своих детей.
texts.en:
Mukaddas is a young woman of 27 years old, married and has two children. Her husband works as a shepherd. She raises cattle at home and her husband shepherds smaller cattle in the mountains. After two to three months of feeding they resell the cattle on the market. This is how they earn their living. Mukaddas wants to buy one more milk cow to feed it and have milk from it for her children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For raising and reselling of cattle

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose B. is a 52-year-old divorced mother of two children: a son and a daughter. Her son is into commercial driving, while her daughter studies in the senior high school. Rose lives with her two children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana.

Rose trades in second hand textiles—clothes for both genders as well as bed sheets. She procures bales of textiles from Accra and sells in her community by hawking. Rose says she also travels to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in the business for five years and desires to expand her business. She hopes to improve her standard of living and support her children’s further education.

loans.use: To procure second hand textiles

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina A. started her local restaurant nine years ago at Mankessim, where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 38 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are currently attending schooling. She serves many kinds of local dishes like fufu, rice balls, banku, and ampesi among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. Ampesi is a boiled plantain or yam and it is taken with any stew. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Georgina hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children’s education. She belongs to the village called ‘St. Peter’s’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
"Twenty-five years, we have been farming. My husband and I grow rice to be able to feed and clothe our family. We wanted to grow our business more so that we could send our child to school and be able to provide her a brighter future," says Rosie S., a 46-year-old mother of one child. In addition to growing rice, she also raises pigs. Raising pigs is another way she thinks could supplement her family's income.

She would like to ask for a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals. The loan will really help to improve their harvest and sustain their pig business.

CEVI is providing financial services to the poor. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is a widowed mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. Some are still in school – junior high and the primary schools. She is seventy years old. Mary lives with her children in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She is a baker. She bakes bread in her community. Mary supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks to sell as well. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Kumasi. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Benkelema 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix femmes du groupe Benkelema 2 sont toutes mariées et  résident à Flacoda un hameau de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. Elles ont  une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, de 5 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne (prêt agricole) de Soro Yiriwaso,qui correspond avec leur activité étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne après avoir correctement  le premier.
Elles veulent utiliser ce prêt  actuel pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles veulent cultiver 20 hectares d’arachide et de riz et  envisagent obtenir une production moyenne de 3 tonnes à l’hectare soit 60 tonnes de céréales à la fin des récoltes.
Une partie de  la récolte sera consommée, l’autre sera stockée d’abord  puis vendue à un moment où les céréales ont de la valeur.
Le bénéfice réalisé sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, prendre en charge certaines dépenses de la famille et acheter les trousseaux de mariages des filles.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Benkelema 2 are all married and reside in Flacoda, a hamlet in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba in the third administrative region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali.  The women average 37 years of age and five children, and they live in polygamous families.  They know one another through ties of kinship and community. With the introduction of Soro Yiriwaso farm loans (agricultural loans), which match their work, they being peasants, these women seized the opportunity and are now on their second farm loan after having correctly repaid the first one.  The group members want to use the current loan for the costs of labor and weeding and for buying seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides.  They want to cultivate 20 hectares of peanuts and rice and envision obtaining an average production of 3 tonnes per hectare, thus 60 tonnes of grain when the harvesting is over. Part of the harvest will be consumed, and the rest will first be stored and then sold when the grains have some value.  The realized profit will be used for repaying the loan, for covering certain family expenses, and for buying wedding items and accessories for the daughters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and weeding

loans.name: Asomdwehene 2 Group

texts.en:
Angelina is 29 years old and the group leader. She is a divorced mother with four children. Currently all her children attend school in the community where they live. She sells smoked fish and started in this business six years ago at the local community market. She buys stock from Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana. She serves her customers very tasty and high quality fish and, because of the quality, many customers buy from her stand. She buys stocks of fish from the fishmongers occasionally, when demand is high. She has a large customer base as a result of her moderate prices and her pleasant disposition towards her customers. She is requesting a loan to upgrade her stock of fishes. She aspires to give her children quality education through the proceeds from the business and she would be grateful for your support.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Asomdwehene 2’ which literary means 'prince of peace.' She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. In this group, members vouch for one another as social collateral to access the loan and apply peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To upgrade her stock of fishes.

loans.name: Simon Njoroge

texts.en:
Simon N. is married with one child. He is 29 years old and he lives in Muguga, Kikuyu area. Muguga is a relatively busy shopping center hence, his customers are the daily shoppers. He has been in this business of selling charcoal(fuel) for the last three years and he intends to grow it so that he can establish a wholesale shop.

He got to know about KADET through a marketing done by KADET staff in the area and he had never borrowed from other sources before. This will be his third loan and his credit repayment history has been good and done on time. He will use the finance from this loan to restock the business.

He has zeal for this venture and believes that he will be successful.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Buying more charcoal so that he can restock his business.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn P. is from the village of  Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Merlyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn sells snacks, like boiled bananas, and other delicacies and peddles in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Merlyn's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She sells sarongs of various colours. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de pagne et de trousseaux de bébé

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel M. V. reside en Mejicanos en el departamento de San Salvador. Miguel tiene 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos de 21,20 y 16 años de edad, todos estudiantes. Miguel y su esposa trabajan para poder brindarle una educación superior a sus hijos quienes ahora se encuentran cursando la universidad y son el orgullo de esta pareja de padres. La esposa de Miguel se dedica a vender artículos de manera ambulante y Miguel da servicios de transporte a través de su taxi, la zona donde Miguel circula es muy transita y solicitada de su servicios, son ya nueve años los que lleva realizando dicha actividad. El solicita de un crédito para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y reparaciones menores que necesita ; ya que reconoce que su Taxi es su herramienta de trabajo y es de suma importancia mantenerlo en las mejores condiciones posibles.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel M. Vasquez resides in Mejicanos in the town of San Salvador. Miguel is 44 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and children of 21, 20 and 16 years of age, all students. Miguel and his wife work in order to provide a superior education to their children who are now in college and are a proud set of parents. Miguel's wife sells items on the street, and Miguel offers transport services with his taxi. The area where Miguel works is very busy, and so many people request his services. It has now been nine years since he has been doing that activity. He is requesting the loan to maintain his vehicle and complete needed minor repairs. Recognizing that his taxi is his means for work, it is very important to keep it in the best possible condition.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Taxi vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Vive junto a su esposa y un nieto de 5 años de edad en el caserío La Pava, distrito de Mochumí, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis años se dedica a comercializar sacos de polvillo (un derivado del arroz utilizado como alimento para animales), adquiere su mercancía en los molinos de arroz de la ciudad de Chiclayo y la comercializa principalmente en las bodegas de Mochumí y entre sus vecinos que crían animales. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con el que sostiene a su familia.

El nos comenta que trabajaba en un molino antes de empezar con su actual negocio. Luego debido a su edad tuvo que dejar el trabajo y esto lo motivó a buscar nuevas opciones con las que pueda seguir manteniendo a los suyos.

La constante demanda por parte de sus clientes ha hecho que Manuel piense en comprar más sacos de polvillo con los que pueda ampliar su negocio. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los que piensa lograr su objetivo.

Manuel es trabajador y muy responsable. Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como comerciante y brindarle a su familia la calidad de vida que ellos necesitan.
texts.en:
Manuel, 59, is married and has three children. He lives with his wife and his 5-year-old grandson in the La Pava farming community, Mochumí district, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 6 years he has sold sacks of polvillo (a type of animal feed derived from rice). He acquires his merchandise in Chiclayo's rice mills and sells it primarily to stores in Mochumí and among his neighbors who raise animals. This is his only source of income with which he supports his family. He has told us that he used to work in a mill before starting his current business but, due to his age, had to leave his job in the mill and seek new options with which to continue supporting his loved ones. His customers' constant demands have motivated Manuel to buy more sacks of polvilo with which to enlarge his business. For this reason, he is asking Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 new soles to reach his goal. Manuel is hard-working and responsible. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a merchant and to provide his family with the quality of life they need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase polvillo (an animal feed derived from rice).

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is single and 55 years old. To make a living, she sells bamboo shoots in the market of Cauayan, Isabela.  It has been her main source of income for years now, and supports her needs. She lives in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela.

Rosalinda is hoping to obtain a loan of 6,000 PHP to use as additional capital to purchase more bamboo shoots for resale in the market. Her business is really a big help in supporting her daily needs. She hopes that it will continuously be maintained, not only to help herself, but also to help her other relatives that need her help. As a single woman, she also wants to have some savings for herself which could be used in case of emergency.  She hopes to earn more profits in order to attain what she wants.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more bamboo shoots

loans.name: Abravi

texts.fr: Cette dame est veuve et assume seule l’éducation scolaire de son enfant. Elle a appris la coiffure ; malheureusement, ce métier ne lui rapporte pas comme elle le souhaite. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle a décidé en 1989 de se lancer dans la vente de pagnes de qualités et des produits cosmétiques dans le quartier d’Avédji à Lomé, dans son atelier de coiffure. Elle vend également des sacs de sortie pour dames. Ce nouveau commerce lui rapporte bien et elle se réjouit donc de cette nouvelle activité. C’est pour renouveler son stock en baisse en ce moment qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des pagnes et certains produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
This woman is a widow, and she assumes sole responsibility for educating her child.  She has learned how to style hair.  Unfortunately, this trade did not bring in what she wished from it.  For this reason, she decided to embark on the sale of quality pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and cosmetics in 1989 in the district of Avédji in Lomé, there in her hair salon.  She also sells women's purses.  This new business is gainful for her, and so she is delighted with it.  To replenish her diminished stock at this time, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy some pagnes and certain cosmetic products. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying "pagne" cloth and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Jeanina

texts.es: Jeanina F. N. de 30 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad, junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Ella como toda madre trabajadora la cual desea poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, posee una venta de frutas y verduras, productos los cuales vende mucho ya que ella es una persona muy amable la cual brinda precios justos para sus clientes. Jeanina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras y frutas de temporada y de esta manera aprovechar la temporada navideña para mejorar sus ganancias y de esta manera poder brindarles una mejor navidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jeanina F. N. is 30. She lives in the La Libertad department with her husband and three minor children. She, like all hard-working mothers, wants to give her children all of the necessities. She has a business selling fruit and vegetables. She sells a lot of these products because she is a very amiable person who offers her customers fair prices. Jeanina is asking for a loan to be able to buy a greater quantity of vegetables and seasonal fruits. This way she will take advantage of the Christmas season to improve her earnings and be able to give her children a better Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
N. Angela is a businesswoman, 39 years old, and the mother of two kids. She has a fabric shop in Abaita Ababiri Trading Centre. She started her business nine years ago.

Angela is using her loan to purchase garments or clothing material for Gomesi (a long, formal, colorful full-length dress for women) and bisilo (belts to tie a Gomesi) so as to expand her business.

Angela wants to construct some rental houses and she wishes to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase garments or clothing material to expand her business

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Amparo tiene negocio de venta de comida, el crédito lo utilizara para invertirlo al negocio incrementando su capital de trabajo y así poder tener un mayor ingreso para su familia, la señora ha tenido tres créditos con CEPRODEL y con ellos ha mejorado su calidad de vida ya que podido mejorar su negocio,   es madre de 4 hijos de los cuales dos están en edad escolar y dependen de ella.
Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en la alcaldía de Nindirí trabaja de lunes a viernes y los días sábados y domingos vende comida en su casa esto para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos a los cuales quiere much
texts.en:
Señora Amparo has a business selling food. She will use this loan to invest in her business and to increase her working capital so she can have a better income for her family. She has had 3 loans with Ceprodel, and with them, she has improved her quality of life and her business. She is the mother of 4 children, 2 of whom are of school age and still depend on her. Her business is located in the town of Nindirí, and she works there from Monday through Friday. On Saturdays and Sundays, she sells food in her home to be able to take good care of her children, whom she loves very much.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ramen noodles, toilet paper, soft drinks, juices, purified water, and candy

loans.name: Sliveny

texts.en:
Sliveny sells spices to earn a living. Spices in Nigeria are used in the preparation of delicious Nigerian soup such as egusi soup (melon soup). The demand for her soup spices is high. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more spices to sell. 

Sliveny is married to a commercial driver and they are blessed with 5 children. Her youngest child is 6 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. She hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more spices to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane B. is married and lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her supportive husband Orlando, a tricycle driver. She has three children. All of the children are currently studying at high school and grade school. Mary Jane is a hard working entrepreneur engaged in selling native products. She has been in business working as an entrepreneur for almost 8 years. 

Mary Jane would like to receive a loan amounting 35,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory for selling the native products.   She is planning to purchase a variety of products such as native bags, accessories, and more supplies. She believes that having a larger variety of inventory will help her to retain her current customers as well as to attract new clients in the neighborhood.

A proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines since 2003, Mary Jane has been a dedicated member, having regular attendance to weekly center meetings and solid records in repayments on previous loans.

Her long-term goals are to purchase a new van so she can expand her business to the nearby town of Morong. By owning her own transportation, Mary Jane will save time and money in purchasing a greater variety of inventory as well as selling products in other villages. With her hard work, focus, and determination, Mary Jane is hopeful that her business of selling native products will continue to grow and will improve the overall standard of living for her entire family.

She is happy that her living condition is better than in the past because she could generate more income from the business. Mary Jane would like to send all the best wishes to all the lenders around the world who are sponsoring this loan. She hopes that they will support her again in the future.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products such as native bags, accessories, and more supplies.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim M., age 31, (in the picture) and her husband, Mr. Het Hun, age 35, live along National Road Number Six about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1997 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of them are in school. Besides her children, she also has her mother living with her. 

Sim and her husband have been farming for ten years. They grow vegetables and rice on the farmland in the village. Sim is asking for her first loan of US$600 in order to purchase pipe and a water pumping machine to irrigate the vegetables and rice on her farm.

loans.use: To purchase pipe and a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita L. is from the village of Sugarland, Lumbo, Valencia City. She is 39 years old. Anita is married and has 4 school-aged children. Anita owns & operates a retail store where she sells vegetables, daily use products and beverages. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Anita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Anita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kuoh

texts.en:
Born in 1969, Kuoh J. is married and has three children. He faces difficulties in taking care of his family, especially when they are sick.

Kuoh had been having difficulties trying to raise business capital. He had tried borrowing money from other financial institutions but had repayment problems due to high interest rates.

Dressmaking is a very profitable trade in his community so he decided to obtain a loan from GHAPE in order to carry out this trade. He has received and repaid loans twice from GHAPE. He knows he will succeed in the trade because he has been doing this trade for a very long time and also has so many customers.

J.’ loan would be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and thread

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mr. Sary L., 61 years old and a resident of Ta Pech village in Kandal Province, is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice. Sary is requesting a loan to buy fertilize and gasoline to support his crop.  His wife, Mrs. Yorn Duch, shown on the left in the picture, owns a washing place for motorcycle washing. With both businesses they can earn a small income to support their family. This couple has two children who are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilize and gasoline

loans.name: Damaso

texts.es:
Damaso es productor lechero.  Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi Prov. Omasuyos a 2 horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera para incrementar su producción de leche.

Es su tercer crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Damaso is a dairy producer. This activity is the main source of the income he uses to support his family. His home is located in the community of Tahari-Achacachi, in Omasuyos Province, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. He will use the loan to buy a dairy cow, in order to increase his milk production. This is his third loan with IMPRO; his excellent payment record qualified him to apply for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a dairy cow

loans.name: Adom Bi Keke Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Mary A. describes herself as hard-working, a woman who sees no challenge too great. She is 50 years old and is the leader of the “Adom bi keke” borrower group, translated as “Just by Grace”. Mary is a manufacturer of local soap popularly known as ‘Azuma blow’ because it looks like the blow of the renowned Ghanaian boxer named Azuma Nelson. 

The soap is prepared by combining materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil and hardener to obtain the soap. The soap can be used for bathing, washing and the like. It is relatively very affordable and much patronized in the rural communities. Mary has operated her business for the past twenty years and is excited to be taking out this loan, with which she plans to purchase ingredients for soap-making.

Mary is divorced and she is the mother of six children. The other members in the group are also engaged in trades such as food-selling, palm oil production, grocery sales, used clothes sales, etc. They plan to invest the loan to purchase stock in bulk to grow their businesses. They hope to make more savings to be able to provide a good education for all their children.

loans.use: To purchase soap-making ingredients

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 42 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eduardo de 48 años y sus 4 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a su esposo, Dina trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de muy buena calidad. Ella principalmente siembra plátano y café, ya que estos productos son muy solicitados en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lleva  24 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas, considera además que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos. Para el futuro espera poder comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción actual. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, lo invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará abono.
texts.en:
Dina, 42, is a very happy and hard-working mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Eduardo, 48, and their 4 young children, to whom they want to offer a better quality of life. With her husband, Dina works every day in the fields. With much work she has achieved great productivity from her land, and she now plants everything, since she knows that every product she obtains will be of very good quality. She mainly plants plantains and coffee, since these products are in high demand in the market of the Pichanaki city. For 24 years she has done this work and what she most loves about her job is keeping her crops safe from pests. She considers her greatest difficulty to be transporting her crops. In the future she hopes to purchase more land to increase her production. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she feels that this loan will help her greatly in the development of her activity. In her community group she is a very responsible member, of which she is very proud. The 2000 soles she is requesting will be invested in improving her crops; for this, she will buy fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for improved production

loans.name: We Praise God Group

texts.en:
J. F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'We Praise God'. He is 77 years old, married, and has six children who range from 40 to 7 years old. He was not able to attend school due to poverty.  

For 20 years, he has been selling drinks (alcoholic beverages) in Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 9,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 41,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more drinks (alcoholic beverages). He describes himself as peaceful. His dream is to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more drinks (alcoholic beverages)

loans.name: Mrs. Kroeun Chou Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people have been selected by Mrs. Kroeun C. is a village bank president who is 49-year-old located in Char village, Takeo province. All the members will use portion of their loan for different purposes in which it can improve their businesses. Mrs. Kroeun C. and her husband, Mr. Muon Mea, are farmers who rent two-hectare plot land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family and she is also a pig breeder. Through this activity, they support three children, two of whom are weavers, while the other is a student in school. Since her children’ business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve this purpose, Mrs. Kroeun C. is asking for a loan to buy more silk and rest of the loan she hires plow machine to plow her field.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
At the age of 54, Barbara C. is still single she really works hard to support her needs. In order to earn a living she ventures in rice retailing in their community. Barbara usually earns approximately 4000 PHP a month in these activities. With this income she has been able to purchase her daily needs. Barbara has been engaged in her business for over 2 years. Barbara lives in the village of Allinguingan 3rd.

In 2008, Barbara joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Barbara has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Barbara is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Barbara from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn K., 31, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean temples. K. and her husband sell vegetables for an income of USD 3 each per day to help cover the family expenses.  K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more vegetables for resale.

 In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s studies.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Zuberi

texts.en: Zuberi is a married woman and she has one child who attends school. She has been operating a clothes selling business for the last three years, selling her wares door to door to friends and neighbors. With the KES20,000 requested in this loan Zuberi would like to purchase a fridge to start a soft drink sales business, with hopes to open a retail shop in future. The major challenge she currently faces in her business is seasonality. Zuberi lives in a rented house which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent. Zuberi decided to work with Yehu because of its good reputation from the community.

loans.use: To buy a fridge to start a soft drinks sales business.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes de 45 años de edad  trabaja como docente en la Escuela Vigarmy Flores Castro desde hace 25 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos: el mayor de  25 años de edad estudia su tercer año de Educación secundaria y la hija menor de 12 años estudia su sexto grado de Educación primaria. 

Está solicitando  su 9no credito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda construyendo la cocina de su casa lo cual le brindarà mayor comodidad a su familia,  esta clienta se ha destacado por ser responsable , honesta, trabajadora, y de cuidar sola a sus hijos, a pesar que son personas humildes son una familia muy unida, viven en un una colonia  donde cada día se va aumentando la población , su sueño es ir mejorando la vivienda y que su hijos sigan preparando para que lleguen hacer alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is 45 years old. She has been a member of the teaching staff at the Vigarmy Flores Castro school for the past 25 years. She is the single mother of 2 children. Her elder child is now 25 and in his third year of higher education. Her daughter is 12 years old and in 6th grade at primary school. Maria is seeking her 9th loan. She will invest it in improving her home, by building a new kitchen that will better accommodate her family. This client [of the field partner] has shown herself to be a responsible, honest, and hard-working woman who takes good care of her children, and while they are humble people, they are a very close family. They live in an area where they population is growing daily, and it is Maria's dream to go on improving her home and that her children go on learning so that they can make something of themselves in life.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kitchen

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is from the village of Bolinao. She is 35 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns a business making and selling food and drinks to passengers in the bus terminal.She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter A. O. is a married lady with three children aged between nine years old and three years old. Her business is located at Manyatta, a busy market in Kisumu. Kisumu is in Nyanza province and boarders Western Kenya. The region is well known for production of Tilapia fish and Omena from lake victoria. 

Benter owns a general store in which she sells such items as rice, sugar, cooking oil and detergents. She has been in this kind of business for three years now and sells to the local households. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is low income as her customers thus cannot afford to buy the items frequently, hence slowing down stock movement. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more general items to grow her business. She also sees herself diversifying into agriculture and the fish export business. She describes herself as hardworking optimistic and motivated.

loans.use: To buy supplies of detergents, rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil etc

loans.name: Mercy Njambi

texts.en:
Mercy has been selling shoes in Olkalou town for the last 20 years.  She is 40 years old, married to James Wahome, and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy more shoes for sale.

In future, Mercy hopes to move into her own permanent shop from where she will be selling her shoes. She is a  very hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale

loans.name: Tap

texts.en: Tap V. is 42 years old. He has a business making rice wine and raising pigs. He lives with his wife and four children in Takeo Province. On average, he makes US $3.00 per day while his wife sells grocery products, typically making US $1.00 each day. Three of their children are in school and one is a garment factory worker. Tap V. wants to take a loan of US $400 to raise more pigs.

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Elma

texts.es: Elma, de 60 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de sus 3 hijos mayores, que trabajan; y  juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de bebidas, según la temporada; es decir durante el verano comercializa chicha morada (bebida hecha en base a maíz morado), y jugos de frutas; y en temporada de invierno vende café. Dice que  le gusta mucho su labor pues la realiza en una mesa que esta instalada afuera de su vivienda, de manera ambulatoria,  y desde ahí no descuida las labores de su hogar. Lo que no le gusta es que no puede vender hasta muy tarde pues aún no tiene licencia de funcionamiento del negocio. Sin embargo, tiene muchos planes para mejorar el negocio de venta de bebidas; y quiere habilitar un pequeño ambiente de su casa para vender en ese lugar de manera más estable. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Elma tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de artículos descartables (vasos de diferentes variedades), además de ingredientes para sus bebidas como maíz, frutas, azúcar y café que necesita para seguir trabajando sin problemas.
texts.en:
Elma is 60 years old.  She lives in her own home with her 3 grown-up children who work.  They all work hard every day to get ahead in life.

This enterprising woman sells drinks according to the season.  That is to say, in summer she sells 'chicha morada' (a drink made from purple corn) and fruit juices.  In the winter, she sells coffee.  She says that she likes her work a lot because she sells her drinks from a table just outside her home, as a street trader, which means that she doesn't have to neglect her housework.  What she doesn't like is that she can't sell until very late in the day because she still doesn't have an operating licence for her business.  However, she has many plans to improve her business.  She would like to adapt an area of her home so that she can sell her products there in a more stable manner.

This is Elma's second loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments punctually because she doesn't want to make a bad impression on the people who have made the loan possible as it will allow her to continue working in search of progress.

Elma plans to invest her loan in buying disposable products (different types of cups) as well as ingredients for her drinks such as corn, fruit, sugar and coffee which she needs if she is to continue working without any problems.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as sugar, corn and coffee.  To buy disposable cups.

loans.name: 28 -Cho- Dien Bien Group

texts.en:
Lan T. T. (127) is a 49 year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Lan is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 28 -Cho- Dien Bien (03.01.28 Dien Bien).

Lan is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, Lan runs a food stall. Lan has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4248000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 5310000 VND, which also will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken by Lan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

About the other borrowers in the group:
1.  N. T. Hoa (125) is a 61-year-old woman who is requesting a 5310000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

2.  L. T. Tinh (126) is a 56-year-old woman who is requesting a 5310000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3.  H. T. Loan (124) is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 5310000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of  Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lan T. T. (127) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Lan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 28-Cho - Dien Bien (03.01.28 Dien Bien).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Lan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lan kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Lan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.248.000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.310.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Hoa (125) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.310.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  L. T. Tinh (126) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.310.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  H. T. Loan (124) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.310.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a member of Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, with the Jasho Letu group. He runs the Master B. transport business. He has been engaged in this business for five years and has managed to employ eight people. In addition, he operates a retail shop to earn extra income.
Faulu Kenya has played a significant role in Wycliffe's business by funding him. This has helped him to improve his business. Wycliffe is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to repair his van. He dreams of purchasing two more vans for transport in the future.

loans.use: To repair his van

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cosmetóloga y también tiene una tienda de abarrotes, la socia atiende el salón de belleza desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia quiere ampliar los negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar sus negocios.             

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "MADRES TRABAJADORAS" (WORKING MOTHERS) communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, in Cusco Province in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Juana is 43 years old and married with two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her cosmetology business.  She also has a grocery store.  And she operates a beauty salon from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  Through her different small business activities she is able to provide an income for her family.  Her goal is to expand business and her plans are to use the loan to help her reach that goal.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To expand her retail business

loans.name: Mrs. Pann Sameur Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 14 people located in Trapeang Young village in Takeo province. Each member will use their portion of the loan in various ways to support their family.
Mrs. Pann S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is a widow who lives with five members in her household. Mrs. Pann S. is a farmer who owns a 1.2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. She also works as a weaver. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Pann S. is applying for a loan to buy more silk for weaving.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita B. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old. Carmelita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita sells AVON personal products such as glasses, watches, and cosmetics, in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. That loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Carmelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: O'yah

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old O'yah B.. She is married, and has two children, aged 6 and 4. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they are her nieces and nephews.  

In 2009, O'yah established her sport shoe, T-shirt and vest business. She began her business because she wants to get a means of caring for her family. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,600,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000 in order to expand her product offerings. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 730,000. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing for her business

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Boubacar Sangaré est un homme marié de 30 ans qui vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, il décida tôt de mener une activité génératrice de revenus pour subvenir à ses besoins. Il a tenté pendant des années différentes activités à  Sikasso, mais sans succès, alors il rentre au bercail, à Bougouni, pour apprendre la menuiserie bois auprès de son ami. Avec une expérience de plus 10 ans, il maîtrise son activité et fabrique des meubles, chaises etc.
Pour obtenir un fonds, monsieur Boubacar Sangaré décida de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, 30  planches de bois, 10 boites de colles, 20 kilo de pointes.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni, à Manankoro et en Côte d’Ivoire.  Tous les prêt précédents de Boubacar ont été correctement remboursés.
Il  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour améliorer son atelier.
texts.en:
Mr. Boubacar Sangaré, age 30, is married and lives with his wife and his child in a nuclear family at the Hérémakono Nord neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. Having never attended school, he decided early on to work and earn money to provide for himself.

For many years, he tried various businesses in Sikasso, but with no success. He then went back to Bougouni, his hometown, to learn furniture making from a friend. After ten years of experience, he masters his trade and manufactures furniture, chairs, etc.

To obtain funding to buy 30 wood planks, 10 boxes of glue, and 20 kg of nails, Mr. Boubacar Sangaré is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  He gets his supplies in Bougouni, Manankoro, and in Côte d'Ivoire.

All his previous loans were repaid without problems. He intends to turn a monthly profit of XOF 65'000 (ca US$ 135), to be used to improve his workshop.

loans.use: to buy 30 wood planks, 10 boxes of glue, and 20 kg of nails

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 53 years old and married with three children.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock.

Yolanda has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from her carinderia/eatery and coffee shop.

Yolanda aspires to expand her business and to do business repairs.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Ma. Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Ma Guadalupe es una persona muy luchadora que le gusta salir adelante por si misma, tiene muchos deseos de seguir trabajando su negocio tiene como propósito surtir de marcación como es de zapatos, accesorios de belleza, ropa de temporada de verano y juguetes. 
Pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para esta inversión es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así tener surdido de mercancía y sus ventas serán mucho mejor.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para ella.
texts.en:
