Ma Guadalupe is a fighter. She likes to get ahead through her own hard work and wishes to continue working.  Her business is to sell items such as shoes, beauty accessories, summer clothing, and toys.

At the time being she does not have the money she needs to grow her business. For this reason, she is requesting this loan to be able to supply more merchandise and improve her sales figures.

She plans to repay this loan with a part of the income generated from this business.  The other portion is her source of income for her living expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Angela Yahaira

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Trabajando Para Un Futuro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable y trabajadora.

La señora Angela es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 10, 6 y 5 años de edad los mismos que  estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es maestro en cerrajería.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudad a su esposo realiza el crédito para el negocio del marido, el mismo que tiene un taller de cerrajería (Taller de metales) en el cual realiza diversidad de trabajos como puertas, ventanas, canales de agua entre otras cosas. Trabaja de lunes  a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 con la ayuda de dos personas a quienes les paga un sueldo semanal. Por su parte nuestra amiga también se dedica a la cría de gallinas y otras aves de corral. Nos cuenta que su esposo tiene este taller ya por seis años y que gracias a Dios nunca le ha faltado trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar hierro, soldaduras, pinturas, entre otras cosas necesarias en este tipo de trabajos.
 
Su sueño es tener propia casa.
texts.en:
The “Trabajando Para un Futuro” (Working for a Future) communal bank meets every two weeks in Rocafuerte Canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweets residents prepare that are famous throughout the country and for the warmth of its kind, hard working residents.

Angela is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the interest rates are lower than at other credit institutions.  She’s 30 years old and is in a common law relationship.  She has three children who are 10, 6 and 5 years of age; all are in school.  Her husband is a Master Metalworker.

She is a very good housewife.  In order to help out her husband she’s taking out this loan for his business.  He has a metal shop where he does a variety of jobs like: doors, windows, gutters, etc.  He works from Monday through Saturday from 8am until 6pm and has two helpers that he pays a weekly salary to.  At the same time, our friend raises chickens and other barnyard fowl.  She tells us that her husband has had his shop for six years and that, thanks to God, he’s never lacked work.

This loan is to buy iron, solder and paint, among other things needed for this type of work.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy iron, solder, paint, etc.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 33 years old, married, and has been blessed with a five-year-old child. He is a mechanic by profession. He has been in the business for seven years and has employed one person to assist him. He has gained a lot of business management skills through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand his business within five years. He needs 20,000 KES to buy auto spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is 58 years old and the married father of four children. For the past 41 years, he has worked making furniture. His extensive experience has earned his clients' trust and recommendations among his competitors. Mostafa opened his own factory in 1976 and has been developing and improving his business through the years.

Mostafa is requesting his third loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary wood to improve his furniture designs and increase his business. In the future, Mostafa hopes to continue to expand his business and provide a good heritage to his children for their future.

loans.use: to buy wood to improve and expand his furniture business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana, vive en  Morelia Municipio de Coapilla, vive en unión libre con el señor Pedro y con quien procreo cuatro hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad: Julieta de once años  en quinto de primaria, el otro es Neftalí  de nueve años, María del Carmen de cuatro años, aron de dos años y la más pequeña que esta por nacer.

   Ella es ama de casa y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ropas ya que en la actividad que tenia anterior mente ya no le funciono y decidió cambiar en lo de ropas para que así salga a venderla en las comunidades cercanas de su localidad,

   Ella se inspiro en esta actividad ya que una de sus hermanas que vive en tecpatan le estará surtiendo para que ella solo lo venda en  otras comunidades y así se poye con os ingresos de su hogar y le pueda dar una mejor atención a su pequeña que esta por nacer.

  Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda y tener sus propios ahorros para que con ello logre agrandar su negocio y pueda seguirá apoyando a su hijos que están creciendo.
texts.en:
Juana lives in Morelia, in Coapilla, with her common-law husband Pedro.  They have four children who are still in their care: 11 year-old Julieta, who is in fifth grade; 9 year-old Neftalí; 4 year-old María del Carmen, 2 year-old Aaron and their youngest who is not yet born.

Juana is a housewife and she requested this loan to invest in buying clothes.  Her previous business activity did not work out and so she decided to make a change and start selling clothes.  She sells her goods in nearby communities to her own.

Juana decided to start this business as one of her sisters who lives in Tecpatan will supply her with merchandise to sell in other communities.  In this way, she will help contribute income to her household and will be able to provide more attention to her youngest child who is yet to be born.

What Juana most desires is to be able to build up some of her own savings through her small business so that she can expand the business and continue supporting her growing children.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato, 40 years old, is married and they were blessed with three children. Renato has been growing corn for almost 15 years. Last growing season his net income was 35,000 PHP. He's asking a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. 

Future loans from Kiva would be invaluable to him as he sees the loans as the only opportunity for progression of his business and financial security.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra has a shop that sells a variety of vegetables like squash and eggplants. She has had this business for two years. Isidra is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Isidra has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She requested a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional vegetables to sell. In the future, Isidra hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nazima's Group

texts.en:
Nazima is the leader of this group. She is 34 and married to a builder. Together with her husband she is bringing up a boy and a girl. The daughter goes to school and the son is preschool age. 

Nazima works as a nurse in the hospital. Three years ago she got a loan in the amount of 7,000 KGS and with that money she bought a calf. Since that moment Nazima has been breeding cattle. With the profits gained from reselling cattle she repaired the house, improved the family’s living conditions and purchased a washing machine. 

She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds for purchasing more farm animals. In the future, Nazima wishes to purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals for breeding.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 33 years old. She is married and blessed with three children who are 10, 6, and 3 years old. The children go to school. For the last four years, she has been operating a retail shop to provide for her family. She wants in the next five years to have expanded her business into wholesale.  She is requesting 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy soap, sweets and biscuits. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making finances available to her.

loans.use: To buy soap, sweets and biscuits

loans.name: Suma Chuyma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA CHUYMA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Nola. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: repostería, promotora de venta, cosméticos, ventas de colchas y prendas de vestir, comercio de prendas de segunda mano.

La señora Nola,indica que este es el primer año que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de amigas para formar un grupo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio punto ENTEL e Internet, que viene trabajando de dos años, por intermedio de sus hermanos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de cabinas de telefono), que compraran de la Huyustus y de la 16 de julio y posteriormente  lo incorporará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “SUMA CHUYMA” communal bank is starting its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Center. The group has 8 members and is directed by a board of directors headed by Mrs. Nola. The members' businesses are varied and include: a bakery; a sales representative; cosmetics; selling bedspreads and clothing; and selling second-hand clothing.

Mrs. Nola says that this is her first year working with Pro Mujer. She joined when friends invited her to form the group. She currently has an Entel store and an internet shop. She has done this for two years with her brothers' help.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her working capital (purchasing phone booths), which she will purchase from the Huyustus and 16 de Julio [markets] and add to her store. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family where possible. She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training.

loans.use: to purchase telephone booths.

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night is 37 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Night has a business of a boutique that sells clothes, which she has had for 5 years.         

To help expand her business, Night has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Night hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Night hopes to expand her business.    Night is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jenny Fernanda

texts.es:
Jenny Fernanda tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera tiene dos hijos vivew con los hijos,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Jenny  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano, ademas cria pollos para la venta. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes y alimento para los pollos. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha y la venta de los pollos. Enfreta desafios como la edad y la salud. Su sueño es tener casa propia y compara mas terrenos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo y jugar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Jenny Fernanda, 30, is single and lives with her two children in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. 

The lending club is called El Placer and belongs to the canton of Chillanes in the parish of San Jose del Tambo, located about 60 minutes from the office. There are 24 members in this bank who work in agriculture, planting plantains, rice, yucca, cacao, soy and oranges as well as raising animals.

Jenny plants rice, corn, oranges, soy and plantains, and she also raises chickens for sale. She makes her purchases in San Jose del Tambo and sells them in the Sunday market in Chillanes. 

The requested loan is to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizers and chicken feed. The loan will help her to improve her harvest and the sale of her chickens. She faces challenges like health and aging. Her dream is to have her own home and to buy more land.

In her free time she likes to go on vacation and to play with her children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizers and chicken feed.

loans.name: Maria Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Maria Yamileth tiene 33 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de El Relleno Amapala, y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Maria antes de abrir su pulperia todos los dias hace una produccion de tortillas las cuales las manda a una finca camaronera, estas tortillas son por encargo todos los dias.
Maria vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo.
el creito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, desea surtir su negocio.

Su deseo como persona es tener salud y que en su hogar reine la paz y el amor.
texts.en:
Maria Yamileth is 33 years old and she lives in the El Relleno Amapala community. She sells everyday products, and she runs a corner shop which is set in her house.
Every day, before opening her corner shop, Maria prepares tortillas that she then sends to a shrimp plant: these are tortillas she makes for order and she prepares every day.
Maria lives with her two children and her husband.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy groceries, as she wants to stock up her shop.

Her personal desire is to be healthy and for peace and love to reign in her house.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, milk, eggs, bread, biscuits, coffee, butter, oil, margarina, soups, pastas, oats, cereals, drinks, sugared almonds, batteries, candles, matches, chicken sausages, sopas, toothpaste, toilet paper and sanitary napkins.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a single man with no children. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his younger sister. 

He has operated a shoe making business for the past three years and his potential customers are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of lack of customers sometimes. He dreams of expanding his business into a shoe selling shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase shoe soles, shoe shines and leather for his business. He decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase shoe soles, shoe shines and leather for his shoe business.

loans.name: Genebeb

texts.en:
Genebeb is 31 years old. She is married with 2 children.
 
Genebeb has a stall where she sells natural food supplements known as Balut Penoy, or boiled duck eggs. According to much research this good is rich in protein and some food minerals. Genebeb has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional eggs to sell to sustain the business.

Genebeb has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genebeb hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional  Duck Eggs to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old and has four children, three of whom are in school. She has a business of selling soap, soda, and sugar in Kator, South Sudan.
Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase soap, soda, and sugar for sale. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soap, soda, and sugar for sale.

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Luz y Vida, vive por la comunidad del Aguacate en la ciudad de Cuenca, en este  lugar su gente es muy amable y de un corazón muy cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, se dedican a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, también laboran en la ciudad en distintas actividades.

La Señora. María tiene 68 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados e independientes, solo una hija viven en su casa con quien comparte los gastos del hogar. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad siendo el fruto del trabajo conyugal.

Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cría animales como ganado, cerdos, cuyes, gallinas y pavos los que vende y también son para su consumo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar su casita.
 
Su sueño es viajar a los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Señora María is a member of the communal bank Luz y Vida. She lives in Aguacate in the city of la Cuenca, a place where the people are very kind and very warmhearted and maintain the culture and traditions of their forefathers. They raise animals and farm and also work in the city in diverse activities.

Señora María is 68 years old, married and has 8 children, all of which are adults, married and independent. Only one daughter lives at home with her and shares the household expenses. Her husband works as a bricklayer. The house she lives in is theirs, a product of the couple's hard work. 

Doña María takes care of the household chores and as she spends her time at home she raises animals such as cattle, pigs, guinea pigs, chickens and turkeys which are both for sale and home consumption.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years and she will use her new loan to buy building materials to improve her small house.

Her dream is to travel to the United States.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Kahawa A Group

texts.en:
Alfred is the facilitator of the Kahawa A group. Alfred and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alfred takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Alfred had a good maize yield, harvesting 6 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Alfred was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alfred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Alfred will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kahawa A group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Alfred is pictured with his group members and Field Officer far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Angin

texts.en:
Angin is from the village of Isahakyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She notes that the village was named after the famous Armenian writer Isahakyan, who was born there.  Angin is a trained nurse but due to difficult economic times, she has been farming for the past 20 years.  She has invested a substantial amount of her personal savings in the farm and is looking for a small loan.  With the loan, she will purchase animal feed.  This investment should increase the family income.  She is quite pleased with the services of microfinance and the crediting conditions.


About the Field Partner – AREGAK Universal Credit Organization
In the fall of 1997, United Methodist Committee on Relief (UMCOR) established the AREGAK microfinance program, with the purpose to create economic opportunities for low income people who have no or limited access to the formal financial sources, especially in the remote rural areas. The microfinance program rapidly became one of the largest MFI in Armenia in terms of number of active clients and portfolio size.

In March of 2006, AREGAK UCO was registered as a Universal Credit Organization, structured as a Closed Joint Stock Company with UMCOR as the sole shareholder.
Today, AREGAK UCO provides a broad range of financial services to the population without compromising the social aspects of its mission and continues initiatives geared toward the fulfillment of its ethical principles

Vision Statement
To be the most dynamic and ethical financial institution in Armenia and Nagorno Karabagh.

Mission Statement
AREGAK supports the economic development of small and medium entrepreneurs with high quality, accessible and reliable financial services.

AREGAK UCO’s Ethical Principles
1. Integrity and Excellence
We deliver on our promises
We are honest and transparent in everything we do
We provide excellent customer service
2. Respect and Inclusion
Our leadership, workforce and decision-making reflect and respect the diversity of customers and communities we serve.
We value all employees, investing in their personal and professional growth.
3. Innovation
We develop new processes and systems to improve efficiency
We create value added new products to enhance economic opportunities

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 36-year-old married man with four children, and he lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been a carpenter for 16 years, and he inherited his shop from his father. His challenges include customers who fail to pay on time, and his dream is to expand his business into new markets. Charles is requesting a loan to buy a welding machine for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine for his workshop.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in the small town of Gweru in Zimbabwe and she conducts her business of selling clothes in the same community. She has requested another loan of $800 to buy baby clothes and winter clothes for kids. This loan will enable her to increase her stock levels. Subsequently, her sales will also increase as will her income. With this extra income, she will be able to buy other goods for her home use. Florence says the challenge she faces is the shortage of capital.  Florence is planning to open a bigger shop to stock clothes for all age groups.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is 28 years old, married, and a mother of five children. She has been selling fish for the last three years, earning a monthly income of about Kes 9,000. 

The client was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy an additional stock of fish to sell. The client will save the anticipated profit to help pay school fees for her children.

 In future, she hopes to grow her business and own a fish depot in the locality.

loans.use: To buy an additional stock of fish.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is a 46-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and 2 daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family does not own their own apartment yet, but they have a mortgage from another bank to eventually own it. 

Her husband works as an engineer at a local outdoor market while her oldest daughter is a teller at a commercial bank. Her younger daughter attends university in China.

Narantuya has been supporting her family by operating a beauty salon for 12 years. Previously her youngest daughter helped her mother at the salon by giving manicures and pedicures. Now that her daughter studies abroad she operates it by herself. Narantuya’s salon offers body and head massages, facial treatments and eyebrow tattoos. 

When she started her business in 2001, Narantuya’s salon was in a small space with only one massage bed. Since then, her salon has expanded to three massage beds, with a variety of other services, in a larger space than before. The salon has an average of twenty customers per day. With this loan of 1,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT), Narantuya will purchase cosmetic products to use and to sell. The loan will hopefully allow her to expand and improve the quality of her services. The salon’s extra earnings will go towards her family’s expenses and her family’s goal of being secure in their own apartment. She is a very well trusted client of our institution.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain vive en la ciudad de Guadalupe. La ciudad de Guadalupe se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y en el cual podemos apreciar sitios arqueológicos de "Pakatnamú", "Farfán", "Caracoles", entre otros. Efraín desde muy joven aprendió sobre el trabajo ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos. Tal es así que debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria.

Cada día Efraín trabaja como vigilante de un centro de esparcimiento de su ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y con el fruto puede su trabajo puede sacar adelante a su hijo de  4 años de edad, a quien saca adelante solo ya que la madre de su hijo se separo de él y desde ese momento se convirtió en madre y padre para él; Efraín cree que está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo honrado.

Efrain está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar zapatos para implementar su negocio de zapatería, de esta manera podrá tener un ingreso extra y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y luchar por convertir en realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y poder tener su casa propia.”
texts.en:
Efrain lives in the city of Guadalupe. The city of Guadalupe is known to have a very warm climate where one can appreciate the archaeological sites of Pakatnamú, Farfán, and Caracoles, among others. Efrain learned when he was very young about working since his parents had few economic resources. It was because of scarce resources that he could only attend school through the fifth grade.

Efrain works every day as a security guard at a city recreation center. He works about ten hours a day and with what he earns from his work he is bringing up his 4 year old son. He is bringing him up on his own as the child’s mother separated from him and from that moment be became mother and father to him. Efrain believes that he is getting ahead in his work because he is responsible and above all honest.

Efrain is grateful to Kiva lenders and thanks to help that they have given he can buy shoes to establish a shoe business so he will have extra income to improve his quality of life and to fight in order to achieve his biggest dream, “to provide a good education to his son and to be able to have his own house.”

loans.use: to buy shoes for a new shoe business he is establishing.

loans.name: Egnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EGNON est composé de trois  personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Thérèse est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Thérèse est âgée de 54 ans et vit au Bénin. Thérèse est veuve et a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et un à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Thérèse vend de façon ambulante depuis neuf ans des tissus, de sacs et des pommades. Thérèse  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Thérèse ensemble avec les membres du groupe EGNON, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus, de sacs et des pommades.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a 50 year-old woman; she is an optimistic, responsible and hard-working person. Her job consists of clothing sales and accessories for ladies; she began her business to address the need to cover all her family expenses. Laura is also a single mother and she is the only person to pay for all the home expenses. She began 5 years ago selling her products in travelling markets and at the moment her job has allowed her to cover all the necessities of her 3 beautiful children.

She requires a loan of $925 USD to purchase merchandise that allows her to face the growth demand, because in this Christmas season her demand is bigger than another season. In a term of 5-10 months she plans to return the loan, so that she thanks your support and caring.

This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Laura es una mujer de 50 años de edad, es una persona optimista, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo consiste en la venta de ropa y accesorios para dama; inició este trabajo ante la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de la familia ya que Laura es una madre soltera y es la única encargada con todos los gastos del hogar. Inicio hace 5 años vendiendo sus productos en mercados rodantes y hasta el momento su trabajo le ha permitido cubrir con las necesidades de sus 3 hermosos hijos.

Ella requiere de $925 USD para comprar mercancía que le permita aumentar hacer frente el crecimiento de su demanda, debido a que en esta temporada navideña su demanda se ve incrementada. En un término de 5-10 meses ella planea regresar el préstamo, por lo que agradece tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Salum

texts.en: R. operates a mobile shop in Dar es Salaam. He has been in this business for four years now. He plans to expand his business by adding varieties of products for sale. R. has undergone a business and entrepreneurship training from YOSEFO. He wants to apply the theory part of the training into reality. He is in need of USD 400 to implement his plan.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Idalia Marleny

texts.en:
My name is Idalia Marleny, and I am a businessperson. My pricipal activity is the sale of clothes and shoes, which I sell door-to-do in the offices and schools of my city. I have dedicated myself to this type of work for several years, and it generates income so that I can help with the expenses of my family. With this business, we have improved our family income so that our children can go to school.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer) Mi nombre es Idalia Marleny, soy comerciante, mi actividad principal es la venta de ropa y calzado la que distribuyo de manera ambulante en las oficinas y escuelas de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de mi familia, con este negocio hemos mejorado los ingresos familiares logrando asi que nuestros hijos estudien.

loans.use: To buy sandals, towels, men's shirts, pants, and underclothes

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana J. S. owns a general store in Magdalena, a community in the Dominican Republic with strong cultural ties to Haiti. Mariana, like most of Magdalena's residents, is of Haitian ancestry; her family immigrated several generations ago in hope of a better future. Mariana sells bread, canned fish, candy, and other edibles; she will use this loan to expand the offerings of her store. Mariana is divorced with three children: Milagro Garcia (28), Jenifer (22), and Yerba (7). She hopes that the further success of her business will allow her to someday buy her own house in Magdalena; she currently lives with relatives.

Note: Mariana is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Store stock expansion

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya S. is married with two teenage sons. She lives in Pavlograd with her family. Nataliya was laid off from her previous job and had to find a stable source of income to provide for her family. That is how she ended up as an entrepreneur. Presently, Nataliya sells children’s clothing in the central city market. Her kiosk offers a large variety of clothing items at a reasonable price. Nataliya has repaid all of her previous loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. Financial assistance helped her purchase a new vending kiosk in a favorable location in January 2007.

Nataliya has been in this trade for 5 years. Currently, she has 150 items for sale in her kiosk. Her monthly net profit is about $600. Nataliya is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase some inventory wholesale and increase her turnover capital. Her long-term plan is to open one more vending facility. Moreover, Nataliya is hoping to use generated profit to help her daughter get a good education in a technical school. We believe her enthusiasm, motivation and desire to improve her living standards will guarantee prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: to purchase 70 items of children’s clothing

loans.name: Adil

texts.en: Adil has his own orchard. He has been in this business for 3 years. He is 54 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Gusarchay. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy fertilizer and pesticide for improving his orchard.

loans.use: Adil would lik to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his orchard.

loans.name: Abdurakhim

texts.en:
Abdurakhim D. lives in B.Gafurov. He has a shop in the Rokhy Abreshim bazaar where he sells meat products, such as salami, sausages, and other meat products. He has a wide variety of products and repeat customers. He has stiff competition in the bazaar, so he wants to increase the variety of products that he offers.

Abdurakhim D. became a client of MicroInvest in 2007. Now he requests a loan of 1600 TJS (about $475) to increase the variety of goods in his shop.

loans.use: Purchase a wider variety of meat products to sell

loans.name: Chrin

texts.en: Mrs. Chrin Nai Seam, 41, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To supplement her family’s income she is employed at a garment factory and makes on average $3 per day. Her husband works purchasing oxen and reselling them for a profit, which earns him about $1.60 each day. Mrs. Chrin Nai Seam hopes to use this loan to buy more cows so that she and her husband will be able to generate more profits for her family. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Chrin Nai seam is unavailable).

loans.use: To buy more oxen in order to increase her income

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Mrs. Dy S., 36, is married with three children and works as a farmer in Kampong Cham province, earning about $2 a day. Her husband, Mr. Chem Sary, 38, is on staff at the Planning Department in Kampong Cham province, making on average around $3 a day. As all of their children are studying and need more money, they hope to use this loan to purchase more plots of land to farm in order to generate more income to sustain their family and get a better life. In the future, they plan to raise more pigs if they have enough capital.

loans.use: to purchase more plots of land to farm

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Every day Felicia traverses the streets of her city selling high-quality natural products. She has a 19 year-old daughter with whom she has shared innumerable happy days. Owing to the fact that Felicia would like to keep developing as an entrepreneur, she has decided to invest more money in her business and start working longer hours. For these reasons she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

A diario Felicia, recorre las calles de su ciudad ofertando los productos naturales de una prestigiosa marca, tiene una hija de 19 años de edad, con la que comparte innumerables días llenos de alegría; debido a que desea seguir contribuyendo con su formación profesional ha decidido incrementar su capital de trabajo y las horas de labor para conseguir su propósito; y a esta razón atiende su solicitud de un préstamo.

loans.use: To increase investment capital

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Eang D., 50, lives with his wife and two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He grows rice and vegetables to earn around $5 a day. His wife, Sovann, is a local doctor. She makes $1 a day. Their children are students. This couple wants to borrow from Kiva to purchase more farmland to grow more rice in order to receive more output.

loans.use: To purchase wood to install in the house (repair work)

loans.name: Taeleasuasu

texts.en: Taeleasuasu owns a bakery. Her regular customers are students from a local primary school who enjoy the donuts, pancakes, and sausage rolls that she sells. Taeleasuasu initially only sold pancakes, but later on expanded the business.  This is her 5th loan with SPBD. She successfully repaid all the previous loans. Taeleasuasu's husband and her four children provide help in producing the snacks. Her business is the only income for the immediate family. Taeleasuasu earns about US$50 per day and sells her products 5 days a week.  With expenses at about US$200 per week, Taeleasuasu makes a weekly profit of about US$60. This allows her to make on-time repayments, and pay her children’s school fees and other family expenses. With the help of the new loan, Taeleasuasu will purchase flour, sugar, sausages, and other products for her bakery.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, sugar, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Samweli John's Rubi Group

texts.en:
Samweli J., age 27, lives in Dar es Salaam with his six-year-old daughter. He manages a water distribution business that he started three years ago. He works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm.

His business currently returns profits of $262. He has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy a water tank, which is necessary for his business. He hopes for a new loan to buy a bigger water tank.

He will be sharing this loan with his group members, who are involved in several businesses, including operating hair salons, fishing, and selling cold drinks and food. These members form a group that is responsible for paying back the loan. Each member guarantees the others to ensure full payback.

loans.use: To buy a bigger water tank

loans.name: Hidelisa

texts.es:
Hidelisa has had a grocery store for four years where she sells essential items. She has three children and it is because of them that she works hard to get ahead. Years ago, Hidelisa had a store that she was forced to relocate due to the fact that it was very far away from her home. Now her grocery store is much closer to home, however the change meant a decrease in daily income. In time, she found new customers and has seen increasing sales every day. At this time Hidelisa’s business needs to grow in order to compete, and it is for that reason that she requests this loan, to buy merchandise as well as fix up her shelving and display areas in the store. Your support will help Hidelisa’s grocery store become the busiest in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Hidelisa tiene una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad desde hace 4 años, ella tiene 3 hijos y por el bienestar de ellos lucha para salir adelante. Años atrás Hidelisa tuvo una tienda que tuvo que trasladar debido a que quedaba muy lejos de su casa, ahora la bodega de Hidelisa está mucho más cerca de su casa, este cambio significó una caída en los ingresos diarios, pero con el paso del tiempo, se hizo de nuevos clientes y ha visto crecer sus ventas día a día. Hoy por hoy el negocio de Hidelisa necesita crecer para estar acorde con la competencia, y para ello, es el préstamo que pide, para comprar mercadería, arreglar los estantes y mostradores de tu tienda. Tu apoyo servirá para que la bodega de Hidelisa sea la más concurrida de su zona.

loans.use:
To improve the infrastructure of her store and to purchase new merchandise for her shop.

Arreglar la infraestructura de su tienda y comprar nueva mercadería para su bodega.

loans.name: Arafa's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Arafa K. is 40 years and married with two children, ages 14 and 12. She began selling clothes in 2005. Every day she works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business, and earns a monthly profit of about $90 from sales.

In the past, Arafa has received a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and bed sheets for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwanampate and Fatma, who also have businesses in clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Mene

texts.es:
Mene tiene 29 años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 5, 3 y 2 años de edad. Está dedicado a la producción de yuca, que por temporada, tuvo gran acogida en los mercados, es un producto que todo el tiempo es solicitado en las chacras, para satisfacer los requerimientos de los compradores tiene que cuidar sus terrenos de cultivo casi por todo un día, lo cual no le parece muy complicado, ya que desde 10 años se dedica a esta actividad.Lo que más le agrada, es que su esposa viene a ayudarlo por las tardes, compartiendo las labores juntos,  tratando de  limpiar y abonar sus sembríos adecuadamente. Lo más  perjudicial es que los abonos son muy costosos  y generan una inversión considerable.
Mene desea el dinero que solicita para invertirlo en la compra de plantaciones de yuca e incrementar nuevas producciones, como de plátano y cítricos;  y con el tiempo ser un próspero  agricultor y comerciante.
texts.en:
Mene is a 29 year old man who lives with his wife and their 3 children, ages 5, 3, and 2. He works growing yucca, which for the season was very sought after in the markets. It is a product which requires daily attention in the fields in order to meet the requirements of the customers. Mene works all day in the fields, something that he is used to; having done it for 10 years. What makes him the happiest is that his wife comes to help him in the afternoons. The work together to fertilize and cultivate their crops sufficiently. The hardest part is that the fertilizer is quite expensive, and they require a significant investment. Mene would like to use the money that he is requesting to purchase yucca plantations and to begin new crops such as bananas and citrus; and in time be a prosperous farmer and merchant.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase yucca plantations and begin growing bananas and citrus.

loans.name: Taoa

texts.en: Taoa T., 50, is married with 1 child.  She has many years of experience in the food business. She sells to families and at the public market 2 days per week. She has had 5 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  Taoa would like a loan to purchase a box of mutton flaps, chicken legs, sausages, potatoes, vegetables, fruit, a sack of sugar, rice, flour, salt, baking powder, and a new stove.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Taoa's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Taoa wants to expand her business to a big restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To Taoa would like a loan to purchase a box of mutton flaps, chicken legs, sausages, potatoes, vegetables, fruit, a sack of sugar, rice, flour, salt, baking powder, and a new stove.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
El señor de nombre Sebastián M. G. con la edad de 56 años, su estado civil es casado, quien tiene 4 hijos en total de los cuales 3 están casados, y no dependen de el solo su hija menor que cursa recientemente  el  4 año de derecho, su compañera de vida no trabaja por lo que es ama de casa, uno de los propósitos que Don Sebastián tiene  es seguirle ayudando a su hija en sus estudios y así podrá  sentirse satisfecho al lograr que su  hija corone su carrera, otros de sus deseos es de tener un taller de sastrería con un poco mas de condiciones para generar empleos a personas que realmente lo necesitan  ya que en determinado momento de su vida el paso por situaciones  muy difíciles y esta seria una manera de ayudar a estas personas, otros de sus propósitos es sacar adelante a su familia debido a que esta a sido una de las ideas que mas a querido realizar y que el mantiene en su mente para lograr sus propósito.

Don Sebastián tiene la actividad económica de sastrería  que se basa en la realización de trajes, pantalones para mujeres y varones, el tiempo que tiene  el negocio es de 30 años Don Sebastián da inicio a su negocio por sus padres normalmente solía acudir a sus clases en un colegio cercano por lo que en la tarde  asistía  a un taller de sastrería,  debido a la situación económica que sus padres presentaron tuvo que descontinuar sus estudios pero  continuo  en el taller de costura con el propósito de el mismo pagarse sus estudios y de esta manera Don Sebastián logra trabajar en la sastrería y tener su propio negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación, el propósito de  este  financiamiento es para invertir poco a poco en su taller y aumentar su producción en las diferentes hechuras de sus trajes, otra de las cosas que necesita es comprar una maquina industrial para proporcionarle al cliente un tipo de trabajo mas fino y el pueda tener mas afluencia de clientes por su excelente trabajo.
texts.en:
Sebastián M. G. is 56 years old, is married, and has 4 children, 3 of whom are married and living independently. His youngest daughter is in her 4th year studying law. His life companion is a homemaker and does not work outside the home. Don Sebastián’s intention is to continue helping his daughter with her studies and to have the satisfaction of seeing her attain her career. Other desires of his are to have a tailoring workshop with enough business to hire people who really need the work and who are determined in this moment of their lives to work through difficult situations. His workshop would be a way to help these people. He wants to move forward for his family, an idea he most wants to realize and which he keeps in mind to help him succeed.

Don Sebastián works as a tailor making suits and pants for men and women. He has worked in this business for 30 years. When he was young he attended classes in a nearby school and in the afternoon would go to work in a tailoring shop. Because of his parents’ economic situation, he had to discontinue his studies. But he continued in the sewing workshop with the idea that he could pay for his studies that way. And so he became a tailor and set up his own business in his house. With the financing he will invest in his workshop, little by little, and increase his production of different styles of suits. Another thing he needs to do is to buy an industrial sewing machine that produces work of a higher quality that would in turn bring in more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Salomón

texts.es: El Sr. Salomón tiene 49 años de edad, habitante Hialeah, de estado civil soltero con un hijo de 15 años de edad, actualmente estudia y le ayuda a su padre en sus tiempos libres. Don Salomón tiene su negocio de abarrotes desde  hace 10 años, iniciando con sus ahorros propios. Ofertando granos básicos, frutas, verduras y productos higiénicos en su casa. Dentro de sus planes son: asegurarle un buen patrimonio a su hijo, incrementar el volumen de venta mediante nuevos y variados productos que a la vez sastifacer las necesidades de los clientes y aumentara sus ingresos económicos. Todos estos planes se podrán realizar gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic. Los cuales brindaran para el desarrollo del micro negocio.
texts.en:
Salomon is 49 years old, and lives in Hialeah. He is single and has a 15 year old son who is a student and helps his father in his free time. Salomon started his grocery business 10 years ago with his own savings. He sells staple grains and pulses, fruits, vegetables, and hygiene products from his house. His plans include: insuring a good inheritance for his son, increasing his sales by providing new and varied products to satisfy the needs of his customers, and increasing his economic income. All these plans can be realized thanks to loans from Kiva partner Afodenic, which will allow for the development of this microbusiness.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruits, vegetables, and staple grains

loans.name: Hélder

texts.pt:
Hélder A. é natural de Maputo e tem 28 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos com idade ente primeiro com 8 anos e segundo tem 4 anos. Para alem dos filhos sustenta a sua mãe e seus irmãos que vive com eles na mesma casa.

Hélder fez o instituto comercial e neste momento trabalha como professor de inglês sendo professor do aparelho do estado. Para alem do salário faz o negocio de vende de produtos diversos onde conta com ajuda de uma empregada. Quando incluir o salário totaliza mensalmente 12000,00mt o rendimento liquido.

Para Hélder este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, já teve noutra instituição no valor de 12000,00mt valor aplicado na reabilitação da sua residência, este pretende reforçar o seu estoque.

Hélder pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de melhorar a suas condições habitacionais.
texts.en:
A native of Maputo, Hélder A. is a 28-year-old married father of 2 children (of 8 and 4 years of age). Along with his children, he supports his mother and her brothers, who also live in his home. Hélder completed school and at the moment works as an English instructor. Aside from his salary, he sells various products at his business where he employs one worker. This is Hélder's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva with which he intends to increase his business' stock. He has already asked for a loan from another institution that helped him remodel his home. He intends to pay back the loan as soon as possible in order to ask for another one to help him improve his way of life.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and sell a variety of products

loans.name: Kowuvi

texts.fr: Mr Kowuvi T. est né en 1983 à Tsévié. N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller loin dans ses études, il est vite entré dans une société de vente et de réparation d’appareil électroniques et de réfrigérateurs usagers. Après la fin de son apprentissage, il ouvrit son propre atelier de réparation et de vente de réfrigérateur. Grâce à son savoir faire, il a gagné la confiance de sa clientèle. Il sollicite un financement pour acheter un stock important de réfrigérateurs et de congélateurs usagers au port de Lomé et les revendre. Cela contribuera énormément à accroître son chiffre d’affaires et ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr Kowuvi T. was born in Tsévié. Not having had the chance to pursue his studies much, he got hired early on by a company selling and repairing electronic appliances and used refrigerators. After finishing his training, he opened his own workshop to sell and repair refrigerators. Thanks to his know-how, he won the trust of his clientele. He's seeking a loan to buy a large stock of used refrigerators and freezers in the port of Lomé, in order to resell them. This will help him greatly increase his revenue and his profit.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat et vente de réfrigérateur usagers

loans.name: Dunas

texts.en: Dunas V. is 50 years old and works with her husband growing fruit and vegetables, which they sell at the market in the Cahul district. They have sold vegetables for 5 years. During the winter, they buy produce wholesale and resell it, but when it is warm enough, they farm their arable land in the village of Brinza and produce potatoes, melons, onions, cabbage and tomatoes. V. would like a loan from MicroInvest to buy seeds and vegetables in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and vegetables

loans.name: Teresa Isabel

texts.es:
La microempresaria Teresa Isabel Chávez tiene 73 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos todos mayores de edad, 3 de estos viven en sus propias casas y 1 aun vive con su madre en compañía de su esposa y los hijos de este. Doña Teresa tiene mas de 30 años de dedicarse a  administrar una pulpería la cual le a servido para poder mantener y darle educación a todos sus hijos ya que doña Teresa es viuda desde hace 30 años.

La pulpería de doña teresa es una de las más viejas del sector donde habita, lo que le permite poder tener una buena cantidad de clientes. Actualmente la preocupación de estas microempresaria no son sus hijos sino mas bien sus nietos los conviven con ella y que espera poder darles al igual que hizo con todos sus hijos una educación que les permita poder enfrentarse ante  la vida por si solos.

Sin embargo al igual que muchos otros microempresarios no cuentan con el apoyo de instituciones bancarias por los requisitos que estos solicitan y por tal razón recurre nuevamente ante ADEPHCA y Kiva para que se le pueda financiar la compra de los siguientes productos:

2 Quintales de Frijoles a US$ 40 dólar cada quintal, 3 quintales de arroz americano a US$ 61 dólar cada quintal, 3 quintales de  harina a US$ 50 dólar cada quintal, 3 cajas de  leche la lechera a US$ 45 dólar cada caja, 5 cajas sopa maruchan a US$ 12 dólar cada caja, 4 cajas de huevos de gallina a US$ 35 dólar cada caja, 2 docenas de café presto grande a US$ 3 dólar cada unidad, 3 quintales de azúcar a US$ 30 dólar cada quintal y 3 bolsones de papel higiénico a US$ 30 dólar cada bolsón.
texts.en:
Microentrepreneur Teresa Isabel Chávez is 73 years old. She is the mother of four grown children, three of whom live in their own houses. One still lives with his mother along with his wife and their children. Teresa has spent more than 30 years running a general store, which enabled her to raise and educate all of her children, as she was widowed 30 years ago. The general store where Teresa works is one of the oldest in her neighborhood, which has brought her many customers. Today, her concern is not her children but rather the grandchildren that live with her. She hopes to give them everything she gave her own children--an education that will enable them to face life independently. Like so many other microentrepreneurs, however, she does not have the support of banking institutions because she does not meet their requirements. For this reason, she has returned to Adephca and Kiva to finance the purchase of the following products: 2 quintals of Frijoles @ $40/each; 3 quintals of American rice @ $61/each; 3 quintals of flour @ $50/each; 3 cases of La Lechera milk @ $45/each; 5 cases of Maruchan soup @ $12/each; 4 cases of eggs @ $35/each; 2 dozen units of instant coffee @ $3/each; 3 quintals of sugar @ $30/each; and 3 packages of toilet paper @ $30/each.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Frijoles, American rice, flour, milk, soup, eggs, coffee, sugar and toilet paper

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace rents out VCD’s and she also sells tailoring materials. Grace needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more VCD’s and tailoring materials to sell. Grace is a LAPO client. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCD and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Mohamd

texts.en:
Mohamd A. is 38 years old and married. He lives with his wife and his six children in Gaza City in Palestine. Mohamd devotes his time to selling prepared meals in the streets from a traveling cart.

Mohamd is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase raw ingredients for making food. Mohamd dreams of being finished with selling in the street and of having his own restaurant and a place of his own.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients for making food

loans.name: Mr. Ngi Top's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people living in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. N. T. is a 57-year-old village bank president. He is a farmer who hires a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice on. In this plantation, he has a problem because he earns too little income to support his family. In order to improve his income, he decided to ask for a loan to hire a piece of land to cultivate rice on and he would use the rest of money to purchase fertilizer to support his field. His wife, Mrs. Van Ran, is a housewife. Mr. N. T. has twelve children, five of whom are employed in different positions while two others are fishermen and the remaining five are attending the local school. Mrs. Srey Tuch C. did not come to take her loan but her husband did, so he is present in the picture instead of his wife.

One member in this group is an end-of-term borrower and the rest have monthly payment loans. E-o-T borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to hire a piece of land to cultivate rice and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly es una mujer de 39 años, quien siempre se ha preocupado por el bienestar de sus seres queridos, sobre todo de su esposo y sus tres hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que con tanto esfuerzo les costó adquirir. Desde muy joven tuvo planes de tener un bazar donde pueda instalar también una pequeña botica al servicio de aquellos quienes por falta de dinero no pueden acceder a los hospitales, y ella con su carrera de técnica farmacéutica siente la responsabilidad de contribuir con su localidad. Entonces hace 6 años abrió las puertas de su negocio, el cual está a la disposición de todos sus clientes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, y como está instalado dentro de su casa, le da la posibilidad de atenderlo sin descuidar a su familia, pues de otra manera no tendría la dicha de disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, quienes también le ayudan en la atención del negocio cuando ella tiende que salir. A pesar de que su tienda marcha bien, Nelly no deja de proyectarse al futuro, y este año tiene como meta ampliar su negocio con la instalación de una mini librería. Hace 5 años que conoció de MFP, y ya está en su décimo crédito, además el grupo que conforma es uno de los más organizados y responsables de la institución. Estos 2000 soles que solicita son una gran ayuda para Nelly, quien tiene planeado abastecer su negocio con mercadería novedosa y la que más demandas sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nelly is 39 years old, and has always been concerned for the well-being of her loved ones, especially her husband and their 3 kids. Her kids live with her in the home that was very difficult for her to acquire. Since she was young, Nelly had a plan to have a bazaar, where she could set up a small shop to help those without money who cannot visit hospitals. Nelly has a background in pharmacy, and therefore feels responsible to contribute to her town. And so, she opened her business 6 years ago, which is available to all clients from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m., and, seeing as the business is located inside her house, she can serve her clients without neglecting her children. If this were not the arrangement, Nelly would not be able to enjoy the company of her children, who also help her attend to clients when she needs to leave the house. Even though the business is going well, Nelly stills thinks about the future, and she has a goal to increase her business this year by adding a small library. Nelly found out about MFP 5 years ago, and this is already her 10th loan. The 2000 Soles she requests will be a great help to Nelly, who plans to re-stock her business with new goods, and with the most popular goods.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Ayo

texts.en: Ayo is 38 years old and married with 3 children. He sells electronics, like television sets. He is requesting a loan for the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more electronics to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina O. is a divorced mother of one child, a son who is currently in the senior high school. She is forty years old. Georgina lives with her son in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She is a baker. She bakes bread in her community. She supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks to sell as well. Georgina buys bags of flour from Kumasi. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. Georgina desires to expand her business and give her son a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Рохат - женщина 1968 года рождения. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она работает в Государственном учреждении. Рохат недавно выдала замуж свою дочь, и теперь хочет купить для нее спальный гарнитур, чтобы дочери не было холодно на полу в осенне-зимний сезон. Постепенно из своей зар.платы она будет погашать займ. Рохат будут помогать ее муж и сын.
texts.en:
Rohat was born in 1968. She is married and has 3 children. She works in a government office. Rohat recently married off her daughter and now wants to buy her a bedroom furniture set, so that her daughter won’t be cold on the floor during the autumn-winter season. She will use her salary to gradually repay the loan. Rohat’s husband and son will help her too.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furniture

loans.name: Glenita

texts.en: Mrs Glenita M. is 50 years old and lives in P1 Silanga, Tangub City. She is a widow and mother of two children. One of her children is now a member of the Philippine National Police (PNP) while the other is still in high school. To support her family, Glenita opened a small sari-sari (general) store in 2004 with a little capital. Now her business is still going well, and she is earning an average net income of not less than 3,000 PHP a month, enough to support her child in high school. She is now applying for a loan amount of 4,500 PHP to use as additional working capital. Her future dream is to expand her business from a sari-sari store to a grocery store and be able to send her child to college.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Thu Thị Vũ (ID number: 010102150020) was born in 1972. She lives in Cho village with her husband and three sons. Her husband is a worker. Thu Thị Vũ raises chickens, geese and birds of peace. Her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. This time, she wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND (about 350 USD) to buy food for her domestic animal.

Ms Thu is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA:

Huệ Thị P. (ID number: 010102150014) was born in 1959. She has two children. She has a restaurant in which she sells noodle soup. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (about 320 USD) to expand her restaurant.

Dư Thị Nguyễn (ID number: 010102150004) was born in 1959. She makes votive paper. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (about 300 USD) to buy more paper.

Lợi Thị Đào (ID number: 010102150002) was born in 1950. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (about 320 USD) to raise pigs and poultry.

Tuyết Thị Trương (ID number: 010102150003) was born in 1957. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (about 320 USD) to buy tonic water to sell.

Xuân Thị Đỗ (ID number: 010102150015) was born in 1975. She has three children. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (about 240 USD) to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy food for her domestic animal

loans.name: Bibi Amana Group

texts.en: Bibi Amana is the group leader of the Bibi Amana group. There are two members in this group. Each member requests a loan to expand their business. They are requesting a group loan for $400. Bibi Amana will use her loan to expand her husband's potato/onion-selling business. Ramzi will use her loan to expand her husband's general store. They thank from AFS and Kiva lenders for their help in people who are working hard to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: For expanding businesses

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen has been a fashion designer who also sells cloth and drinks for 13 years. Forty-one and married with four children, she lives with her family in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Helen is requesting a loan of N150000 to purchase more cloths and drinks to sell. She thanks you for your help.

loans.use: To purchase more cloths and drinksto sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita has managed a typical retail store for almost twenty-one years and she is earning a weekly net income of PHP 600. She wants her business to become productive so she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 that she can use as additional business capital. The amount will be of great help in purchasing different grocery items for her store that will also result in increased income.

Nenita is married to Medardo Sr., a farmer. They have three children: Ebony - 28 years old, already working in Manila; Medardo Jr. - 26 years old, an auditor, also working in Manila; and their youngest is Angelica - 21 years old, a college graduate. They are living in Salay, Angadanan, Isabela, a rural and peaceful area.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her store

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Y Mi Guia Group

texts.es:
DIOS ES AMOR Y MI GUIA
La Alcancía Comunal Dios es amor y mi guía  está representada por la Presidenta Sra. Dora y cursan el quinto ciclo demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad. Están ubicadas en la zona D. Ate Vitarte.
 La Sra. Dora se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, además D. impulsar la marca también hace demostraciones D. maquillaje, eso le ayudó a la educación D. sus hijos que ahora ya son mayores.
La socia Shirley es la secretaria del grupo,  al igual que la Sra. Dora se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza,  además D. ser promotora en su zona,  incentiva a las socias para desenvolverse en este rubro.
Las socias realizan diferentes actividades relacionadas con el comercio tales como: venta D. productos D. belleza, buffet, óptica, venta D. comida, pequeñas  bodegas. Todas tienen mucho entusiasmo para salir adelante. Ellas saben que tienen mucha competencia y es por eso que renuevan constantemente sus productos.
Todas las socias están contentas con los préstamos pero desean aumentar sus ventas,  es por eso que solicitan préstamos  para comprar productos e insumos que les permita obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
The Community Savings, God is Love and my GuiD. is represented by the president, Mrs. Dora and this will be their fifth loan where they have shown to be punctual and responsible with their loans. They are located in the region of Ate Vitarte. Mrs. Dora sells beauty products; besides selling the products she gives makeup demonstrations which have helped her educate her now grown children. The member, Shirley, is the secretary of the group, and like Mrs. Dora she sells beauty products. Besides being a promoter in her region she encourages the members to develop in their lines of work. The members have different businesses like selling beauty products, buffet, optical, food and small mini markets. They all are very enthusiastic to get ahead in life. They know they have a lot of competition and this is why they constantly renovate their products. All the members are happy with the loans but they wish to increase their sales, this is why they need the loans to buy the products and invest so they can get more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Mosi

texts.en: Mosi S. is married and has one child who is in primary school. She is a small businesswoman who makes and sells traditional clothes (batik) at Tandika ward in Dar es Salaam. Her business materials, including colors, are purchased at Kariakoo shops. Mosi has been in business for four years and uses her business income to meet her family's daily needs and put capital into her business. She needs a loan of 600,000 TZS to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Raïssa Mahulon

texts.fr: G. Raïssa Mahulon est née le 25 Août 1977 et réside depuis 32 ans à Cocotomey non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Raïssa Mahulon est mariée à ADJOVI Hypolite. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Raïssa Mahulon vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Ayant arrêté les études au cours secondaire, Raïssa Mahulon a commencé depuis 10 ans la vente de tissus, de mèches et des produits de beauté à Bazounkpa au Bénin. Raïssa Mahulon fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Raïssa Mahulon n’a jamais obtenu de crédit à ALIDé.  Afin d’augmenter la taille de sa clientèle et son fonds de roulement pour pouvoir mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, Raïssa Mahulon sollicite un premier crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. Raïssa Mahulon was born on August 25, 1977 and has been residing for 32 years in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to ADJOVI Hypolite.  The couple has two children who are both in school.  Raïssa Mahulon comes to her husband's aid to meet family expenses.  Having dropped out in secondary school, she started selling cloth, hair extensions, and beauty products ten years ago in Bazounkpa, Benin. She acquires her merchandise from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Lomé, in Togo, a country neighboring Benin.  Raïssa Mahulon has never had an ALIDé loan.  To increase her customer base and her working capital, so as to do better in satisfying her more and more numerous customers, she's requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 bolts of cloth and 10 dozen hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Gloria Azucena

texts.es:
la joven GLORIA AZUCENA S. se dedica a la venta de ice cream y conos, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de  "LA GLORIA" su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, es casada y madre de 3 hijos, de los cuales todos dependen de su matrimonio y estudian en la escuela primaria de los centros educativos publicos de la ciudad de Danli. 
La  Sra.Gloria  tiene  experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de negocio ya que son 2 años de dedicarse a prestar este tipo de servicios. Su esposo le ayuda a vender mientras ella cuida a sus hijos por las tardes, su negocio les genera recursos finanacieros para suplir los gastos dentro del hogar.
ahora Gloria esta solicitando un credito para comprar ice cream al por mayor, por el motivo que ya vienen los dias de navidad y hay muchas fiestas y las personas compran bastante ice cream para estas ocaciones.
Gloria es una persona que tiene mucho espiritu de superacion.
texts.en:
The young GLORIA AZUCENA S. is dedicated to the sale of ice cream and cones. Her business operates under the name of "LA GLORIA" . Her business is located in her house. She is married and the mother of 3 children, of which all depend on her and her husband. They all attend the primary school of the public educational centers of the city of Danli. Señora Gloria has experience in the management of this type of business since she has been dedicated to providing this type of service for 2 years. Her husband helps her to sell while she cares for her children in the afternoons. Their business generates them the financial resources to supply the expenses inside the home. Now Gloria is requesting a loan to buy ice cream wholesale, motivated by the approach of Christmas and the many festivals when people buy a lot of ice cream for these occasions. Gloria is a person that has a lot of spirit of self-improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ice cream, cones, napkins and water for her ice cream business

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix tiene 43 años de edad, está casado con Juliana, cuenta con tres hijos su vivienda consta de tres habitaciones de material concreto. Félix se dedica a la actividad pecuaria producción de leche y elaboración de queso. La competencia es relativamente baja debido a que si bien existe gran cantidad de productores lecheros también existe mucha demanda de este producto. El destino del presente crédito es para la ampliación de hato lechero (construcción de un galpón). Cuenta con dos operaciones crediticias anteriores, donde demostró un comportamiento bastante bueno.
texts.en:
Forty-three-year-old Félix is married to Juliana, and they have three children. They live in a three-room, concrete dwelling. Félix is a dairy farmer and producer of cheese. His business competition is relatively weak because, although there are many dairy farmers, there is great demand for milk and cheese. This loan will be used for expansion of his dairy herd (construction of a shed). In his two previous loans, he established a good credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of Dairy Herd

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi M. is a single mother of four children. She lives in Mariakani town in the coast province of Kenya. Sidi operates her business in Mariakani market and she mainly sells dried fish to the area residents. She has been selling this type of fish for 11 years and has been able to satisfy a big number of the area residents.

Sidi has been a KADET member for a long time and she is now accessing her third loan. With this loan she plans to purchase 15 sacks of dried fish and to expand her business to another new town called Mwanda.

Through her business, Sidi has been able to educate her children well. She hopes to expand the business now to a nearby town and grow more.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sacks of dried fish and to expand her business to another new town.

loans.name: Eliel

texts.es:
Eliel es un joven luchador de 22 años, está casado con Nicida, de 20 años, con quien tiene una hija de 3 años. Esta joven familia vive en su humilde casa propia en la sierra central del Perú.
A pesar que fue padre a muy temprana edad, desde que vio a su hija supo que tenía que salir adelante porque su familia que confiaba en él. Por eso, desde hace 3 años, con la ayuda de su esposa siembra papa, arveja, flor de gladiolo y habas, en terrenos cedidos por su padre y en otros arrendados para obtener mayor productividad.
Esta pareja es consciente que viven de la agricultura porque les permite mantener su hogar y poder amoblar su vivienda hasta lograr una adecuada calidad de vida. Pese a que el trabajo diario es sacrificado, Eliel está contento porque pronto implementará una bodega en su pueblo, para que su esposa se encargue de ella, sin descuidar a su pequeña, que en este año ya empezará a ir a la escuela.
Pero Eliel también desea concluir su proyecto de ampliar su fábrica procesadora de papa en la ciudad de Lima, que había dejado de lado, y por supuesto continuará sembrando en mayor cantidad.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que lo pagará a tiempo, además  a él le gusta trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal porque son buenas personas que siempre están dispuestos a poyar a los demás. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja, abono orgánico, fertilizantes para acelerar su crecimiento e insecticidas para evitar la proliferación de plagas. Es así que en la foto muestra el terreno que sembrará en estos días.
texts.en:
Eliel is a determined young man of 22. He is married to Nicida, age 20, with whom he has a 3-year old daughter. This young family lives in a humble home they own in the central mountains of Perú.
