Mr. Phhal hopes to use this loan to expand his business by purchasing more bananas in his community and reselling in large quantity.

loans.use: Mr. Phhal hopes to use this loan to expand his business by purchasing more bananas in his community and reselling in large quantity.

loans.name: Jaime Armando

texts.es:
At a young age Jaime left home so as to not be a burden to his parents. His parents did not have enough money to pay the expenses of both Jaime and his siblings. For this reason about 3 years ago Jaime began selling clothing and gifts in a small local store. Little by little he established himself in the community and now he has a considerable amount of faithful customers.

Nevertheless, Jaime wants to expand his business even more so that in the future, when he finds the ideal woman of his dreams, he will be able to marry and support a family. For this reason he is asking for a loan of $375, which he will repay within 6 months. With the money Jaime will buy more merchandise to advance his business. With your help Jaime will turn his dream into reality of running his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Jaime a su corta edad comenzó a independizarse para no ser una carga para sus padres quienes no tienen tanto dinero para poder pagar los gastos de él y de sus hermanos. Fue por eso que hace 3 años comenzó a vender ropa y artículos para regalos en un pequeño local. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocido y actualmente ya cuenta con un número considerable de clientes.

Sin embargo Jaime desea que su negocio crezca para que en un futuro que encuentre a la mujer ideal, poder casarse y formar una familia. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Jaime podrá comprar más mercancía para poder darle surtido a su negocio. Con tu ayuda Jaime logrará hacer su sueño realidad de tener su propio negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Siti's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Siti is 45 years old and is a widow with 6 children, ages 12-20 years old. Siti is a business woman. She started in 1978. Every day, she works from 7am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have small businesses.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Neang Oun Group

texts.en:
Mrs. N. O., the group leader, is a subsistence farmer who cultivates rice in monsoon season and vegetables in the dry season. However, without fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel farming is very difficult. She decided to apply for a loan to buy these things because they will improve her rice and vegetable crops. Mrs. N. O. previously obtained a loan from Amret Co.,Ltd to hire a laborer to plow her rice field.

Mrs. N. O. is 51 years old. She is a widow and has eight children, two of whom are farmers while the others attended school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and fuel

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en: Mutabar T. became a client of MicroInvest earlier this year, when she applied for her first loan. She succeeded in paying this loan back on time while also expanding her business and her income. Mrs. T. lives in the high mountains of the Asht region of Taijikistan, where raising livestock and making yarn are the main businesses. Mrs. T. supports herself by making and selling yarn and warm socks in the local bazaar, where she has many repeat customers. She has been in this business for 10 years and knows it very well. Mrs. T. has applied for a Kiva loan to open up her own shop. She will repay the loan in eight months.

loans.use: to open her own shop

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina P., 29, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the snacks business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also to friends 5 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

SPBD loans are Paulina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will spend the whole amount of her loan to replace all the supplies for her project while her husband works at the Water Authority and that will be a financial support for her business.

loans.use: Purchase bananas, plastic papers, salt

loans.name: Schola

texts.en:
Schola is a 21-year-old entrepreneur who lives in Kisumu, Kenya, with her husband and 1 child. She has also been trained as a community health worker to provide home-based care to people living with HIV/AIDS in her area. She runs a cereal-selling business that she initiated in 2006. Her hard work, determination, and excellent skills have led to her success. Her profits pay her household expenses. Schola plans to use the funds from her next loan of US$500 to buy 10 sacks of grains, particularly maize. As the price of this staple food is currently low, she hopes to sell at a higher price later.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To buy a large stock of cereals

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Carolina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Florcitas del Progreso II“, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de repuestos en general. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio,  en el Jr. vía de evitamiento C-14

Se inicia en el negocio ante la necesidad de generar sus ingresos para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa. Con su esfuerzo ha logrado que su negocio crezca y se mantenga. Comenzó vendiendo aceites de diferentes marcas y repuestos para diferentes vehículos. Actualmente el negocio es muy variado y surtido. Tiene buena cantidad de clientes, quienes acuden desde muy temprano a comprarle sus productos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 600, que pagará en 4 meses, comprará filtro de freno, focos, pernos, aceites y repuestos que son más pedidos entre sus clientes y poder satisfacer sus necesidades.

Carolina tiene 55 años, vive sola ya que sus hijos son independientes. Se considera independiente para decidir y manejar el negocio, porque es quien dirige el negocio. Los clientes se han incrementado debido al carisma y amabilidad en la atención. Cree que tener un negocio surtido también garantiza las ventas, su meta es acondicionar y arreglar un ambiente en su domicilio para el negocio.
texts.en:
Carolina is a member of the Las Florcitas del Progreso II community bank. She lives in the San Martin region and province of the Tarapoto district. She works selling auto parts. Her business is located in her home, in the Jr. route of of the C-14 cut off. She began her business out of the need to help her husband with the household bills. Through hard work she has been able to grow her business and provide support. She began selling different brands of oil and spare parts for vehicles. Now her business is more diverse. She has many clients who start arriving early each day to purchase products. With a loan of 600 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase brake filters, light bulbs, bolts, oils and the parts most frequently requested by her customers in order to meet their needs. Carolina is 55 years old. She lives along now that her children are independent. She considers herself independent as she makes decisions and manages her business. Her client base has grown because of her charisma and friendliness in providing service. She believes that having a well supplied business also helps sales. Her goal is to set up an area in her home for her business.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of brake filters, lightbulbs, bolts, oil and spare parts.

loans.name: Asosoifua

texts.en: Asosoifua S., 53, is married with 5 children.  Her husband is an engineer, and his work is the other source of income for the family.She has 4 years of experience in the sewing business. She works 5 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  Asosoifua would like a loan to buy material rolls,a sewing machine, thread and needles.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Asosoifua's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy material rolls,a sewing machine, thread and needles

loans.name: Out

texts.en: This is the second time Mrs. Out S. has asked for a loan in order to improve her living conditions. She lives in Kour Chen Laeng Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Sao Vuth, are farmers. They live in poor conditions because they have only one business. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Out S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for her husband to start a motorbike taxi business. She hopes to increase her income with this new loan. Mrs. Out S. is 38 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband to start a motorbike taxi business.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. is married and cares for five family members. She attended school through senior high.

Adjoa sells used clothing at the Elmina New Market, which she has done since 2002. Her husband is a trader.

Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs.

She will use this loan to increase her stock of goods for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business she plans to reinvest in her business and expand her capital base.

loans.use: Adjoa will use the loan to increase her stock of goods for sale.

loans.name: Biek

texts.en: Biek B. is 35 years old and lives in the Pursat Province. She is a rice farmer who started the business over ten years ago. She is married with four children, all of whom are students and are living at home whilst her husband San Ngoun, 46, works as a vehicle repairman. He owns and runs a small workshop in front of his home, providing his services for bicycle or motorcycle repair, earning approximately $2 a day. B. requested a loan of $150 for her husband to purchase a range of tools and materials for his business activities. The loan will help their family to earn additional income. (B.'s husband appears in the picture of his workshop because she was not available)

loans.use: To purchase tools and materials for vehicle repair business

loans.name: Aziza Group

texts.en:
There are four members in the Aziza group, and they would like to receive a loan for their businesses. Nafesa and Aziza R., the group's leader, want to take out a loan to buy more materials for her husband's business of carpet weaving. Marjan wants to take out a loan for her brother's business of selling car parts, so that he can increase his stock. Leada wants to take out a loan to expand her beadwork business.

They all want to increase the businesses with the loans. They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan. They want to thank AFSG and Kiva lenders from around the world.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz de 29 años, es una mujer muy preocupada por el bienestar y educación de sus 2 pequeños hijos, vive alquilada en la casa de su tía y quiere salir adelante mejorando su negocio. Acompañada de sus dos pequeños hijos, Beatriz realiza sus hermosos tejidos artesanales, ella se los vende a un acopiador, el cual  posteriormente los pone a la venta en el mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). A Beatriz le gusta mucho tejer, es por eso que siempre hace modelos novedosos, aunque no todo lo que teje es fácil, ya que siempre le es molesto tejer los Chullos (Prenda de vestir para la cabeza), que son los que más se venden a los turistas, tiene pensado para el futuro de su negocio, poner una tienda donde pueda vender ella misma su tejidos. Su deseo es educar adecuadamente a sus hijos y darles lo que a ella sus padres no le pudieron brindar. Beatriz se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con MFP, pero es el primero con su actual banco comunal, ella está dispuesta a pagar sin demora sus cuotas, para no perjudicarse y no meter en problemas a las demás socias. Con el dinero del solicitado planea comprar más lana, para incrementar su mercadería, por eso invertirá todo el préstamo en ello.
texts.en:
Beatriz, aged 29, is a woman very much concerned with the well-being and education of her two young children. She rents a home from her aunt and wants to make improvements to her business. With her young children by her side, Beatriz creates her beautiful handcrafted weavings which she sells to a middleman who later sells them in the Tupac Amaru market (an important marketplace in the city of Juliaca). Beatriz very much enjoys weaving which is why she always makes original weavings even though not all weaving is easy. Because she finds it difficult to always be weaving "chullos" (a typical Andean hat) which are the items which sell best to tourists, she is thinking that it would be best for the future of her business if she were to open her own store where she could sell her weavings herself. Her wish is to give her children a good education and give them what her parents were not in a position to give her. This is Beatriz' second loan with MFP, but it is her first as part of her current community bank. She is prepared to make her repayments on time so that she doesn't hurt her reputation and so as not to create problems for her fellow members. She will use this loan to buy more wool and to increase her stock of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool for weaving

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Luisa es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Luisa viaja a las ferias en donD. compra animales que luego transporta a la ciudad D. Ayacucho, sus ventas los realiza en la feria D. San Juan y en algunas oportunidades los beneficia y venD. por mayor.
Luisa necesita un préstamo D. 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ganado vacuno y porcino.
Los sueños D. Luisa son tener mas capital, comprar un carro para transportar los animales y construir el segundo piso D. su casa.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Violeta Community Bank. She is married, is 48 years old, and has 4 children. Luisa travels to the markets where she buys animals which she then transports to the city of Ayacucho. Her sales take place at the San Juan market and on some occasions she improves the animals and sells wholesale. Luisa needs a loan of 2600 Peruvian soles that will be invested in the purchase of cattle and pigs. Luisa's dreams are to have more capital, to buy a car to transport the animals, and to build the second floor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cattle and pigs

loans.name: Iringa Group

texts.en:
Shinuna H., age 41, is married with nine children. She makes chapati, fries fish and makes local pancakes in Tageta, a suburb of Dar es Salaam. She started 20 years ago and works from 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $308.

This will be Shinuna’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She plans to buy more materials for her business and wishes to maybe open a shop that sells clothes in front of her house.

Shinuna will share this loan with her group Iringa. The group has 15 members who do tailoring, food vending, fish and charcoal. They hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Shinuna is in the middle in red.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy T., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Vanna Khorn, 38, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1982 and have six children: five sons and one daughter. Two of their children work in a soft drink company, two children are in school and another one is still too young.

Vuthy and his wife have been farming for twenty-two years. They grow green beans and cantaloupes and other food crops on their farmland. Vuthy is asking for his second loan of $1,000 in order to build a restroom for use of the family. Another part of the loan will be used for his farming business.

loans.use: To build a restroom for his family and to use for farming

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is 29 years old and lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. He has been repairing cars for 13 years and went into this business because he wanted to have independence in his work. His customers are his friends, neighbors and other local people.

Jihad requested a loan of $1000 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase car batteries and spare parts for his garage. He has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business, and in the future he plans on further improvements.

loans.use: To purchase car batteries and spare parts for his garage

loans.name: Herlinda Rosario

texts.es: Doña Herlinda A. cuenta con 55 años de edad, es casada de oficios Tejedora, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto a su esposo y con  sus 2 hijos, ella y sus hijos se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 12 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chichaclan del Cantón Paquí , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Doña Herlinda A. is 55 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children. She is a weaver and works in the workshop “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres”. The workshop has two looms. Both of her children are in the same line of work and work with her. She has been working for 12 years to establish her company 'Elaboracion de Cortes Tipicos para mujeres' in her home. Her house is in the Paraje Chichaclan del Cantón Paquí area in the Totonicapán region of Guatemala. Recently, the demand from her clientele has grown. However, the current economic conditions make it difficult for her to build up enough capital. For this reason, she approached the Asociacion ASDIR to request a loan. The loan will be used to buy more material and in this way she will be able to increase her sales. She hopes this will also help her children and improve the conditions in which they live.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (buy more material)

loans.name: Ankabenkélenkan 2. 2 (Soyons Unies). Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2. 2 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Fonfona de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 5 enfants et  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles soeurs  etc. 
Elles  cultivent principalement  du riz et de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Ankabenkélenkan 2.2 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre premiers prêts, elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des semences de riz, d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au marché de Fonfona, M’pessoba et Zansoni. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au marché de M’pessoba et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail et en gros, au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2.2 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 70 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Ankabenkélenkan 2.2 Group is a group of married women from the village of Fonfona in the main city of Koutiala (in Mali's third administrative region). They have an average age of 35 and at least five children each, and live in large, extended traditional families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. They grow mainly rice and groundnuts. Keen to make a profit from their agriculture business, the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2.2 group decided five years ago to join Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program. Having fully repaid their first four loans, they are now on their fifth country loan. The current loan will be used to buy rice and groundnut seeds, small equipment and fertilizer at the markets in Fonfona, M’pessoba and Zansoni. After the harvest season, the crops are placed in storage for a certain period of time to increase in value before being sold at retail and wholesale at the market in M’pessoba or surrounding markets for cash to a clientele composed of retailers, in general from the large towns. Once the crops are sold, the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2.2 group each expect to make a profit of CFA 70,000, which will be used to repay the loan and for everyday family expenses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and small equipment

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José Santos R. Martínez tiene la edad de 45 años, es hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad a la que José se dedica es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio.  Anteriormente José vendía ropa, calzado entre otras cosas, pero debido a un sin numero de problemas por los que atravesaba tenia que dejar este tipo de negocio, ya que viajaba mucho y sus hijos y su esposa pasaban mucho tiempo solos, y José es un hombre muy responsable y siempre le ha gustado mantenerse cerca de su familia. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y no perder este negocio que tanto le gusta e invertir en la compra de frijoles, maíz, cacao y tamarindo. Su sueño es establecer un negocio para su esposa para que ella pueda obtener una fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
José Santos R. Martínez is 45, is married, and has 2 children. He has sold basic grains for more than 6 years. Previously José sold clothing, shoes, and other items, but due to countless problems he decided to leave this business. He had to travel a lot and his children and wife were spending a lot of time alone. José is a very responsible man, and he has always like to stay close to his family. This is why he requesting financing for working capital so he won't lose his business that he likes so much. He will invest in the purchase of beans, corn, cocoa, and tamarinds. His dream is to establish a business for his wife so she can have a source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. There, he has settled in the Fizuli region, in a Finnish house. This village was built for IDPs.

He was born in 1983. This man has 2 years of experience in the sheep-breeding business. Now he needs a loan of 1600 AZN to buy 15 sheep to expand his sheep-breeding business.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène N. est une veuve de 59 ans, avec 10 enfants en charge. Elle fait de l’élevage porcin et du petit commerce. Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Hélène N. is a 59-year-old widow with ten children to look after. She raises pigs and works in small-scale commerce. Her goal is to support her family.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For raising pigs and small-scale commerce

loans.name: Annah Wanjiku

texts.en: Annah is 50 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Kirigu, Kikuyu, where she sells milk on a retail basis to nearby shops and to households that are not, themselves, involved in farming. Annah got to know about KADET from her friend who is a member and she had not borrowed elsewhere before. This will be her third loan and, with this loan, she hopes to buy raw materials for the construction of rental houses to boost her family income. In future Annah hopes to construct a shop for her milk business and also to buy more cows so that she increases her milk supply. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To construct rental houses to raise the family income

loans.name: George Boro

texts.en:
George Boro is 27 and married with one child, Benson K., who is three years old and in nursery school. George operates his milk-selling business with his brother, Peter Njoroge.

George has been selling milk for eight years and works in an area where milk and meat are staple foods, therefore ensuring a huge customer base. He is requesting his first loan in order to purchase a motorbike to make transporting milk easier, and with the extra profits generated from this investment he intends to start rearing pigs.

George, who was introduced to KADET through existing members, is hardworking and dreams of purchasing a plot of land in a prime area to build rental houses.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to make transporting milk easier.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells sarongs and clothes. She has been in the business for years. She is 49 year old and married with four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more sarongs and clothes to sell. She says thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs and clothes to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 26 years old and have a strong determination in fulfilling her dreams in life. She is happily married to Julius, a tricycle driver. They have three children: Johnson-5 years old; John Paul-4 years old and Jilian-2 years old. Her family is peacefully living in the village of Sta. Rosa, Santiago City.

Analiza is tricycle operator and at the same time she is making some accessories for cell phones. She wanted to improve their way of living through the business she manage. The couple strives hard to provide the needs of their family especially the needs of their children.  Analiza would like to borrow additional capital to the ASKI KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000.00.  The loan will be used for the maintenance of their tricycle. She really hopes that her request will be granted.

loans.use: For the maintenance of their tricycle transport business

loans.name: Iris Isabel

texts.es: Iris es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 40 años, es madre de tres hijos, de los cuales dos son mayores de edad. Iris se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, ella vende a crédito sus productos y la cobranza es diario y semanal, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se desempeña como docente en una escuela. Iris forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, desde hace ocho años.  El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que lo utilizó para comprar golosinas y vender en su casa. Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar prendas de vestir y vender. La meta de Iris es llegar a tener un bazar y seguir aportando en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Iris has been a member of the “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (“Hardworking Women”) Community Bank for eight years and is a dynamic and collaborative woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region, is 40 years old, and is the mother of three adult children. Iris has a business selling clothing. She sells her products on credit and collects payments both daily and weekly. Her husband is a school teacher and is supportive of her.

The first loan that Iris received was for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, which she used to purchase sweets to sell from home. She is now requesting a loan for 1000 soles, to buy clothing to sell. Iris's goals are to have her own shop and to continue contributing to her household's income.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
En la foto aparece la señora Bertha Abelia Rodriguez esposa del señor Efrain L..

Efraín López E.  desde hace 13 años se dedica a la compra y venta de fierro viejo para el sostén de la familia, su esposa para ayudarle con los gastos familiares es vendedora de ropa usada en un pulga muy conocida en la ciudad. Ellos siempre han salido adelante a pesar de la crisis ellos quieren seguir esforzando para darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ahora el señor quiere reparar el techo de su casa ya que por dentro hay abertura por donde se filtra el agua cuando llueve y no quiere que sus mubles se deterioren pero sobre todo para dejarles a su familia una casa en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Bertha Abelia Rodríguez, wife of Efraín L., appears in the photo. For 13 years Efraín López E. has been buying and selling old iron to support his family. In order to help him with the family expenses, his wife sells used clothes at a well known flea market in the city. They have always gotten ahead in spite of the crisis. They want to continue putting forth great effort in order to give their children a better quality of life. Now he would like to repair the roof of his house. There is a crack inside where water leaks when it rains. He does not want his furniture to be ruined. Above all, he wants to give his family a house that is in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof of his house

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren is 49 years old and lives with his wife and 19-year-old daughter in a house in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. His daughter attends the university while Davaasuren and his wife operate a meat retail business in their town. They began their business in 2000 with working capital of 200,000 tugrugs. They became quite successful and soon began selling their meat products in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, where they can charge higher prices than in the countryside. He is well known amongst both his customers and suppliers as an intelligent and responsible businessman. Since beginning his business, he has been able to purchase a piece of land and build a house on it for his family. He would eventually like to be able to purchase a truck for his business. Davaasuren is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more meat in order to keep expanding his business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more meat.

loans.name: Sara Antonia

texts.es:
la sra. Sara Antonia C. R. tiene varios años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa y calzado, actividad que tiene de realizar por mas de 13 años,  es madre de 2 hijos los que estudian en centros educativos publicos del municipio de Las Trojes.
Con las ganancias que le genera este negocio apoya a su esposo y asi juntos sacan adelante su familia y su hogar, gracias a la buena administracion y al buen manejo de su negocio a logrado todo lo que hoy en dia posee , los precios modicos que ofrece Sara a sus clientes hacen que ella tenga una buena clientela. .
solicita el credito para surtir su negocio ya que se aproxima la epoca navideña donde muchas personas compran ropa para regalar a sus seres queridos y Sara desea tener un buen surtido para satisfacer a su apreciable clientela.
texts.en:
Sra. Sara Antonia C. R. has been selling clothes and shoes for more than 13 years. She is the mother of two children who attend public schools in the town of Las Trojes.

With the earnings her business generates, she is able to help her husband with moving their family forward. Thanks to the good administration and management of her business, Sara has achieved everything she has today. She has developed a good clientele as a result of the modest prices she offers.

Sara is requesting a loan to restock her business since the Christmas season is approaching. Many people buy clothes for their loved ones during this time, so she wants to have a good assortment to satisfy her valued customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell for the holiday season

loans.name: Jorge Marciano

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 53 años de edad, es separado desde hace 18 años, tiene 2 hijos y actualmente vive con su madre y con su abuela en el sector Los Grados del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde muy pequeño. Cría vacas productoras de leche en los terrenos agrícolas que rodean su casa y siembra forraje para alimentarlas. La leche que producen sus animales la vende a una empresa acopiadora de la zona. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que sostiene a los suyos.

Debido al paso del tiempo las paredes de su establo, construidas de material rústico, están sufriendo deterioros, por lo que Jorge se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su establo.

Su más grande anhelo es ampliar su establo y comprar una procesadora de forraje. Esta es la segunda vez que Jorge trabaja con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Jorge is 53. He has been separated for 18 years, and he has two children. He currently lives with his mother and grandmother in the Los Grados sector in the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region. This is three hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked in agriculture and with livestock since he was very small. He raises dairy cows on the fields surrounding his house. He plants fodder to feed them. He sells the milk his animals produce to a milk collection company in the area. This business is the only source of income he has to support his family. Due to the passage of time, the walls of his stable, which are made from rustic material, are deteriorating. That is why Jorge is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 800 PEN. He plans to buy construction material to improve his stable. His greatest desire is to expand his stable and buy a processor for the fodder. This is the second time that Jorge has worked with our Institution. He has demonstrated himself to be a punctual and responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to improve the stable

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en: Hadijah N. is a hardworking businesswoman. She is thirty years old and married, and the mother of two children who are in school. She started a salon business ten years ago. She is using the loan to purchase salon items, such as hair chemicals, relaxes, combs, and hair driers. She is a promising businesswoman whose dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase salon items

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth A. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Ruth is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Ruth joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: La señora Maria Azucena tiene 36 años de edad, La señora Maria  se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 4 años. Por lo que ella busca la forma de mejorar sus condiciones de vida para su familia. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de las frutas que sus clientes le solicitan, ya que tiene un sin número de clientes nuevos la atención que les brinda es la mejor pues siempre trata de salir adelante con su actividad. Ella sueña con instalar una distribuidora en el municipio en donde vive, ya que actualmente no hay ninguna.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Azuena is 36 years old. She has a fruit and vegetable business which she started four years ago because she was looking for a way to improve the condition of her family. The loan will be used to purchase the kinds fruits that her clients request. She has many new customers who say that the attention she gives them is the best, since she is always trying to move her business forward. She dreams of setting up a distribution business in her city since, as of now, there isn´t one.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits

loans.name: Mrs. Sameur Pann Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan includes 14 people who live in Trapeang Young village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sameur P. is the village bank president who was selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purpose. She is a silk cloth seller and a weaver in the local village. She can't earn enough to support her family. Thus, in order to expand her business, Mrs. Sameur P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk cloth to re-sell door-to-door. She is single and lives with three dependants.

loans.use: To buy more silk cloth to re-sell door to door

loans.name: Bavubuka Twekembe Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Sulaiman is the leader of his group in Mukono. He is 35 years old and married with five children. His eldest child is 23 years old. Sulaiman has been in the business of fishing from Namusenyi Landing site for fifteen years, and, although his business is faced by poor fishing methods, he is able to make 280,000 UGX in weekly profits. Sulaiman would like to increase his income, and, with this loan, he hopes to restock and develop a retail shop, which will enable him to get income for school fees. It is for this reason that he needs a loan to boost his retail shop by increasing his capital. Sulaiman is a hardworking and devoted man.

N. Sulaiman is featured in the small photo at the bottom right of the group photo as the group leader although he does not appear in the big group photo.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Zolboohuu

texts.en:
Zolboohuu is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His wife, Dulmaa, operates a seasonal construction business and his daughter and two sons all attend a local secondary school. They have been living in their current home for the past 23 years.

Zolboohuu operates a transportation business in his local area. He transports people throughout his province and has a loyal customer base who appreciate his convenient service. Zolboohuu started his business in 2008 with capital of 700,000 tugrugs (~ 495 USD) and after years of successful operation has increased his working capital to a level exceeding 1,500,000 tugrugs (~ 1,055 USD) today. His earnings have enabled him to renovate his car and improve his service. Zolboohuu is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~ 351 USD) loan for his transportation business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Juana Francisca M. A. es soltera, tiene tres hijos pero ninguno depende de ella, habita en el barrio Camilo Ortega y se dedica a la venta de repostería, esta repostería ella la compra en una panadería por cantidades y luego sale a vender por las calles del barrio.

Sus hijos también le ayudan económicamente pero a ella le gusta el trabajo para tener su propio dinero, lleva ya seis años trabajando con CEPRODEL y ha sido muy cumplida con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca M. A. is single; she has three children but none are still dependent on her. She lives in Camilo Ortega neighborhood and she sells pastries that she buys at wholesale from a bakery; she then resells them along the streets of her neighborhood. Her children help her out financially but she likes to work to earn her own money. She has collaborated with CEPRODEL for 6 years and she has always repaid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pastries.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Comité San Antonio, así se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá en fecha 17 de junio de 2.008.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo.
Elba es una de la integrantes es una de las señoras mas activas del comité, su familia es muy trabajadoras, sus hijas son hijos son todos estudiantes, su marido es albañil y constantemente tiene trabajo  de esta manera toda la familia se ayuda y llevan una vida muy saludable.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos ya que ella se dedica a la veta de los mismos en su tiempo libre ella sale a ofrecer sus productos a vecinas y amigas y esta muy satisfecha con su actividad. Nos comenta que deja un buen ingreso para sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
The group of women that formed in the city of Itá on June 17th, 2008 call themselves the "San Antonio Committee". They all work to collect funds, and they help each other to reach their common objectives, which all the members of the group have. Elba is one of the members. She is one most active women in the committee. She has a very hard working family. Her children are all students, and her husband, who works in construction, always has work. And so her family members all help each other, and they live a very healthy life. She is requesting the loan to buy cosmetics, since she makes her living selling the same. In her free time, she goes out to offer her products to her neighbors and friends. She is very satisfied with her work. She tells us that it supplies her with sufficient income for her personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire make-up, such as blush, powders, nail polish, creams etc.

loans.name: Lidia Yolanda

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia V. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de verduras,  actividad en la cual cuenta con 18 años de experiencia.
La Sra. V. tiene ubicado su negocio en el mercado “Nuevo Amanecer” cubículo Nº 2 de la ciudad de danlí, y realiza ventas al por mayor y al detalle.
Doña Lidia  además de vender en el cubículo también tiene 3 vendedores los cuales salen a vender verduras en bicicletas de carga que ella posee dándoles como sueldo el 25% de las ventas que realizan.
Doña Lidia vive en unión libre y su compañero de hogar de igual manera se dedica al comercio, el cual posee un vehiculo y transporta verduras desde Tegucigalpa y sale a vender en los mercados de la ciudad de danlí.

Doña Lidia nos comento que anteriormente residían en Tegucigalpa y que llegaron a esta ciudad de Danlí en busca de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ya que en la capital es mas cara la vida y expresa que en el poco tiempo que tiene de vivir en Danlí sus condiciones de vida han mejorado en gran manera ya que ahora poseen su propia vivienda lo que nunca pudieron tener durante el tiempo que vivieron en Tegucigalpa. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de verduras y surtir más su negocio ya que su clientela día a día es mas grande.
De su matrimonio tienen 4 hijos que dependen a un 100% de ellos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia V. has a business selling vegetables, an activity she's been doing for 18 years. Mrs. V. has her business situation in the "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Dawn) market, stand No. 2 in the city of Danli, where she does wholesale and retail sales. In addition to selling in the stand, Ms. V. has three salespersons who go out on bicycles to sell vegetables, and she pays them 25% of the sales their make. Ms. Lidia cohabits with her life partner, who also works equally hard at business. He has a car and transports vegetables from Tegucigalpa to Danli city markets. Ms. Lidia told us that previously, they lived in Tegucigalpa. They moved to Danli in search of better living conditions as the capital is very expensive. In the short time they've lived in Danli their living condition have improved and they already own their own home, something they never could have done while living in Tegucigalpa. She wants to use the loan to buy a wide variety of vegetables to increase her supply and meet the demands of her increasingly growing clientele. From her relationship, she has four children who depend on her and her partner 100%.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a wide variety of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Née en 1973, A. Philomène est mariée à PADONOU Euloge, un conducteur de véhicule poids lourds. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis sept ans au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Philomène vient en aide à son mari et supporte avec lui les charges familiales. Philomène n'a pas été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Philomène vend depuis une trentaine d'année, des escargots à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est à Houègbo à Allada, que Philomène achète ses produits. Philomène a bénéficié entre temps, de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son capital et d'augmenter le stock de ses produits, Philomène sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Philomène A. was born in 1973 and is married to Euloge PADONOU, a truck driver. The couple has three children, who all attend school. For seven years, the family has been living in the Dogoudo neighborhood, Atlantic Department. Philomène helps her husband and supports the family expenses with him. She never attended school. For about 30 years, Philomène has been selling snails in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, to provide for herself. She buys her supplies in Houègbo, Allada. Philomène already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, which were repaid without problems. With the goal of bolstering her working capital and increasing her stock, Philomène is seeking a third loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2'400 snails

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
Lisbeth pertenece al Banco Comunal Florecer, Lisbeth es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos que están estudiando.
Lisbeth inicio su negocio hace algunos años, tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado que cambio hace 6 meses, sus ventas han mejorado por la ubicación de su negocio, actividad que realiza todo el día, por las noches vende caldos hasta las 10 de la noche.
Lisbeth necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles dinero que será invertido para la mejora la presentación de su cocina, cambio de mayólicas.
Lisbeth sueña con implementar una polleria grande.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Florecer” (To Blossom). She is 28 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children who are in school.

Lisbeth started her business a few years ago. She has a restaurant that changed six months ago to a rented location. Her sales have increased since moving to this location. She works all day and sells soups at night until 10pm.

Lisbeth needs a loan of 2200 PEN to replace her ceramic dinnerware in order to improve the presentation of her dishes. She dreams of opening a large chicken shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ceramic dinnerware

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and gallons of oil

loans.name: Jean Michel

texts.en:
Jean Michel is 28 years and married with three children who are 2, 4 and 8 years old.  Jean Michel makes a living by driving a motorbike and he has been in this business for about three years.  Jean Michel drives from 7 am until late in the evening hours.

Jean Michel needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. This loan will allow him to purchase another motorbike, which will allow him to create one more job for one of the people in his community and increase the size of his profits.  Jean Michel, through the use of this loan, has hope for a better future for his children.

loans.use: To buy one additional motorbike

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam Harutunyan is married and has three children. The family lives in a private house on the outskirts of Yerevan city. The front part of the house is remodeled into a modest tavern, where Mariam prepares delicious barbecue. Her tavern is on a road that leads to a site in the country with picnic areas. so most of Mariam's customers visit the tavern to buy barbecue for a picnic. To meet the clients' demands and to expand her business Mariam is planning to open a small grocery shop.

loans.use: to open a small grocery shop

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a wife of M. A. and resides in a city called Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is a city famous for its dairy business. A talented lady, Azra owns & operates a business embroidering and making lace. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs and lace and sells it to different embroidery shops for earning good income.

Her husband is a loader by profession. He uses his horse-cart to deliver different items such as fruits & vegetables and construction supplies through it. He has been in this profession since the last five years. People hired him to deliver their items to the designated places. 

Azra has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy a new horse-cart because the old cart has become rough and rotted in different areas, leaving him unable him to load items on it. Azra is hopeful that this investment will help her husband to continue his business well and to provide the better dervice to his customers.

loans.use: Purchase a new horse-cart for loading business

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is the mother of six daughters. She and her husband, Raed, own a kids’ clothing store in Rafah city in Gaza Strip. She and her husband share working in the store where they sell girls’ and boys’ clothes. The store is located in the heart of the city center and is the only source of living for the family.

As the feast (Eid al Fitr) is around the corner, Hameeda and Raed want to increase the amount of clothes exhibited in their store. Accordingly, Hameeda took a $1,200 loan from FATEN in order to purchase the needed amount of clothes.

In the photo, Hameeda's husband appears in the store as she doesn't wish to have her picture online.

loans.use: To increase the amount of clothes exhibited in their store during Eid al Fitr

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay off his car loan.

loans.name: Eternal Rock Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Roca Eterna esta integrado por tres personas las cuales tienen varios años de conocerse, este grupo esta ubicado en la aldea Altos de la Cruz San Lorenzo, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la señora Maria Bertilia C. tiene 41 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos, su esposo le colabora ya que trabajan juntos en su taller donde se fabrican tejas y ladrillos para construccion de casas, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de tierra, leña y materia prima que se utiliza para la fabricacion de los mismos.

el señor Osman Joel R. A. tiene 33 años de edad,  es padre de cuatro hijos, su esposa no trabaja solo le ayuda en su hogar, Osman se dedica a la fabricacion de muebles desde hace 7 años su taller lo tiene en la casa de habitacion en donde elabora, comodas, estantes, puertas, ventanas, gaveteros, closets y mucho mas relacionado con la carpinteria, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de madera, pintura, tiner para seguir elaborando sus muebles.

la sra. Santos Orbelina G. O. tiene 48 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ahi vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica familiar, como ser azucar, manteca, jabon, frijoles, queso, mantequilla, embutidos, refrescos, churros, pan, verduras.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The group named "Eternal Rock" is made up of three members who have known one another for many years. This group is located in the village of Altos de la Cruz San Lorenzo. Here below is a description of the businesses they have: 

Maria Bertilia C. is 41 years old; she is the mother of 3 children. Her husband works together with her in their shop where they make roofing tiles and bricks for buildings. The loan will be used to purchase sand, wood and other materials to make these products. 

Osman Joel R. A. is 35 years old, he is the father of four children and his wife is not working but she takes care of the house hold. Osman has been crafting furniture for the past 7 years in the shop located in a section of their house. There he makes counters, stands, doors, windows, cabinets, closets and many other carpentry items. The loan will be used to purchase wood, paint, and thinner to keep making furniture. 

Santos Orbelina G. O. is 48 years old and she sells general grocery store items, selling all the basic items used by families, such as sugar, lard, soap, beans, cheese, butter, canned goods, soft drinks, pastries, breads and vegetables. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise to stock her business.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose S.  is currently in the business of selling clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more shoes and tomatoes to sell.  

Rose is 25 years old and married to a peasant. She has no children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock more shoes and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Chhim Ya's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhim Y. is married to Mr. Sakk Sam Oeun, 49, who works as a farmer on his plot of land to grow crops. This couple has five children, three of whom are grocery sellers, while another is a student in the local school. They live in Kbal Chrouy village in Kandal province.

Chhim is the group leader of this group loan with four members. With their portions of the loan, each hopes that they will increase their incomes so as to improve their family’s living conditions.

Mrs. Chhim Y. earns her living by selling groceries in the local village. Her profits support the family. In order to increase her income so as to improve the family’s living conditions, Chhim would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Pelita

texts.en:
Pelita T. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Pelita is separated from her spouse and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Pelita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Pelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Pelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Pelita is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Pelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Analiza Ano-Os' Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Analiza A. is from the Barangay of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Analiza is the group leader of a two member group loan offered by Kiva partner PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Analiza A.’ Group. 

Analiza A. is 40 years-old and married to Concordio A..  They are blessed with four who are all school age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in a firewood buying and selling business. Her husband is also giving her regular support from his income as a motor cab driver. She’s been engaged in this business for four years already. She earns an average amount of not less than P3,500.00 a month from this business. 

In the year 2009, Analiza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza, as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities, has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php5,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php7,500.00 as her third loan which will be used for  additional capital for her firewood buy and sell business. The future income of this business will be used to meet their basic needs, to make loan repayments and pay for the children’s education. She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the Savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites L. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Marites is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from buying and selling junk foods & beverages like soft drinks in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Marites is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional beverages like soft drinks & juices. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional beverages like soft drinks & juices

loans.name: Palatina

texts.fr: Mlle Palatina est née en  1986 et  a un enfant en charge.  Elle est née  à Kouméa et habite quartier Gbinkomé. Elle fait le commerce de céréales et a débuté en 2005 cette activité.  Elle achète les céréales à kpalimé et revend a côté de la pharmacie satis à Gblinkomé.  Elle demande un crédit pour acheter  10 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs d’haricot et  8 sacs de mil.
texts.en: Miss Palatina was born in 1986 and has one child to support. She was born in Kouméa and lives now in the neighborhood of Gblinkomé. She has been trading with cereals since 2005. She buys the cereals in Kpalimé and resells them next to the pharmacy in Gblinkomé. She applies for a loan to buy 10 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of beans and 8 sacks of millet.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans and millet

loans.name: El

texts.en:
El M., 39, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells clothes, earning an income of approximately $5 per day. Her two children are employed at the factory, earning an income of about $3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $83 on food and $5 on other necessary expenses. 

M. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike to transport clothes to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. M. appears in the photograph with her daughter.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to transport clothes to sell

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: Emerita, de 30 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Emerson de 34 años, que es chofer, y de sus dos pequeños hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace seis años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la administración de un motocarro que conduce su esposo. Mientras él trabaja ella se encarga de administrar el dinero, no solo para el hogar si no también para la reparación de los dos motocarros que tienen en la actualidad, pues la segunda lo ofrece en alquiler. Esta muy satisfecha pues gracias a estos negocios ha logrado salir delante y ahora tiene muchos planes para el futuro, como el de instalar una tienda de comestibles, pues por la zona donde vive no hay un negocio así calcula que obtendrá buenas ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Emerita tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en cancelar la última letra de su motocarro, pues solo le falta una letra para que sea totalmente de su propiedad, así espera continuar adelante.
texts.en: Emerita is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, Emerson, of 34 years old.  He is a chauffeur and the father of her two small children.  Together, they work very hard every day to give their family a brighter future.  Six years ago, this entrepreneurial woman began managing the motorcycle that her husband drives.  While he is working, she is in charge of managing the money, not only for their household but also for the repairs of the two motorcycles that they currently own.  They rent the second motorcycle that they have.  She is very satisfied because this business has allowed her to move forward and make future plans, such as installing a grocery shop.  There isn't any business like it in the area that she lives.  This is her first credit with MFP and she promises to pay her dues on time since she doesn't want to appear irresponsible before the people that are making this possible.  Emerita plans to invest the credit in paying off the final payment due on her motorcycle.

loans.use: To pay off a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Robbie

texts.en:
Robbie B. is from the village of Bugo, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 26 years old. Robbie is married and has two infant children. 

To make a living, Robbie buys and sells coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) in the local community. Robbie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Robbie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Robbie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for  working capital. 

Robbie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts for copra. This will be the second loan taken out by Robbie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts for copra

location.town: Bugo, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Lucia Consuelo

texts.es: La Sra U. labora como operadora de fotocopiadora  es acompañada, tiene una persona a su cargo,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece  la oportunidad que le brindan esta institución con  este  desembolso, para poder mejorar su vivienda, comprar materiales de construcción como arena, cemento madera cinz, mano de obra, para hacer anexo .
texts.en:
Sra. U. works as photocopy machine operator. She lives with one person who is a dependent.

This is the first loan she has received from CEPRODEL. She is grateful for the opportunity being given to her. The funds will be used to make an improvement to her home. She will buy construction materials such as sand, cement, wood, and zinc in order to build an extension. In addition, she will pay for labor.

loans.use: Purchase materials & pay for labor to build an extension to her house

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó a través de la Sra. Maria Lidia S. y la Sra. Alicia D., quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más acerca del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, las mismas invitaron a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 23 (veintitrés) mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
Ellas  son independientes en sus labores, por ejemplo: la sra. Rafaela se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas, y necesita el crédito para aumentar la producción de sus comestibles, comprando huevos, fideos, azúcar, harina, entre otros ingredientes, y así también mejorar la calidad de lo que ofrece a sus clientes.
Ella sólo sueña con poder prosperar y tener un negocio amplio donde pueda incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Maria Lidia S. and Alicia D. who had come to the office of the Fundación Paraguaya  (Paraguayan Foundation) to find out more about the program of the Entrepreneurial Women’s Committee.  They invited their friends and acquaintances from the neighborhood and decided to put their different businesses together to get ahead and improve their standards of living.  There are 23 (twenty-three) hardworking and humble women who need to make their living every day.
They are independent in their businesses, but Rafaela sells food and drinks and needs a loan to increase the production of her food, and also to improve the quality of what she offers her customers.  She dreams of being able to prosper and have a large business where she can increase her income.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, cheese, oil, rice, sugar, pasta, salt and yerba (an herb) and to buy meat (pork, beef, chicken).  To buy cassava, fruit and vegetables, drinks, sodas, soft drinks and sweets, etc.

loans.name: Rafis

texts.ru: Rafis rodilsya v 1973 qodu. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey, kotoriye uchatsya v kolledje. Rafis A. yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona, seychas projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey jenoy, detmi i materyu. Rafis uje 6 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom pochinki mashin. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye zapchasti i instrumenti dlya pochinki mashin. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadi kotoriy toje zanimayetsya etim delom.
texts.en: Rafis was born in 1973. He is married and has two children who go to college.  Rafis A. is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the Fuzuli region who now lives in Baku with his wife, children, and mother.  Rafis has been repairing cars for six years.  Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy needed parts and tools to repair cars.  He started this business with his uncle who also does this work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools

loans.name: Alma Vee

texts.en:
Alma Vee G. is from the village of Tagpako, Gingoog City. She is 39 years old. Alma Vee is widowed and has four adult children. Alma Vee owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Alma Vee has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2011, Alma Vee joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Alma Vee is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alma Vee from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Maria Digna

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

María se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado caprino y ovino en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad la realiza hace 9 años, por ello conoce a la perfección este rubro.

María desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria is a 31-year-old mother of a family. She is married and lives with her children in the district of Mochumí -- an agricultural area with substantial commercial traffic located more than half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Maria makes her living by raising and commercializing sheep and goat livestock that she grows in a yard near her home. She feeds the animals natural grass and grains, and when they reach a good level of development, she offers them for sale to merchants who frequently visit the area where she lives. She has been in this business for nine years, which is why she knows this line of work to perfection.

Maria would like to purchase additional livestock and balanced animal feed to expand her business and to obtain a higher level of income. For this reason, she has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 soles which will help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Razzok

texts.en:
Razzok D. is a hardworking man who has one child. His wife works in a maternity hospital and she has additional income from her services. 

Razzok is working as a taxi driver in the urban route. For five years he has been in this business. Besides this business he works as an electrician in his region. 

This year he plans to purchase an apricot garden and he will process his apricots. From the profits he would like to build a house. 

Razzok would like to get a loan of 10,000 TJS for purchasing the apricot garden in order to make a good profit and improve his life. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy an apricot garden.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and married. She has been running her own shop for four years. Josephine earns around 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) a month and hopes to own a big shop in the future. 

Josephine has been a good client who repays her loans well. This is her fifth loan with KADET. Josephine intends to take a 40,000 KES loan to buy cooking oil, sugar, tea leaves and flour for her shop. As a hardworking individual, she plans to use the proceeds from this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, tea leaves, and flour for her shop.

loans.name: Juarez Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad, ella tiene  02 hijas, con las cuales vive en casa propia, dicha casa está ubicada en la Caserío Palominos distrito de Tambogrande en Piura. Teodora vive en la parte rural de este distrito, y cuenta con servicio de luz.
