Teodora  se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral; esta actividad la realiza desde hace 7 años y cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos, para desarrollar dicha actividad, los cuales están ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando el ganado alcanza el tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.Complementariamente trabaja en un fundo de Maracuyá y con estas actividades ella cubre las necesidades de sus hogar.

Teodora está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para poder invertir en la compra de mas animales para su engorde, con su respectivo alimento balanceado.

Teodora es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Teodora is a 33-year-old mother; she has two daughters living with her in her own house which is located in the Palominos hamlet, Tambogrande District in Piura.  Teodora lives in the rural part of this district and she has electricity.

Teodora raises sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl to sell.  She’s been in this line of work for 7 years and has appropriate, spacious corrals for this activity located in her back yard.  When the animals reach ideal size and weight she sells them at the local market.  She’s also employed at a passion fruit large farming firm and with these activities is able to meet household needs.

Teodora is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more animals to raise as well as to buy their respective feed.

Teodora is quite a hard working woman who strives daily to get ahead and have a better quality of life.  People who know her consider her to be a kind person who is always willing to help others.

loans.use: to buy more animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Moun

texts.en: There are numerous Cambodians who make a living as domestic rice cultivators; one of them is Mrs. Moun who has been working in this sector since 2008. She and her husband grow different kinds of crops and fruit on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they can generate an income of around 11 USD per day. This polite couple has three single children who are students. This rainy season, the family wants to plant potatoes, but they don’t have money to grow them. Because of this issue, Mrs. Moun needs a loan from Kiva in order to plant potatoes.

loans.use: to plant potatoes

loans.name: Melchedick

texts.en:
Melchedick is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children. Melchedick provides motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle taxi) services. He has had this business for 11 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and to pay for the utilities needed for the service.

Melchedick is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for the utilities needed for the service

loans.name: Kuku's Group

texts.en:
Microfinance in Kyrgyzstan provides small loans to entrepreneurs with small and mid-sized businesses, which comprise 40% of the country’s businesses. It is especially crucial for women, who are vulnerable but eager and full of enthusiasm to start up their own independent businesses. 

Kuku, 66, is the leader of this group. She is a widow and brought up three kids, the youngest of whom is a high school freshman. Her sons live independently in the capital, while Kuku together with her daughter stays in a small fishing town Balykchi, which attracts thousands of tourists both from Kyrgyzstan and abroad. The constant flow of tourists is a key to Kuku’s business success. 

As she is already retired, all she does is manage her orchard with plenty of fruits and vegetables. This year she was blessed with a very rich harvest of apricot and apples. They do not stay in a warehouse for long and get sold very easily. A monthly profit of 3,700 soms allowed her to purchase new furniture for the house and other necessary things. This year’s savings plus the loan that Kuku is requesting from Kiva lenders will help her finance a trip to her sons in the capital of Bishkek and spend some time with them there. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to cover transportation costs so she can visit her sons

loans.name: Kankoe Georges

texts.fr:
Georges est un homme de 36 ans. Il est marié à une commerçante. Georges est père d’un enfant.
Georges travaille comme couturier depuis 2003.Il achète des tissus et des pagnes  sur les marchés appropriés à Lomé pour la confection des habits prêt à porter. Son atelier se situe à Afanoukopé  la rue en face de la station ; il se fait aider par un employé.
Georges a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter  des tissus et des pagnes pour la confection des habits.
texts.en:
Georges is 36 and married to a small-scale retailer. He is the father of one child. He has been working as a tailor since 2003. He buys textiles and lengths of African print cloth at the markets in  Lomé to use to make ready-to-wear clothing. His workshop is located in Afanoukopé, the street opposite the station. He has one employee to help him. 

He has requested his first-ever loan from WAGES in order to buy textiles and African print cloth to make into clothing.

loans.use: to buy textiles and lengths of African print cloth.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel, de 23 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador; que vive junto a su mamá Elizabeth, su papá Clemente y su hermano Paúl. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. Esté responsable joven, hace 6 años que se dedica a la agricultura ayudando a salir adelante a su madre. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, alverja y hortalizas, los cuales siembra a gran escala, ya que sus padres heredaron muchos terrenos agrícolas, pero no tienen el capital necesario para poder producirlos. Lo que más le gusta a Joel, es poder esparcir la semilla de su producción, ya que según menciona, “es símbolo de un nuevo objetivo”. En cada cosecha, Joel, viaja al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Pero como joven ambicioso, el desea más adelante abrir una empresa de ganadería, donde pueda criar y comercializar la carne de los animales más comercializados. Ya que en su localidad, las personas se dedican mayormente a esa actividad. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está orgulloso del progreso obtenido hasta hoy. Por ello espera del apoyo de todos ustedes en este nuevo préstamo. Joel de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos; los cuales esparcirá en sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
Joel, 23, is an unmarried man and a hard worker.  He lives with his mom Elizabeth, his dad Clemente, and his brother Paúl.  The family lives together in their own home, located in the town of Ricrican. 

He is a responsible young man.  For the last 6 years he has been working in farming, helping his mother to move forward in life.  His main crops consist of potatoes, peas, and vegetables, which he grows on a large scale as his parents inherited many agricultural fields but lack the capital needed to make them productive. 

What Joel like most is scattering the seeds for his crops, which he talks about as "a symbol of a new goal." 

At each harvest, Joel travels to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  However, as an ambitious young man, he wants later on to start a business in livestock, where he can raise the most marketable animals and sell their meat, as people in his area mostly work in this type of business.

Joel belongs to the communal bank "Mirando a un Futuro Mejor", ("Looking for a Better Future"), and this is his second loan through MFP.  He is proud of the progress he has made to date, so he is hoping for the support of all of you in this new loan. 

On receiving the support, Joel will invest the requested money to buy organic fertilizers, which he will spread with his next crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, bath soaps, dishwashing soaps, laundry detergents, and other daily use products.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica está casada con el señor Aristarco y con quien procreo  cinco hijos que aún están a su responsabilidad.

    Ella solicito el préstamo en la compra  de ropas para luego venderlo en la misma localidad, también comprará tela para elaborar mandiles. Esta actividad la lleva practicando hace 10 años  y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso.

    Ella se inspiro en esta actividad por que su papa le dio la idea del negocio, ya que al principio ella trabajaba junto con su papá en éste mismo negocios, pero después por si sola  comenzó a comprar las ropas y a salir a vender y así apoyarse con los ingresos de la casa.

    Lo que desea es con el préstamo es que pueda comprar más ropas de mejor calidad así las ganancias sean mejor para comprar una maquina de coser mas cómoda y costurar mas días a la semana.
texts.en:
Verónica is married to Aristarco, with whom she has five children who are still their financial responsibility.

She is requesting this loan to buy clothing to sell, and to buy cloth, which she will use to make aprons. She's made a living this way for 10 years, and she says it's going well for her and provides a good income.

She was inspired to start the business by her father, since she used to work at it with him but eventually went out on her own to buy clothing and sell it and use her earnings to support her household.

She would like to use the loan to buy higher-quality clothing so that she'll earn more, which will enable her to buy a more comfortable sewing machine and be able to sew more days a week.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nora Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PRO DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Pisaq, perteneciente a la provincia D. Calca,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nora Bertha; ella tiene 61 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. condimentos como ajo molido, pimenta, aji entre otros condimentos, la socia venD. en el mercado D. Pisaq desD. las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante  sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. condimentos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar condimentos como ajo, aji, pimienta y sal al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “PRO DESARROLLO” ("Pro Development") communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Pisaq, which is part of Calca province, in Cusco department.

The member is Señora Nora Bertha; she is 61 years old and is married with seven children.  The member combines her daily activities with her business selling spices such as ground garlic, pepper, cayenne pepper and others.  She sells in the market at Pisaq from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m., and by means of this business the member has been able to move her children ahead in life.

The member would like to expand and improve her business selling spices.  She is requesting the loan to buy spices such as garlic, cayenne pepper, pepper and salt at wholesale.

The member is happy about the loan and agrees to comply with the repayments.

loans.use: to buy spices such as garlic, cayenne pepper, pepper and salt at wholesale.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul de 52 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace 5 años Raul se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su  seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio sea más grande y tenga productos más surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.  Raul es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarles todo lo mejor a los suyos.
texts.en:
Raul is 52 years old and lives with his family in his own house which has no basic services and is located in the rural district of Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Piura. This area is noted for its agriculture, livestock, arts and crafts.

Raul has been selling staples (milk, rice, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, etc) and beverages for the last 5 years. He has located his store in his house for safey reasons. He tries to cover all the household expense and improve his family's quality of life with the profit he makes from selling his products.

In order to be able to expand his business, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy more goods with the sole purpose of growing his business and offering a bigger variety of products to his customers. Raul is a responsible person, dedicated and hardworking who cares about providing his family with the best.

loans.use: to buy more goods to stock his store with groceries for his customers.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a farmer in Murang’a, Central Kenya. He is 52 years old, married, and has two adult children. He has been farming for 20 years. His farm produces tea, coffee, and milk, which goes to the local market.

Julius has requested a loan of 63,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the loan will improve his income and reduce his dependence on his children. He says he wants to own six dairy cows. 

Julius says Juhudi has made it easier for farmers to create wealth.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is 36 years old and married, and has a 17-year-old child. Benjamin is able to support his family through his business. He works hard to improve his income and save for his child's college education. He requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other supplies. He hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other supplies.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y emprendedora, le gusta los nuevos desafíos. Vive con su pareja Abel y sus dos hijos de 14 y 13 años, además de un sobrino, al cual apoya con su educación. La actividad que realiza carmen es la costura, oficio que aprendió con su madre desde muy joven y ahora le sirve para generarse un ingreso económico, realizándolo desde su propio hogar. Paralela a esta actividad, se dedica a  la compra  y venta de semillas, las cuales compra a los productores y los envía fuera de la región a pedido. El servicio de costura lo realiza desde hace diez años, mientras que la venta de semilla desde hace un año. Lo que le gusta de sus actividades, es que le generan ingresos económicos con los cuales puede pagar sus gastos, así como también el poder conocer y relacionarse con más personas. Comenta que le gusta  la costura desde muy joven, lo considera rentable por que es bastante requerida por la calidad de su trabajo y tiene un clientela fiel que siempre la buscan por su trabajo. Tiene planes de ampliar y mejorar su negocio comprando una maquina de coser semindustrial. Este sería el crédito número siete con MFP, se siente cómoda con el trabajo de su banco comunal, considera a sus miembros buenas personas, puntuales y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de semillas en mayores cantidades, para así poder tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old and a hardworking, cheerful, and enterprising woman who enjoys new challenges. She lives with her partner Abel and their two children (ages 14 and 13). Carmen also has a nephew who she is supporting with his education.

She is a seamstress and learned this trade from her mother when she was a young girl. Now this skill provides her a source of income. Carmen works from home. In addition to this business, she also buys and sells seeds. She purchases the seeds from the producers and then ships them outside of the region based on her orders. Carmen has been providing sewing services for 10 years, while she has been selling seeds for one year. What she likes about these activities is being able to generate income to pay for expenses. In addition, these businesses provide her with the opportunity to know and build relationships with more people. She says that she has enjoyed sewing since she was a young girl because she considers it to be profitable. This job requires that she produce quality work and she has loyal customers who are always requesting her services. Her plans include expanding and improving her business by purchasing a semi-industrial sewing machine.

This will be her seventh loan with MFP. Carmen feels comfortable working with her Communal Bank because she considers the members to be good people who are both punctual and supportive. The amount she requested will be invested entirely in the purchase of seeds in large quantities so that she can generate more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds in large quantities to sell.

loans.name: Majaliwa

texts.en:
Majaliwa is taking another Kiva loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to boost her business. With this loan, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes, Khangas, and cosmetics for resale. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.

Majaliwa is giving thanks to Yehu and Kiva Lenders for giving her loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 29 years old. He lives in the village Matani, East Georgia, with his family: wife Lela and his 2 years old daughter. Mikheil and Lela have a small rabbit-breeding farm. They sell rabbits in the village. Along with the farm, they own small grocery store in the village, located in their yard. Mikheil and Lela purchase grocery products on wholesale market and sell them in their store. Total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris.

Mikheil requested credit for expansion of the rabbit-breeding farm. He will purchase additional pure-strain rabbits for the farm. After the domestic animals start breeding Mikheil will have more rabbits for sale. It will increase family’s income. Mikheil and Lela plan to use increased income for renovation of their house, as it is old and already in bed conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pure-strain rabbits for expansion of the rabbit farm.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is 30 years old and single with no children yet. He describes himself as a courageous man. Previously, he was involved in a grocery store activity. For the last two years, he has been providing taxi transportation services to frequent customers in a strategic and suitable place for the business. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy a bicycle to increase his modes of transportation. His dream and hope is to own a transportation industry.

loans.use: To purchase a bicycle

loans.name: Alexandrine Bernadette's Group

texts.fr: Bernadette, responsable du groupe de deux peronnes, vit maritalement et n'a pas encore d'enfant. Elle est couturière de profession et revend des pagnes au domicile des parents. Ses approvisionnements se font selon la zone favorable. Pour accroître son chiffre d' affaire et maximiser son profit , elle compte  renouveller  son micro crédit à Finadev afin d'honorer ses engagements vis-à-vis de ses clients  et de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Bernadette is responsible for this two-person group. She's married but doesn't have children yet. She's a professional seamstress and she resells pagnes (colorful African cloth) at her parent's home.

She gets her supplies from adequate areas. To increase her revenue and maximize her profit, she intends to renew her loan from Kiva's partner, Finadev, in order to fulfill her commitments towards her customers, and help with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes (colorful African cloth), one sewing machines, and threads

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has 4 children. She is a petty trader at Mpredwow, trading in groundnuts which she has done for 2 years. Her husband is a driver. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family. She will use the loan to purchase more groundnuts to sell. With the new profits from her business, Esi plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Nitzimi Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo Nitzimi son mujeres muy alegres y solidarias pues se apoyan mutuamente ante cualquier situación. Son originarias de una comunidad mexiquense peculiar pos su tranquilidad y riqueza natural; de igual forma su cultura y fiestas son especiales ya que proviene desde la edad prehispánica. 
   El nombre del grupo es un vocablo mazahua cuyo significado es “Capilla”, lo decidieron para hacer mención de su tradición originaria y religiosa mostrando así la mezcla cultural que se vive en las comunidades indígenas. Huelga decir que el municipio conserva la lengua, cultura y costumbres de sus antepasados. 
   Doña María Ignacia es miembro del grupo y sus conocidos sabes que es una persona muy amable y, sobre todo, muy trabajadora. Es una persona de edad avanzada pero eso no es ningún impedimento para solventar de manera efectiva sus gastos, actualmente vive con su esposo Juan quien trabaja como albañil. Para lograr cumplir sus objetivos, cada día se levanta desde muy temprana hora para volcar sus energías en la cría de ovejas esto, a su vez, le ayuda mantener la jovialidad que la caracteriza. Con 25 años de experiencia en su actividad y una amplia lista de clientes, conoce todos los detalles para llevar a cabo un excelente desarrollo sobre cada ejemplar. 
   Actualmente tienen seis ovejas en los corrales ubicados a un costado de su hogar pero desea incrementar su producción y por lo tanto ha buscado el apoyo que ofrece VFMéxico para lograrlo. "Con este nuevo préstamo podemos comprar nuestros animalitos para mejorar poco a poco" comentó hablando en su nombre y en  el de Eugenia y Silvina, sus compañeras, quienes se dedican al mismo negocio; mientras que Margarita hace lo propio en una tienda de abarrotes. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio, Doña María Ignacia es quien está colocada al final de izquierda a derecha.
texts.en:
The group members are very happy and always supportive of one another. They live in a peaceful community with a lot of culture. Their big celebration is December 12th. This is when the townspeople who raise and fatten up animals for a living will sell them, which helps to cover some of their expenses.

The name "Nitzimin" is a Mazahua word meaning "chapel", and it is also the name of this group formed by four hard-working women from a community belonging to the State of Mexico that still conserves the language, culture and traditions of its ancestors.

Maria Ignacia, 67, is a very friendly, talkative person, but above all very hard-working even though her children no longer depend on her. She worries about paying her expenses. She is married to Juan who is a construction worker.

While Juan works building houses, Maria Ignacia helps with home expenses by raising sheep, which she has been doing for 25 years. She buys them when they are very young and cares for them over many years while they achieve a considerable height and weight. She then sells them to other people in her community or to barbecuers.

Currently, she has six sheep at home, but this is not sufficient because she wants to expand her animal farm. All of the members chase the same dream, but due to lack of money they cannot get ahead. With this new loan, Maria Ignacia can buy animals and grow her business little by little.

She does not have any problems because she has a lot of experience with lambs. She doesn't spend a lot on feeding them because she takes advantage of the grass in open fields. Every afternoon she and her children take their sheep to graze.

The other group members are Margarita, who will invest in groceries, Eugenia and Silvina who will invest in sheep.

*The photo was taken in the town garden. Maria Ignacia is the last one on the right.

loans.use: buy young lambs.

location.town: SAN NICOAS GUADALUPE, SAN FELIPE DEL PROGRESO

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married with four children and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more fresh fish to sell to her local market.

Josephine has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from buy and sell dried fish. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Molina

texts.en:
C. Molina is 27 years old, is married, and has one son. She currently sells clothes for a local clothing company. The clothing company pays her $65 per month and she also earns a commission of about $10 per day from her sales.  Her husband is a driver for a company, and he earns a salary of $110 per month. 

C. Molina is requesting a loan of $800 to use to purchase more clothing to sell. She is excited about the idea of being able to expand her business. In the future she would like to be able to buy a shop to sell her clothing in, and once her income is large enough she would like to build a home for her family. She believes that this loan will help her to improve her business, increase her family\'s standard of living, and move her closer to fulfilling her dreams.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.en:
For some years now, I have dedicated myself to the making and selling of shirts. I also buy some to sell alongside the ones I make. My sales have increased a lot, and I have started working full time. My clients are pleased with the shirts, and some buy from me wholesale. With the income I recieve from this business I can help with family expenses, namely helping with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace algunos anos me dedico a la fabricacion y venta de camisetas, tambien compro algunas para venderlas junto a las que confecciono. Mis ventas han mejorado mucho ya que me he dedicado a tiempo completo a este negocio, mis clientes se complacen con las camisetas, algunos me compran al por mayor. Con los ingresos que percibo de este negocio puedo ayudar con los gastos de mi familia y principalmente ayudarles en sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy cloth, thread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bicycles for his bicycle transport business

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Ms. Em H. is 46 years old and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia. Her full-time job is to care for her five children. Her husband is a hard-working farmer and earns about two dollars a day.

Ms. Em H. would like to purchase a motorcycle in order to carry the family's farm products to the market. She hopes to receive $800 in loans to be able to start this effort.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Mrs. Comfort E. is a 58 year old woman, who has a chemist shop for the care of people in her community. She is married with seven (7) children, and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She hopes to get the loan amount of $400 for business improvement, i.e., buying more drugs for sale. She has been in this business for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Rogerio Martin

texts.es:
The micro-entrepreneur Rogerio Martín C. is 45 years old, lives in the city of Bluefields, is married and has three kids. Two study in primary school and one at the secondary level. For the past six years he has dedicated himself to the jewelry profession, making rings, earrings, gold chains, as well as repairing these same products. Currently he has a large quantity of requests for graduation rings but due to lack of money he cannot buy the stones and gold needed to make them. This demand for rings is because in the months of November and December many High School graduations occur and as a remembrance students buy rings with engravings alluding to their respective schools. In order to facilitate the purchase of his products, Mr. C. allows customers to pay for the rings in four or five installments, since for many parents it is difficult to pay the total cost of these rings all at one time. Micro-entrepreneur C. employs one other person who he pays a head of the household (full-time) salary. The cost of the square stones used for rings is $2.00 U.S. each, the stones for graduation rings are valued at $3.00 US, a pound of plaster costs $2.00 US, and a gram of gold can be purchased for $8.00.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El microempresario Rogerio Martín C. tiene 45 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Bluefields, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, dos estudian en primaria y uno en nivel secundario. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la profesión de joyero fabricando anillos, aretes, cadenas de oro, así como la reparación de estos mismos productos. Actualmente tiene una gran cantidad de pedidos de anillos de promoción pero por falta de dinero no puede comprar las piedras y el oro para su elaboración. Esta demanda de anillos se debe a que en los meses de noviembre y diciembre se realizan las graduaciones del nivel secundario y como recuerdo los estudiantes compran anillos con grabaciones alusivas a sus respectivos colegios. El señor C. a fin de dar facilidades en las compras de sus productos les permite pagar los anillos en cuatro o cinco partes valorando que a muchos padres de familia se les dificulta pagar de una sola vez el total de estos anillos. El microempresario C. tiene contratado a una persona por lo que aporta a la generación de empleo de una cabeza de familia. El valor de las piedras cuadradas para anillos es de US$ 2.00 dólares cada una, las piedras para anillos de promoción están valoradas en US$ 3.00 dólares cada una, la libra de yeso cuesta US$ 2.00 dólares cada libra y el gramo de oro se compra a US$ 8.00 cada gramo.

loans.use: To buy 20 square stones for various rings, 20 stones for graduation rings, 10 pounds of plaster, and 20 grams of gold.

loans.name: Faig

texts.en:
Faig Mehraliyev is 44 years old. He is from Sumgayit city in the Azerbaijan Republic, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan.  Right now he lives in Sumgayit with his family. He is the only breadwinner of his family. He works in the café situated in the central market. He began his business 5 years ago. 
He wants to carry out repair work and to buy necessary tools and equipment for his café. He has already gathered some money for repair work. But it is not enough, so he needs borrow money.
Faig would like to receive a $300 loan in order to repair his café and to buy necessary tools and equipment.  He will repay the loan within 12 months. He hopes eventually to expand his business and improve the living condition of his family. He will repay his loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to carry out repair work and to buy necessary tools and equipments for his café

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is a 46 years old and the mother of four children. She lives in the Lebanese town of Aley, where she supports her family by making embroidery and other kinds of handicrafts. This is the third time Najwa has sought a loan from Al Majmoua, and we are proud of the way she has used her previous loans to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for a handicraft business

loans.name: Buguwa I A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sofia N.. She is currently operating a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase her stock. Sofia is 28 years old and is married to a farmer. She has four children, ranging from age 1.5 to 12 years old. Only one of her children attends school. Each week, Sofia makes approximately UGX 17000 in profit. With the extra profit she earns, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Sofia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, to the amount of UGX 600000, to buy sacks of sugar. The loan was paid back on time.

Sofia is joined in her small group by Efrancee N., Jovia I., Agatha N., and Salama K.. Efrance N. has a business selling charcoal and wants to expand her business. Jovia I. is currently operating a retail shop and wants a loan to purchase more items. Agatha N. operates a retail shop and wants to add more stock. Salama K. is currently selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to increase her stock and improve her business.

loans.use: To invest in a retail shop business

loans.name: Yahe

texts.en:
Yahe is 56 years old. He and his wife have raised six children. Yahe is a doctor at the City Central Hospital. Yahe was raised in a rural area. Though he had graduated from the Medical Institute and worked as a doctor for more than 20 years, Yahe never forgot how to work the land. Ten years ago he decided to find an additional source of income in order to better support his large family and to arrange the weddings and dowry for all of his children. Thus he started growing onions.

Yahe believes that the onion business is quite profitable and generates considerable additional income for his family. He now requests a loan of 2,000.00 Somoni (US$600.00) for 12 months to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Yahe has received one previous loan and managed it with accuracy. He promises to repay the new loan on a timely basis and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and fertilizer for growing the onion.

loans.name: Sek Chan

texts.en: Sek Chan N. is 46 years old and lives in Siem Reap. She is a housewife while her husband works at a night club along with their eldest son. Her husband, Tuong Phan, earns US $6 per day. They want to secure their family's future by building a better home from which to possibly run a business in the future.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mr. Horn H. and his wife Mrs. Kong CHHOUN have been married since 1988 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Their daughters work in a garment factory, while their sons are in school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Horn started his motor Remoque taxi business in 1995. He carries goods and people from his village to Phnom Penh and from Phnom Penh to the village. With the income from the business, he is able to send all of his children to school. His wife does not have a job; she stays at home and takes care of the children. However, by now, Mr. Horn's trailer has become old and is broken, and he therefore needs to buy a new one. He is requesting a loan of US$1,000 for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase of a trailer for a motor Remoque taxi business

loans.name: Zarovsha

texts.en:
Zarovsha M. is a married, 45-year-old woman with four children.The family lives in the 'Internally Displaced People Settlement' within the Bilasuvar region.

She has been breeding sheep for meat production for more than 20 years Summer is high season for weddings and thus a high demand for meat. Zarovsha would like to meet this demand by using a loan to expand her sheep herd. Her business is the only source of income for her family and she is barely covering the basic family needs.

Zarovsha is asking for the loan to purchase fifteen sheep and fodder to feed them.

loans.use: To purchase fifteen additional sheep and fodder

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Hello, our group, New Dawn, consists of three business partners, Sonia F., 46 years old, Mayra L., 35 years old, and Vera H., 35 years old.  All of us have the support of our husbands to provide for our families. Our group has been around for 14 years and we live in San Lorenzo, Valle department.  
Our work is in the sales of tortillas and fresh juice. In our country, the tortilla is an indispensable food that nearly the entire population uses as an accompaniment to every meal.  The sales of fresh juice is  great also, since it is very hot where we live.  In addition, the natural drinks are very healthy and refresh the body, and people prefer them as they are rich in vitamins.  The juices we sell the most are those of Melon, orange juice, lime juice, and Watermelon juice.
Right now, all of the products have suffered a rise in prices and everything is more expensive. As a result, we need a loan in order to be able to inject capital into our business and continue to meet the demand of our clients, who are many since we sell our goods in the municipal market of San Lorenzo.  We need your help to accomplish our goals.
Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

hola nuestro grupo Nuevo Amanecer esta conformado por 2 socias mas, en total somos 3, Sonia F. 46 años de edad, Mayra L. de 35 años de edad y la sra Vera H. de 35 años de edad todas nosotras tenemos el apoyo de nuestros esposos para la alimentacion de nuestras familias.
nuestero grupo tiene 14 años de conocernos todas vivimos en San Lorenzo, departamento de Valle, 
nuestro rubro es el de venta de tortillas y refrescos naturales, en nuestro pais la tortilla es un alimento indispensable ya que casi toda la poblacion la utiliza como acompañante de los tres tiempos de comida, 
la venta de refrescos naturales es muy buena tambien ya que en el lugar en donde nosotros vivimos es muy caliente y los frescos naturales ademas que son saludables refrescan el cuerpo y la gente los prefiere ya que son ricos en vitaminas. los que mas se venden son los de melon, naranja, lima y sandia.
en estos momentos todos los productos han sufrido una alza en sus precios y todo esta mas caro, por lo que necesitamos un prestamo para poderle inyectar capital a nuestros negocios y asi poder cubrir con la demanda de nuestos clientes que son muchos ya que nuestras ventas las realizamos en el mercado municipal de San Lorenzo.
necesitamos la ayuda para cumplir nuestas metas.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, salt, lime, fruits, water and sugar.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena is 29 years old and lives with her three month old baby and her husband, who works in filming. Magdalena is a native of the Azangaro province, but really settled in the Mina “La Rinconada”, where she has a business selling CDs and videos in a place rented with her husband Edgar, who is not at home a lot as he also has his filming business, which means that he travels a great deal. Magdalena started her business a year ago, struggling in the evenings with the harsh, cold weather of this part of the country. Doing this allowed her to do both her duties; as a businesswoman and as a mother. Her reason for her efforts was to succeed in building her business, so that her husband will not have to travel as much and to guarantee a good future for their little Dilmar. The loan she is looking for is to add to her merchandise and expand her business. Magdalena is a great businesswoman, generating more income for the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Magdalena tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo quien trabaja en filmaciones y con su bebe de tres meses de nacido. Magdalena es natural de la provincia de Azangaro, pero radica actualmente en la Mina “La Rinconada”, donde tiene un negocio de venta de discos de música y video en un local alquilado con su Esposo Edgar, quien no está mucho en casa ya que se dedica también al negocio de las filmaciones, lo cual hace que esté en constantes viajes. Magdalena realiza este trabajo desde hace un año atrás, luchando por las tardes con el inclemente frió de esta zona del país; haciendo que esto le permita cumplir actualmente con sus dos labores; su función de negociante y su función de madre. En motivo de su esfuerzo es conseguir que su negocio crezca, para que su esposo Edgar no tenga que viajar tanto y asegurar el futuro del pequeño Dilmar. El dinero del préstamo solicitado es para aumentar su mercadería y expandir su negocio, Magdalena se ve como una gran empresaria generando más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: To add to the merchandise of her business(CDs and videos)

loans.name: Aicela

texts.es:
La Sra. Aicela ella tiene poco que adquirir su casa pero le está haciendo falta algunos acabados en el exterior y reparación al techo.

La Sra. Aicela es soltera y trabaja en una compañía de chofer de entregas productos en varias tiendas de la cuidad de Nuevo Laredo. Este es su ingreso familiar.

Ella en cuanto se entero que Fvp y kiva le podían ayudar a realizar su mejora más rápido y sin descapitalizarse inmediatamente acudió a las oficinas para solicitar un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls para la reparación del techo y acabados de exterior de la casa.
texts.en:
Aicela has little left to do on her house, but it does still lack some finishing touches to the exterior and requires repairs to the ceiling.

Aicela is single and works in a company that offers product delivery services for various stores in the city of Nuevo Laredo. This represents her regular source of income.

As soon as she found out that field partner FVP and KIVA could help her to make the improvements quickly and without being undercapitalized, she immediately went to the offices to ask for a loan of $1,000.00 to complete ceiling repairs and exterior finishes to her house.


Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Exterior finishes and ceiling repair for the home.

loans.name: Sasa

texts.en:
Sasa T., 30, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the farming business. She sells to the village people 7 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Sasa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She needs this loan to buy the equipment used in her business. Her husband and children help her.

loans.use: Purchase the equipment used in her business

loans.name: Try

texts.en: Mrs. Try A., the 43-year-old mother of a child attending the local school, lives in Chambork Village in Takeo Province.  She owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice, but because her soil has become infertile, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers. Try’s husband, Mr. Ang Doeu, shown on the left in the photo, is a construction worker who makes only a small income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Dos Mil (“Two Thousand”) Village Bank. Ana is 29 years old and married with three children. She sells Avon and Esika brand cosmetics by catalog; most of her customers are friends, family members and colleagues. Ana also works as a secretary at a local institution. Ana needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy lipstick and perfume. Ana’s dreams are to buy a plot of land to build her own house and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil. Ana es casada, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Ana vende cosméticos por catálogos, de dos líneas como Esika, Avon, sus productos ofrece a amigos, familiares y colegas, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Ana trabaja en una institución como secretaria. Ana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de labiales, colonias. Los sueños de Ana son comprar un terreno y construir su casa, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy lipstick and perfume

loans.name: Mr. Sar Phlang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank consists of twenty two members and is located in Chek village in Kandal province. They plan to use the loan they obtain for different purposes. Mr. S. P. is the bank president and was selected by the members. He and his wife, Mrs. Nhey Cham, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living.

They face an obstacle in the plantation because their field is infertile, which has a bad effect on their crop. In order to deal this problem, Mr. S. P. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the crop and make it more productive. He hopes to increase their incoM. and improve their living conditions with this loan. He is 49 years old and the father of five childrE.. Two of the childrE. are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay aN. principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments maN. months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on tiM.. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to support the crop to make it more productive.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget E. is 40 years old and married with six children.  She lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria.  She has a poultry business where she raises birds and sells both birds and eggs.  She is requesting a loan for N170000 to purchase more birds to sell.  She says thank you to all that make this loan possible!

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama B. is a 39 year old trader who is married with two children. Her children are in school. She is a very resourceful wife and mother whose hard effort brings livelihood to the family. Ama supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing. Selling of used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive. Ama has been in this business for the past 9years. Presently she sells through hawking which means she walks from door to door  through the scorching sun all day to make ends meet. Ama is asking for a loan of $375 to buy more bales of used thing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would allow her to rent a store where she could sell the clothes and  to save for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Gladys Reyna

texts.es:
Gladis es socia del Banco Comunal Las Hormigas.
Gladis es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Gladis se dedica a la venta de lanas en el penal de la ciudad de Ayacucho, a donde acude los días miércoles y sábados, días de visita. Además Gladis tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, carnes y abarrotes en general.
Gladis necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Gladis son que sus negocios progresen y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gladis is a member of the Las Hormigas ("The Ants") Community Bank. Gladis is married, is 40 years old and has four children. Gladis is dedicated to selling wool in the jail of Ayacucho city, where she goes to visit on Wednesdays and Saturdays. Additionally, Gladis has a shop in her house from where she sells produce, meat and general groceries. Gladis needs a loan of 1,000 soles which will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Gladis' dreams are that her businesses progress and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery cuenta con 42 años de edad, vive con su pareja durante 14 años y tiene 7 hijos, viven en la casa que heredó en sus padres. Mujer de varios oficios; se dedica a criar cuyes, al tejido, a la venta de comestibles y también tiene algunos cultivos. Pero la mayor parte de su tiempo lo dedica a sus tejidos artesanales, donde pone toda su imaginación y creatividad. Con su herramienta fundamental, que es su pequeño telar y un cuadro o fotografía para guiarse de los colores y detalles del dibujo, confecciona sus tapices. Ahora, también está tejiendo chompas para niñas y niños de madejas gruesas, lo cual le resulta muy rentable, y con la venta de sus tapices, puede vivir con tranquilidad y cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos. Este arte textil los heredó de sus padres, y se siente muy orgullosa, con anhelos de tejer tapices en cantidades mayores para la Semana Santa, donde su pueblo es muy visitados por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Mery es la presienta de su banco comunal, este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de materiales para sus tejidos, con el afán de captar mayores ingresos económicos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Mery is 42 years old and she has lived with her husband for the past 14 years. She has 7 children. They live with her in the house that she inherited from her parents. She makes a living by doing a variety of activities. She makes money by raising guinea pigs, weaving, selling food items and she also has a few crops. She makes the most money by selling her weavings and through her weaving she is able to express her creativity and imagination. Her most important tool is her loom and the drawings that she uses to guide the colors in her weavings. Recently she also began knitting sweaters out thick yarn for girls and boys. She is able to make a profit by selling her knitted items and by selling of her woven tapestries. The money that she makes allows her to live with tranquility and to cover the costs of her childrens' educations. Mery's parents taught her how to weave and knit and this makes her feel very proud. She wants to be able to weave a greater quantity of tapestries so that she can sell them during Holy Week. Her town receives many visitors and tourists that come from all around the world. Mery is the president of her communal bank. This will be her third loan with MFP and she has always made her payments on time. The money that she is asking for will be used to buy materials for her weavings so that she can increase her income and improve the quality of life for her family.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her weavings

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria C. is a 49 year old mother of six. Her husband, Eliobe, is a carpenter. This couple were previously employed in a shop where they made native plates and baskets. The baskets are made from “ipgid”, a wild vine that grows in the virgin forest of Libertad, Antique. Upon learning about ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), the couple has decided to apply for a loan to start their own business. Maria has applied for this loan to buy raw materials in bulk to continue making the plates and baskets. She wants to maintain her very good performance in the organization so that she can apply for a larger capital loan in the future. She plans to expand her business by establishing a shop and employing some of her neighbors in order to keep up with her orders. She plans to seek customers not only locally, but also abroad.

loans.use: To buy assorted raw materials in bulk for making native plates and baskets.

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en:
Bassem is a 35-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife. Bassem has been working as a house painter. He also working as a home decorator. He requested a loan of US $500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase painting tools for his work and repair his car. This is the first time that Bassem has requested a loan.

Bassem is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network. Bassem decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his work and learning new decorating techniques.

loans.use: Painting tools and car repair

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Maria Margarita P. V. tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 2do de Secundaria, tiene 3 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
María se dedica a la venta de verduras y de comida rápida, cuando inició tenia un pequeño puesto donde vendía verduras, al darse cuenta que aumentaban sus clientes empezó con la venta de comida rápida (esto desarrollado desde su puesto y en su casa).
Recién ha iniciado como socia, y es miembro del Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II.
Con el crédito de 300, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de comida (arroz, azúcar, aceite, legumbres)
María tiene como sueño poner un restaurante
texts.en:
Señora Maria Margarita P. V. is 28 years old, and lives in the Casa Grande district, in the province of Ascope, La Libertad, Peru.

Maria studied through the second year of High School, and has three children who depend on her financially. Maria devotes herself to selling vegetables and fast food. When she began, she had a small shop where she sold vegetables, but when she realized her number of customers was increasing, she began to sell fast food (prepared in her home).

She has recently become a client and member of the Community Bank Romanas Luchadoras II. With a loan of 300, she will invest in the ingredients she needs to prepare meals (rice, sugar,oil, vegetables).

Maria's dream is to own a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for meal preparation (rice, sugar, oil, vegetables)

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en: Apolonia O. is 45 years old and married with nine children. She sells secondhand clothes. She is requesting the loan of N30,000 to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchases more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Tamella

texts.en:
Tamella H. is a 57-year-old woman who has been engaged in a poultry business for the last 10 years. She is married and has four children. She has dedicated her life to bringing up her children and providing them with quality higher education.

The poultry business is not as easy as it might seem at first sight. Tamella works from early morning till late at night in order to raise good chickens. Tamella chose this business because it is very popular and people come to her and purchase at least one or two chickens every day. She is applying for a $2000 US loan in order to purchase about 150 chickens to expand her business and increase her income. She believes that with the help of this loan she could sell more than five chickens a day.

loans.use: To purchase 150 chickens

loans.name: Neno

texts.en: Neno V. is currently in the business of selling beans at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of beans to sell. Neno is 35 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a lorry (truck) for transporting goods from place to place. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène S. est une mariée, mère de 6 enfants. Elle tient un poulailler et fait aussi du commerce de produits de teinture. Elle aimerait renforcer son activité pour mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Hélène S. is married and the mother of 6 children. She has a henhouse and also sells dye products. She would like to improve her business in order to better provide for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For bird farming and selling dye products

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a very assiduous woman. She is striving hard to provide for the needs of her family and to send her children to school. Everyday she roams around their village just to sell her products. She sells assorted commodities such as vegetables, bread and some cooked snacks and usually earns a daily income of PHP 100.

Remedios wishes to have a prosperous life. In this regard, she is now asking for business capital amounting to PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders. She believes that through the loan, she can sustain her business and she can also help her husband in sustaining their farming needs and be able to continue to send their children to school. Remedios is also planning to put up a small stall in their village where she can display her products.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun K. lives in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. She grasses to sell. Her husband, Mr. Hang Meng, is a fisherman. Since his fishing going well, he wants to expand it purchasing boat and machine to connect the boat for fishing. Thus, Mrs. Oun K. is decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 46 years old and the mother of two children who are farmers who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan for boat and machine to connect the boat for fishing.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Don Juanito que con carino se le conoce en su comunidad su actividad principale es la prestacion de servico de bus de la ciudad de Totonicapan a la comunidad de Poxlajuj  asi viceversa el inicio su propio negocio hace cinco años, hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de repuesto ya que el quiere brindar un servicio al publico con seguridad, ya que se aproxima la feria del municipio la cual quiere aprovechar dicha ocacion.
texts.en:
Don Juanito is known in his area for providing bus services from the city of Totonicapan to the community of Poxlajuj and vice versa. He started his business five years ago and now needs a loan to purchase spare parts. He wants to continue providing this public service as safely as possible. The next town fair is approaching so he wants to make these repairs before this occasion.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his minibus

loans.name: Chimedregzen

texts.en: Chimedregzen is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. His oldest son attends university and his daughter attends a local secondary school. Chimedregzen operates a retail clothing business in a rented stall in his town’s central market. He started his business in 2000 with working capital of 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD). Now his working capital exceeds 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD). Chimedregzen imports his products both from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and China. Because of his hard work and good business skills, Chimedregzen has been able to build a home for his family as well as pay for both his children’s education. He is requesting a 3,800,000 tugrug (~3670 USD) loan to purchase new types of clothing for his business so that he can expand his customer base.

loans.use: to purchase new types of clothing for his business

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Maria; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; ubicados en el distrito D. Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 55 años D. edad, y tiene 2 hijos mayores, ella almacena maíz y trabaja en la municipalidad D. Andahuaylillas como administradora desD. el año 2008, nuestra socia también tiene terrenos, los cuales los cultiva con maíz, papa y otros productos, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un nuevo terreno.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y D. este modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. las cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Las Triunfadoras” communal bank, located 5 minutes from the city of Cuzco in the district of Andahuaylillas.

Maria is 55 years old and has 2 older children. She stores corn and she has worked in the municipality of Andahuaylillas as an administrator since 2008. Maria also has lands, which she uses to cultivate corn, potatoes, and other products. She is asking for this loan to purchase new land.

Maria is thankful for and values the loan provided to her, and she promises to make her loan repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a small plot of land for cultivation

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda M. is from the city of Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Imelda owns and operates a business providing dressmaking services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Imelda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from GDMPC. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Barq Group

texts.en:
This is Barq Group. Muhibullah, an educated man with ample experience in his work, is the leader of Barq Group. He is 24 years old, married, and the father of 6 children: 4 sons and 2 daughters. He is in the business of selling fuel. Currently, his business income is not enough to satisfy his family's needs and wants. Therefore, he wants to expand his business capacity to make a larger profit and increase his business income.

Abdul Mateen is the second member of Barq Group. He is an expert in his field. He wants to get a loan to buy wood and enlarge his business. The third member of this group is Naseerullah, who has a business selling mobile phone cards. Through the income from this business, he supports the 7 members of his family.

They have requested a group loan of 15,000 Afghani to expand their businesses and they have met the requirements to receive this loan. They would like to say many thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Brigida es socia del  Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 47 años de edad y es viuda. Se dedica a la compra y venta de golocinas. 

El grado de instrucción de la señora Brigida es secundaria completa y tiene 2 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de golosinas como: galletas, caramelos, chocolates, yogures, etc..

Su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda de abarrotes y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros, los préstamos y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Brigida, 47, is a member of the "3 de Mayo" communal bank. She lives in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is a widow and is a sweets merchant. She finished secondary school and has two children. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy stock inventory for her business. She is now requesting 1000 new soles to buy sweets such as: cookies, candies, chocolates, yoghurt, etc. Her future desire is to have a grocery store and that her children become professionals. What she likes the most about her communal bank are the savings and the get-togethers with the members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, yoghurt, candies, etc.

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es:
Las Pioneras es el nombre del grupo compuesto por Francisca Inés E. A., Claudia S. y Danelia Carolina C. F. quienes escogieron este nombre porque al empezar a trabajar con Adim sintieron que era un nuevo inicio para ellas y sus negocios.

Francisca Inés E. A. inició su propio negocio para ayudar en los gastos del hogar pero con el tiempo este le ayudo a sentirse realizada y ser independiente. Esta joven de 25 años vende colchones matrimoniales, unipersonales, almohadas y cojines  e invertirá el crédito en la adquisición de inventario en dichos productos. 

Claudia S. tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita característico del pueblo nicaragüense, este tipo de negocio tienen sus inicios en los años 30. Claudia desde las tres de la tarde empieza a colocar su rustico puesto de comida en la acera de su casa esperando la llegada de sus habituales clientes por su carne asada, enchilada, tajadas con quesos, pollo…etc.

Danelia Carolina C. F. vende ropa y cosméticos por encargo, ella inicio con pocos productos pero con el tiempo empozo hacer más clientes y a distribuir más.
texts.en:
Las Pioneras (The Pioneers) is the name of the group comprised of Francisca Inés E. A., Claudia S., and Danelia Carolina C. F.. They chose this name because when they started working with Adim they felt that it was a new start for them and their businesses. Francisca Inés E. A. started her own business to help with the household expenses. In time, this helped her feel fulfilled and independent. She is 25, and she sells double and twin size quilts, pillows, and cushions. She will use the loan to get more inventory of these products. Claudia S. has a “fritanga”, a popular restaurant with fried food that is characteristic of the Nicaraguan towns. This type of business started in the 30’s. At three in the afternoon Claudia starts to set up her rustic food stand on the sidewalk to her house. She waits for the arrival of her regular customers who come for her grilled beef, enchiladas, banana chips with cheese, and chicken, etc. Danelia Carolina C. F. sells clothes and cosmetics by order. She started with a few products. But, in time she started to have more customers and to distribute more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy king, queen, double, and twin quilts and pillows

loans.name: Maria Eufemia

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Crédito es formado por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras que buscan cada día la manera de salir en adelante y así entregarles un mejor futuro a sus familias, viven por distintas partes de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta la tercera ciudad mas importante del Ecuador, es una ciudad que tiene una belleza natural que enamora a propios y extraños.

La Sra. María P. pertenece al banco comunal El Crédito, vive en el Cantón Girón siendo muy visitado por sus hermosas chorreras y su naturaleza, se dedica a la venta los productos YANBAL pues su hija empezó con la venta de estos productos y ella le ayuda, el resto del tiempo se dedica a su casa, tiene 3 años trabajando con su bankito, nos comenta que los prestamos le ha beneficiado mucho en un bazar que tenia, pero lo tuvo que cerrar porque sufre de osteoporosis y reumatismo lo que reprodujo que tenga muchos gastos y ya no pudo mantener su negocio y ya se encuentra en dos años en tratamiento y espera recuperarse pronto.

María tiene 49 años de edad, se encuentra casada, fruto de esta unión ha procreado cuatro hijos de que se encuentran de 31, 28, 22, 18 años de edad, su hija de 31 y su hijo de 22 años son casados y viven independientemente con sus propias familias ya formadas, su hijo de 28 años se encuentra viviendo en el exterior emigrando para darle un mejor futuro a su familia y es quien ayuda le ayuda económicamente para sus medicinas y su hogar, su hija de 18 años estudia en el Colegio Los Andes, su esposo es Chofer, es propietario de un bus de la Cooperativa Trans Girón, no poseen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregó lo va a invertir en el bus de su esposo ya que necesitan comprar repuestos para brindar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros, su gran sueño es que su salud mejore para poder trabajar y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The “El Crédito” Village Bank includes a group of persevering women in a daily quest for success and a better future for their families. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, the third largest city in Ecuador; it’s a city of great beauty that captures the hearts of locals and foreigners. One member of the Village Bank, María P., lives in Cantón Girón, popular for its beautiful waterfalls and nature. She sells YANBAL [beauty] products; her daughter started selling them and she helps out. She spends the rest of her time taking care of her home. She has been with the bank for three years and tells us that the loans had been very helpful when she had a small store, but she had to close the store because she has osteoporosis and rheumatism. She kept incurring expenses and she couldn’t keep up her business. She’s been in treatment for two years and hopes to recover soon. María is 49 and married with four offspring, who are 31, 28, 22, and 18. Her 31-year-old daughter and 22-year-old son are married and live on their own with their families. Her 28-year-old son lives outside the country; he emigrated to provide his family with a better future, and he’s the one who provides María with economic support for her medications and her home. Her 18-year-old daughter goes to the Los Andes School. María’s husband is a driver and owns one bus in the Trans Girón Cooperative. They don’t own a house, so they rent. She plans to use her new loan from FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR for her husband’s bus; they need to buy spare parts so they can provide better service to the passengers. Her greatest dream is that her health will improve so she can work and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for their bus

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 47 años, vive con su pareja, Antonio de 56 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales sólo vive con uno, Edwar de 20 años. La casa es habitan es propia y está ubicada en un lugar apacible de la sierra del peruana.

Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la siembra de arveja, papa, flor de gladiolo, habas y maíz. Paralelamente cría dos caballos y varios asnos que le ayudan a trasladar sus insumos agrícolas hasta su chacra diariamente. A Yolanda le gusta sembrar la arveja y flor de gladiolos porque son los productos que tienen mayor demanda en el mercado y son bastante rentables.
“Dedicándome a la agricultura he podido cubrir la educación de mis hijos, construir mi casa y ahora estoy ahorrando, tal vez para comprarme un carro que transporte mis cosechas”, refiere.
Para el futuro desea incrementar su producción de arveja y instalar una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y ante los integrantes de su banco comunal se compromete a pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, porque al igual que ellos desea salir adelante. Por ello, invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de dos botellas de insecticidas y pesticidas, además de un saco de abono y pagará a algunas personas para fumigar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 47 years old and lives with her partner, Antonio who is 56. They have 3 children, one of whom, Edwar who is 20, lives with them. They live in their own house, which is located in a peaceful area of the Peruvian sierra. For the past 30 years, Yolanda has worked planting peas, potatoes, gladiolus flowers, beans and corn. At the same time she has raised two horses and several donkeys that have helped her daily to move the crops around the farm. Yolanda likes to plant peas and gladiolus flowers because they are products that have the most demand in the market and are very profitable. "Dedicating myself to farming has allowed me to pay for my children's education, build my house and now I am saving, perhaps to buy a car to transport my harvest," she says. For the future she wants to increase her pea production and set up a grocery store in her house. This is Yolanda's first loan with MFP and before the members of her communal bank she promises to punctually pay her fees, because, like the others, she wants to get ahead in life. She will invest the money she is requesting in buying two bottles of insecticide and pesticide as well as a bag of fertilizer and will pay for some people to fumigate her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Vilma Argentina

texts.es:
La cliente Vilma Argentina P. E. es confeccionista de ropa variada. Con una experiencia de 7 años en la industria de la confección, junto a esta actividad vende ropa y cosméticos.

Es casada, madre de una Hija, pero apoya económicamente a su nieta también quien estudia la secundaria.
Este crédito lo solicitó para compra de insumos para la producción de 30 uniformes escolares. Con el dinero prestado compró tela Sincatex, Dacron, Entretela a 90, 60 y 15 Córdobas la yarda respectivamente. Así mismo compró hilo, botones y Zíper para faldas y pantalones, 

Es cliente A de CEPRODEL desde Diciembre del 2005 con un buen record crediticio, se encuentra muy agradecida con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
The client, Vilma Argentina P. E., is a seamstress. She has seven years worth of experience working in this field. She also sells clothing and cosmetics. She is married and has a daughter. She also helps support her granddaughter who is in high school. She is asking for a loan to buy materials to make 30 school uniforms. With the loan money she will buy material from Sincatex, Dacron, and Entretela at 90, 60 and 15 córdobas a yard respectively. She also will buy thread, buttons, and zippers for skirts and pants. She is an A client of CEPRODEL since December 2005 with a good credit record. She is very happy with our institution

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Lelia's Group

texts.en:
Lelia D. is from the village of Talic. Lelia is the leader of a three-member loan group at PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lelia is 56 years old and married. To make a living, Lelia owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She's been engaged in her business for over twelve years.

In 2008, Lelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that she used to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. She requested a second loan of 7000 PHP (her portion of the group loan) to use in the same way. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her store and use as working capital.

loans.name: Ntungamo Tukore Group B, Kihihi

texts.en:
K. Alice is shown at the top left and also in the group photo of her lending group in Kihihi. She is 52 years old and married with eight children. She also takes care of an orphan. Some of them are at the University, while others are in secondary and primary schools.

Alice has a grocery store where she sells mostly fruit and vegetables and, although she is faced with price fluctuations and poor seasons, she is in a better position to take care of her family.
