She ensures that she has attractive produce on display and this has helped her increase her profitability. She ensures that her family is happy and together.

Alice will need a loan to be able to increase her stock for business expansion.

loans.use: To increase her stock for business expansion

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem S., age 30, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business of selling vegetables at a local market in the town, earning an income of $2.80 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband operates his motorbike as a driver, earning an income of $8 per day. Their standard of living has improved since S. and her husband have had these businesses. S. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband because the old motorbike is old and consumes more gasoline. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Leonardo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo Antonio C. es soltero tiene un hijo menor vive en la florida del restaurante la terraza 1c al norte ½ c. abajo de profesión, contador público, actualmente trabaja como auxiliar de contabilidad en la Alcaldía de Chinandega.
  El señor Leonardo Antonio C. ha tenido tres créditos de los cuales ha cancelado dos crédito demostrando ser una persona responsable, el señor C. solicito el Crédito para ayudar a su mama en gastos personales.
texts.en:
Leonardo Antonio C. is single and has a minor son. He lives in La Florida, one block north and ½-block below La Terraza restaurant. He is a public accountant employed as an accounting assistant for the city of Chinandega. He has had three previous loans that he has repaid in a timely fashion. He requested funds to help his mother with some personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help his mother pay for some personal expenses.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité “Renacer”tiene  mas de 3 años de formación, la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero hay nuevas integrantes que emprenderán actividades productivas para ayudar a sus familias.
Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta de frutas y verduras , venta de comestibles artesanales como empanadas de carne ,empanadas de pollo ,empanadas de jamón y queso, y otros.
Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.   
La venta de ropas es una actividad muy practicada por muchas mujeres y entre ella se incluye la señora Olga quien también se dedica a dicha actividad. Ella ofrece sus ropas en un salón frente a su casa.
Ella nos comenta que hay días en tiene buena venta y otros en las que no tiene, además quiere renovar sus mercadeáis ya que se acerca la temporada fría y los tipos de ropas que se compra cambian.
Actualmente encontró una oferta muy buena de un lote de pantalones de Jeans  a muy buen precio para concretar la venta solicita el prétamos.
texts.en:
The group "Renacer" was formed more than 3 years ago. The majority of its members already have productive businesses, but there are new members who will start up new businesses to help their families. They have a variety of types of businesses, including: the sale of fruit and vegetables, the sale of handmade foods such as meat empanadas, chicken empanadas, ham and cheese empanadas, and other items. They yearn for a better future for their children, and toward this end they redouble their efforts to provide the materials for their training and development. Many of the women in the group sell clothing. Among them is Olga, who also works in this occupation. She offers her clothing in a room at the front of her house. She tells us that there are days when sales are good, and others when sales are low. Also, she wants to renew her merchandise, since the cold season approaches and the type of clothing that people buy will change. Today she has found a very good offer to buy a large quantity of jeans at a very good price. In order to carry out this purchase she requests a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy jeans

loans.name: Jorge Luís

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Jorge Luís G. le esta haciendo falta el piso de enfrente de la vivienda. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar el piso y que no cuenta con el dinero necesario.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como policía escolar de la ciudad. Con el vive su hermana la señora Maria Elizabeth G. quien le ayuda con los gastos familiares. Desea que su casa este en mejores condiciones.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Maria Elizabeth G., hermana del señor Jorge Luía G., ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo el día que la visita.
texts.en:
The home of Sr. Jorge Luís G. is lacking a floor at the front of his house. He is requesting a loan to buy the materials and pay a contractor to lay down the floor since he does not have the necessary funds. Sr. Jorge plans to repay the loan using the salary he earns working as a school police officer for the city. His sister, Sra. Maria Elizabeth G., lives with him and helps with the family expenses. He wants his home to have better conditions.

The person who appears in the photo is Sra. Maria Elizabeth G., the sister of Sr. Jorge Luís G., since he was already at work on the day of this visit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & pay a contractor to lay down a concrete floor

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Pablo Emilio A. M., tienen 24 años es soltero, agricultor, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, en este lugar existen varios productores de diferentes  siembras, él  a su corta edad es muy trabajador y apoya económicamente a su familia, dentro de los problemas que más lo ha agobiado es la escases de agua potable que no abastece a la zona en donde habita, el proviene de una familia muy humilde, que con mucho esfuerzo logro culminar sus estudios secundarios.

Cosecha piña, y tiene una experiencia de 10 años en este rubro y fue gracias a la reforma agraria y el apoyo de sus padres que comenzaron sus días de agricultor, solicita un préstamo para la inversión en la compra de materiales agrícolas que mejoren y salvaguarden el crecimiento de la producción para nuevos cultivos que favorezcan las ventas y los ingresos del Sr. A.. Tras esto mejoraran sus condiciones de vida y obtener los recursos económicos para compra un terreno y edificar su viviendo con el propósito de formar familia pronto.
texts.en:
Señor Pablo Emilio A. M. is 24 years old and is single. He is a farmer and lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. In this area there are several farmers who produce a variety of crops. At his young age, he is very hardworking and supports his family economically. Among the problems that have most oppressed him is the lack of potable water, which is not supplied in the zone where he lives. He comes from a very humble family, and with much effort he succeeded in completing his secondary studies. He harvests pineapple and has ten years of experience in this type of work. It was thanks to the agrarian reform and the support of his parents that he began his days as a farmer. He is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of agricultural materials that will improve and protect the growth of new crops that will help his sales and income. Through this his living conditions will improve and he will obtain the resources necessary to buy a plot of land and build a home with the intention of forming a family soon.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy agricultural materials to provide appropriate care for his crops

loans.name: Elisban

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Santiago del la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es El Sr. Elisban; él tiene 25 años de edad, El socio es soltero y se dedica a la compra al por mayor de libros, obras literarias, colecciones de libros y almanaques, afiches y otros. Nuestro socio trabaja vendiendo libros en la feria Túpac Amaru, el socio junto a otros compañeros de banco son jóvenes trabajadores y muy responsables, Nuestro socio en particular solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de sus proveedores.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Elisban belongs to the communal bank, “Lideres del Tercer Milenio,” Leaders of the Third Millennium. He lives in the Santiago district in the Cusco province and department. Elisban is 25 years old and single. He works as a purchaser of books, literary works, book collections, almanacs, and posters, among other things. He sells books in the Tupac Amaru market. Elisban along with fellow bank members are hardworking, responsible young people. He is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise from his suppliers. This member values and is infinitely grateful for the loan since it allows him to grow his business and improve his quality of life. Moreover, he is committed to making his payments in the stipulated time period.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise from suppliers

loans.name: Cheick Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheick Oumar O. est un homme marié de39 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit dans une famille nucléaire, avec sa femme et ses enfants à Bougouni dans le quartier Torakabougou.
Après des études secondaires il a obtenu un diplôme en comptabilité, mais est resté très longtemps sans avoir un emploi. Alors Cheick Oumar s’oriente vers les activités génératrices de revenus et cela depuis maintenant 15 ans. Il mène des activités d’achats et de ventes d’articles divers  tels les tissus pour chemises, pantalons, des  parfums etc.
Monsieur Cheick Oumar O. maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité.
Vu la faiblesse de son fond de roulement, il décide rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso afin d’acheter des articles de fête, des tissus pour ‘pantalons et chemises’  et des parfums.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali), à Lomé et au Burkina Faso. Sa  clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Les fêtes religieuses et les grandes cérémonies (baptême, mariages) sont les périodes où les ventes de ses articles sont intenses.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheick Oumar O. is 39 years old and a father of 3. He lives with his wife and children in the Torakabougou neighbourhood.
After high school he received a diploma in accounting, but he remained unemployed for some time. So Cheick Oumar turned his efforts to income-generating activities and has done so for 15 years now. He buys and sells various items, including cloth to make shirts and pants, perfumes, etc. He stocks up in Bamako (the capital of Mali), Lomé and Burkina Faso. He has both male and female customers. During religious festivals and ceremonies (baptism, marriage) his sales are at their highest.
With this loan, he hopes to make a monthly profit of 65,000 XOF.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth, perfume and other items

loans.name: Wandum

texts.en:
Born in 1986, Wandum M. is a single mother of two children. She has been very hardworking from the day she joined GHAPE. She explained how good it is for a woman to work for herself and to care for the children. Her desire is to work for her children’s education and to pay for their apprenticeships. She joined GHAPE in 2007 as she was unable to get investment capital which would enable her to increase her income to meet her family's needs. Since then, she has successfully received and repaid two loans.

With this third loan she plans to buy five tons of corn, two tons of beans and to pay workers who will work in her farm. This investment will help her community as she will retail her goods to the public.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy corn, seedlings and to pay laborers

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married lady with two children: Pauline, 6, and Samson, 8.  She owns and operates Judy grocery shop with two employees.  She has engaged in the business for three years.  

She is a member of Granary group in Faulu Kenya.  Since she joined the group, she has learned how to keep business records.  The group has guaranteed her loan of 50,000 KES.  

She will use the money to buy bags for packing coconuts and add to her stock of coconuts.  She hopes to expand her business and employ more people.

loans.use: To add stock of coconuts and bags for packing coconuts

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Lalita D.. She is married and has two children, ages 10 and 5. In 2007, she established her coral carving business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family. This is her first loan from Patan BPW, which she has used to increase her inventory of coral. In the future, Lalita plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support.

In Nepal, large supermarkets are rare. Instead, most items can be found in the small, densely packed pasals that line the streets of every city and village. Piled high with utensils, paper goods, and anything else one would need, these stores are your one-stop shop in Nepal. Although usually packed into a space no larger than 100 square feet, these stores carry a sizeable and diverse inventory. With the help of a Kiva loan, pasal owners are able to keep inventory up and their customers happy. Competition is fierce, but with extra capital and a bit of creativity, the opportunity for profit is there.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To increase coral inventory for carving

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter O. is a 39 year old gentleman who is married to a primary school teacher by the name of Eunice Oluoch. He buys and sells shoes at a profit in Migori town. He has been in this business for 13 years and he is able to make a profit of about KES 800 per day.

Peter is accessing his first loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use this money to buy more stock of shoes, which he will sell later at a profit.

Peter’s future dream is to buy a plot of land and build his own home.

loans.use: To buy more shoes inventory for resale.

loans.name: Kaneez Muhammad Arif's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez M. A. is a resident of Vehari, a small city famous for its agriculture industry located in Punjab, Pakistan. Kaneez is a very talented lady who handles her house and embroiders clothes for her business in perfect order. She always gets up early in the morning, offers up her prayer and then prepares breakfast for her family and gets them ready for work. Then she cleans the house, and after that she starts making embroidered clothes. By doing embroidery work she makes money for her family. She is excellent in her art and receives regular orders.

Kaneez’s husband is involved with livestock. He purchases animals at wholesale, then raises and sells them to his customers to earn a profit.

Kaneez has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy young goats and sheep to raise for resale. Kaneez is hopeful that the decision to investment in her husband’s business will result in good profits and that her family’s financial condition will get better as a result.

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Kaneez.

loans.use: To buy young goats and sheep to raise for resale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, D. 57 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hugo D. 57 años y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. El negocio al que Rosa se dedica, es la venta D. cuyes, gallinas y patos, a los cuales tiene bien alimentados y cuidados. Su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma, donD. tiene muchos clientes y el dinero que obtiene D. sus ventas es muy bueno. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo y los dos se han encargado D. sacar adelante el negocio.  Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es alimentar a sus animales, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es tener que permanecer en su puesto todo el día en espera D. clientes. Para el futuro, planea incursionar en el negocio D. la ganadería. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará alimento para sus animales menores, ya que sabe que tiene que tenerlos bien alimentados, si quiere recibir un buen precio por ellos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 57, is a very hard working, cheerful woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Hugo, 57.  What she wants most is to have a peaceful old age.

Rosa’s business is the sale of guinea pigs, chickens and ducks which she keeps well fed and cared for.  Her stand is located in Tarma’s wholesale market.  She has many customers and the money she gets from her sales is very good.  She works alongsiD. her husband and both have seen to the business’ success.  What she enjoys the most about the work is feeding the animals.  She’s been in this line of work for 5 years and considers the most difficult part of it having to stay in her stand all day waiting for customers.  In the future she plans to go into cattle raising.

This is her 8th loan with MFP.  She knows that she must repay on time and is willing to do so.  She is a very cheerful, responsible member of her communal bank.

She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy feed for her small farm animals because she knows that if she keeps them well fed she will get a good sales price for them.

loans.use: To buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Dawa

texts.en:
Dawa J. is currently in the business of selling sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, etc., and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar and cartons of salt to sell.  

Dawa is 30 years old and is married to a businessman. She has six children, and three of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to further expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of sugar and cartons of salt to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. is 59 years old and has two children: Wilson Odari, 22 years old, and Ann, 16 years old. She is married to Fred Kalinga, who is 65 years old. They live in the Chavano area in Vihiga.

Jane has a cereals business that she has been running for the past 8 years. Her monthly income is Kshs 9,900. She is applying for her 4th loan from Kadet Ltd and she has a good credit history with Kadet. His profits will be used to pay school fees for her children and also cater for the family's upkeep.

Her desire is to establish a grain depot to be able to supply grains in large quantities.

loans.use: Buy more cereals to add to her stock.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a widowed lady with three children who are in school. She has been rearing chickens for 12 years. In her business, she employs casual laborers when she has a lot of work in her poultry house. She also sells clothes to supplement her family’s income.  

She joined Faulu Kenya under the Faida Jamii group so as to access loans easily. She has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chicken feed and chicks.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Komsot

texts.en:
Mr. Komsot S., 36, and his wife, Mrs. Kakada Chea, 33, have been married since 1992 and have two daughters. One of them attends school and another one is assisting her parents in the business. The family lives along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Komsot and his wife have been farming for five years. They grow cauliflower on their farmland in the village where they live. Komsot is requesting his first loan of $1,200 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his cauliflower farm and pay for plowing fees.
 
Photo: Mr. Komsot and his wife were at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Delina

texts.en:
Delina B. is a married woman who lives in 112, Brgy. Dancalan, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and buying and selling bananas. Her husband Aquilino, who is 43 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 14 and 23 years old.

Delina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Delina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and the expansion of business. Delina B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Muvo Women's Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
50 year-old S. Alice has been affiliated with Muvo Women's group-Lugazi for the past 12 years. In the course of these years, she has been living from profits from a retailing business which is situated in Mabira-Lugazi. Alice, who previously farmed, says it was her husband's suggestion and support that that set her forth in this business.

Alice sells all types of retail general merchandise that is very popular with the majority of persons around her operating area.  Close friends say Alice is dedicated, hardworking and has always been unwavering in her determination to succeed. 

Alice's optimism about the future success of her business is sky high. She says that beginning to sell wholesale is a prospect she is highly taking into consideration. Weekly, this business generates 120,000 shillings of revenue.

With this loan, Alice, a happily married mother of two children, plans to buy more general merchandise retail stock to resell.

loans.use: To buy more stock.

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than T. is a 41-year-old married man blessed with three children, all of whom are still single.  One of his children is a sewing worker in the garment industry. 

To earn a living, Than T. works as a construction worker in Phnom Penh City. He has a life partner in his wife, who works as a garment worker, earning an income of approximately $3 per day. 

Than T. is building his house, but it is not yet finished because he lacks materials for its construction.  Than T. has  requested a loan to buy extra construction materials to complete his house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for house

loans.name: Maria Leonza

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la fabricación y venta D. hamacas, vive con su esposo y sus hijos María Gloria D. 24 años, Neni D. 20 y Ezequiel D. 6 años D. edad, ellos residen en San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán, el negocio lo realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijas, quienes le ayudan a confeccionar las hamacas  las cuales algunas son encargos y otras las ofrecen en el mercado municipal.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. materiales para mejorar el techo D. su casa, comprando teja y madera, además del pago D. mano D. obra, esta reparación ellos la necesitan realizar ya que el techo no tiene la resistencia para soportar el invierno D. este año.
Con este préstamo espera realizar los trabajos antes mencionados y que poco irá mejorando las condiciones D. esta, también quiere ayudar a sus hijos para que continúen estudiando y puedan optar por un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
María makes hammocks to sell.  She lives with her husband and children, María Gloria, 24, Neni, 20 and Ezequiel, 6, in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department.  Her daughters help her with the business helping her make the hammocks some of which are orders and some are sold at the municipal market.

She is asking for a loan to buy building materials to improve her house’s roof.  She is buying roofing tile and lumber as well as paying for labor costs.  They need to do these repairs because the roof isn’t strong enough to withstand this year’s winter.

With this loan she plans to have the above-mentioned work done which will gradually improve her house.  She also wants to help her children so that they will continue studying in order to be able to opt for a better future.

loans.use: To buy roofing tile and lumber and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Ediza

texts.en:
The beginning does not always determine the end. For Ediza R., 41, a poor educational background will not necessarily end in poverty. Ediza did not even reach high school. She is married to Freddie, a factory worker. They have two children, who are both in elementary school. Their family resides in Binondo, Manila.

To fight off poverty, Ediza set up a sari-sari (variety) store at their home, by which she also helps her fellow community members by providing them with what they need most: basic toiletries and instant food, among other things. She has been running her sari-sari store for five years now. Aside from that, she also repackages garlic and onions and includes them in her sets of products for sale. These enable her to earn 12,000 PHP monthly. 

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to request a 16,000 PHP loan. She knows that sufficient finances on hand will ensure that she will have enough products in her store to meet the various needs of her community. Basically, she plans to buy additional products for her store.

Just like any ordinary sari-sari store owner, it is her struggle to go after customers who do not pay their debts on time. But a strategic microentrepreneur like Ediza finds ways to solve such problems. Ediza is focused on growing her store into a big grocery someday. She desires to prove that her failure in terms of her education will not be experienced by her children, whom she hopes will finish their schooling well.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meetings, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.
	
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase products for her store

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna H. G. de 35 años de edad, estudio la primaria, esta casada con el señor Jesus Robles Cruz quien tiene el oficio de albañil. Tiene una hija de 8 años quien estudia el segundo año de primaria.
Reyna se dedica a la elaboracion de tamales de pollo en mole y cerdo para vender, sus ventas los realiza de casa en casa en su poblacion de Paso de la Reyna. 
Además de la venta de tamalaes se dedica a la compra de pollos para la venta. Los pollos los compra desde pequeños para engordarlos y despues venderlos. Reyna solicito el prestamo para poder comprar los insumos para la elaboracion de tamales como son la hoja de platano, hoja de totomoztle, chile, maiz, entre otros productos, de igual manera para poder comprar mas pollitos para engordar. El sueño de reyna es poder tener una granja mas grande en donde pueda criar mas pollos y despues distribuirlos y vender de mayoreo y menudeo para así obtener mas ganancia para poder mantener a su familia y sobre todo seguir dandole estudios a su hija para que llegue a ser una gran profesionista.
Ella es una persona responsable y trabajadora de la poblacion del Paso de la Reyna.
texts.en:
Ms. Reyna H. G., age 35, completed her elementary education. She is married to Mr. Jesus Robles Cruz, who works as a bricklayer. She has an eight-year-old daughter who is in second grade.

Reyna makes and sells pork and chicken with mole sauce tamales for a living. She sells them from her home in the town of Paso de la Reyna.

In addition to selling tamales, she also buys and sells chickens. She buys them young so that she can fatten them up and sell them. Reyna is requesting this loan in order to purchase the ingredients she needs to make tamales, such as banana leaves, corn husks, chili, corn, and other goods. She also wants to use the loan to purchase more chicks to raise. Reyna's dream is to be able to have a bigger farm in which she can raise more chickens and sell them both wholesale and retail, thus obtaining bigger profits so that she can support her family and provide her daughter with an education so that she can one day become a professional.

She is a responsible and hardworking person in the town of Paso de la Reyna.

loans.use: Purchase chicks and ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has run an electronics repair business for the past seven years. He started by repairing items as a vendor and then later opened his own workshop. He faces the challenge of customers not picking up their items after he has repaired them. In future, he wants to have at least four business outlets. He wants to take out this loan in order to buy reconditioned items like TVs, radios, and spare parts. 

Patrick and his wife have two children. The family lives in their own semi-permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. Patrick's goal is to build a permanent family house.

loans.use: to buy reconditioned items like TVs, radios, and spare parts

loans.name: Todjikhon

texts.en:
Todjikhon is married and a loving mother of three children. She produces and sells bakery products. She started her own business with a small production and then she brought her family in to her business. Today, Todjikhon works with her family together in this business. She has been in this business for 12 years. She produces her baked goods at home in a special place.

Todjikhon would like to get a loan of 7,500 Somoni to purchase a large quantity of flour to expand the assortment of her products.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Erdenedelger

texts.en: Erdenedelger is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Kherlen province, one of Mongolia's largest provinces. She and her family live in a caravan on their land. Her three children all attend a local secondary school. Erdenedelger operates a fruit and vegetable retail business. She purchases fruit and vegetables from the Narantuul and Bars markets, the two largest markets in Ulaanbaatar, and sells them to people for a profit. Her business is doing very well. Erdenedelger has good communication skills and her business is very important to her. She has many plans for the future, and says, “My aim is to create my own shop by working hard and stabilizing my current business.” She is applying for a loan for 900,000 MNT to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesales prices to resell to her many customers.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesales prices to resell

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida belongs to Arifwala which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its dairy industry.  She has been living there in the small colony named Fazal colony in a 3-room brick house with her family for the past 12 years. She is a housewife and takes care of her household responsibilities by staying at home. 

Her husband's name is Z. H. and he operates a Punjabi food restaurant business in the market. He offers good quality food items to his clients. In the restaurant, he sells "Daal roti" (made with lentils and served with bread), "Nan chanay" (made with chick peas and served with bread), etc. He has a good name in the area for his good quality food. 

Rashida is the mother of two sons and both of them work. Her elder son sells vegetables in a vegetable market while younger one does a private job. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. Through the loan, he will buy required items like lentils, cooking oil, chick peas, flour and spices, etc. which will allow him to provide better quality of food to his clients and earn better profits. 

He started this business 12 years ago and Rashida is hopeful that after an investment, it will start bringing him better profits. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rashida.

loans.use: To buy required items for Punjabi food restaurant business.

loans.name: Constantino Carlos

texts.pt:
Costantino Carlos nasceu no Distrito da Manhiça, Provincia de Maputo sul de Moçambique casado e pai de 2 filhos de 2 e 9 anos de idade, cujo o mais velho vai a Escola. Vive na casa proppria com a sua familia e naõ se responsabiliza por mais ninguem.

Saiu de Manhiça para Maputo em Boane aprocura de melhores condições de vida. Trabalha como promotor de vendas na empresa Green World ha mais de 5 anos e tem como salario 7.830,00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar alguma parte na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de seus colegas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este e o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000,00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção ( chapas de zinco, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para abrir um centro de cursos de Inglês, francês e informatica.
texts.en:
Costantino Carlos was born in the district of Manhiça, state of south Maputo in Mozambique. He is married, father of two (a 2 years old and a 9 years old). The older son is attending school. They own the house they live in. Constantino isn't responsible for any other minor.

He left Manhiça to the city of Boane in the state of Maputo in search for better living conditions. He works as a salesman at Green World for over 5 years and has a monthly income of 7.830,00mt (182,25€), which he applies in housing expenses and still manages to save some in his bank account.

He never asked for any other loan. He got to know Hluvuku through his colleagues who are also clients of this institution. This is his first loan at Hluvuku, in the amount of 25.000,00mt (582€/830$) with which he plans to buy construction material (zonc plates, cement, sand, stone, and others) to proceed with the building of his house.

He is confident that he will be able to pay the loan before deadline, and then ask for another one to start his own business: a professional school with courses such as English, French and computing skills.

loans.use: buy construction materials (zinc plates, cement, sand, stone and others)

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 32 years old and married to Edward who contributes to the family income. 

Monicah has been running a retail shop for a period of about three years, with an income of approximately 5,000 Kenyan shillings a month.

This is her first loan with KADET which she wants to use to buy sugar, rice and cooking fat to restock her shop. 

She hopes to become a wholesaler and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and cooking fat for her shop.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Mr. Cheng, age 30, is a Tuk Tuk driver who picks up passengers to visit interesting places in and around Siem Reap Province. For his motor service, he can receive a high fee from his customers as he is very skilled. 

For additional family income, Mr. Cheng’s wife sells breakfast food, Khmer noodle, to the neighbors in her community and she also plants crops on her farmland according to the seasons. Their two children still study in school. Mr. Cheng will be using his loan to assist his wife to hire a machine for plowing on the farm so she can begin to plant her crop.

loans.use: to hire a machine for plowing

loans.name: Mzomba

texts.en:
Mzomba is a widowed woman with nine children, three of whom attend school while six graduated from school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a vegetables sale business from home that sells to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a food stall selling business.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase maize flour and build a permanent vegetable stall.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour and build a permanent vegetable stall.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 35 years old and married with 2 children. Leonida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Leonida has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from used clothing. Leonida aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her store
